original: dkar po ni ser po nyid kyis rtogs pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: dkar po ni ser po nyid kyis rtogs pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: White is not understood by yellow.

original: rang gi ngo bo de la ma rig ste /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo de la ma rig ste /
translated: It is not understood by itself.

original: mngon sum gzung gi 'on kyang gzhan gyi rang bzhin du mngon zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gzung gi 'on kyang gzhan gyi rang bzhin du mngon zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is said that it is understood by another,

original: des na 'khrul ba'i phyir de ji ltar rtogs she na /
analyzed: des na 'khrul ba'i phyir de ji ltar rtogs she na /
translated: then how is it understood, since it is mistaken?üîΩInference is accepted as mistaken because it engages by superimposing an object on its own appearance, which is devoid of object.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni rang gi snang ba don med pa la don du lhag par zhen nas 'jug pa'i phyir na 'khrul bar 'dod pa nyid do zhes lan btab pa ni ji bzhin mngon zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni rang gi snang ba don med pa la don du lhag par zhen nas 'jug pa'i phyir na 'khrul bar 'dod pa nyid do zhes lan btab pa ni ji bzhin mngon zhe na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is: ‚ÄúJust as it appears.‚Äù

original: de kho na nyid ji ltar ba bzhin du mngon bzhin yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de kho na nyid ji ltar ba bzhin du mngon bzhin yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it appears just as it is in reality.

original: phyin ci log tu mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir na /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir na /
translated: Because it has the characteristic of being conceived in a distorted way.

original: mngon sum la ltos pa'i gnyis pa rjes su dpag pa'i rtog pa ni 'khrul pa nyid yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: mngon sum la ltos pa'i gnyis pa rjes su dpag pa'i rtog pa ni 'khrul pa nyid yin par 'dod do //
translated: Inference, which is the second conception that relies on direct perception, is accepted as mistaken.

original: ci ltar don de zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa ste /
analyzed: ci ltar don de zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa ste /
translated: How is that object?

original: yul dang dus dang rnam pa nges pa'i don de'o //
analyzed: yul dang dus dang rnam pa nges pa'i don de'o //
translated: That is the meaning of the determination of place, time, and aspect.

original: dus la sogs pa nges pa nyid bshad pa ni /
analyzed: dus la sogs pa nges pa nyid bshad pa ni /
translated: The determination of time, etc. is explained:

original: da ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: da ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNow‚Äù and so on.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni dus nges pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni dus nges pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù refers to the determination of time.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni yul nges pa'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni yul nges pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù refers to the determination of place.

original: rgyu'i dbye bas tha dad pas zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin du mngon pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i dbye bas tha dad pas zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin du mngon pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy the difference of cause‚Äù refers to the determination of aspect.

original: gal te de'i rang bzhin du mngon par zhen pa med na /
analyzed: gal te de'i rang bzhin du mngon par zhen pa med na /
translated: If there is no adherence to the nature of that,

original: ji ltar de la 'khrul pa yin snyam na /
analyzed: ji ltar de la 'khrul pa yin snyam na /
translated: how can there be error in that?

original: dngos po la ma reg kyang der lhag par zhen pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dngos po la ma reg kyang der lhag par zhen pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because of the adherence to that, even without touching the thing.

original: de la ma reg na ji ltar reg / lhag par zhe na snyam na /
analyzed: de la ma reg na ji ltar reg / lhag par zhe na snyam na /
translated: If there is no touching of that, how can there be touching?

original: sngar mthong ba'i don gyis zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sngar mthong ba'i don gyis zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because of the object seen before.

original: re zhig 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rnam 'grel gyi don ldog pa'i sgo nas brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: re zhig 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rnam 'grel gyi don ldog pa'i sgo nas brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of the PramaÃÑnÔ¨Å avaiÔ¨Åttika, which will be explained later, is stated by way of the negation: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù and so on.

original: mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni skabs kyi don rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni skabs kyi don rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt would not be‚Äù is the meaning of the context.

original: de nyid smras pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa nyid tshad ma ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid smras pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa nyid tshad ma ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat itself is said to be‚Äù is the inference itself that is not a valid cognition.

original: gal te gzhan gyi ngo bos ni rtogs na 'o na de tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi ngo bos ni rtogs na 'o na de tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: If it is understood by way of another nature, then it is not a valid cognition.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'khrul pa zhes gsungs te gzhan rtogs pa na gzhan thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩrjes su @105a * //
analyzed: 'khrul pa zhes gsungs te gzhan rtogs pa na gzhan thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to // rjes su @105a * //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is mistaken‚Äù is stated because when one thing is understood, another is obtained.

original: 'gro ba'i sgo nas 'chad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i sgo nas 'chad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation by way of concomitance is ‚ÄúIf . . .‚Äù

original: gal te yang nga yi rnam pa mthong ba la gzhan gyi ngo bor sgro 'dogs pa yin yang /
analyzed: gal te yang nga yi rnam pa mthong ba la gzhan gyi ngo bor sgro 'dogs pa yin yang /
translated: If it is the case that seeing the aspect of ‚ÄúI‚Äù is the superimposition of another nature,

original: mngon par 'dod pa 'thob pa la ni bsam pa ji ltar ba bzhin mi lus bar byed pas na /
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa 'thob pa la ni bsam pa ji ltar ba bzhin mi lus bar byed pas na /
translated: then in obtaining what is desired, it is as intended and does not fail.

original: tshad ma yin te mngon sum bzhin no zhes brjod pa 'di ni /
analyzed: tshad ma yin te mngon sum bzhin no zhes brjod pa 'di ni /
translated: Therefore it is a valid cognition, like direct perception.

original: lam du zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: lam du zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: This is stated in ‚ÄúThe path . . .‚Äù

original: / gal te ji ltar bsam pa thob pa na /üîΩji ltar gzhan la gzhan gyi rnam pas rtog pa'am /
analyzed: / gal te ji ltar bsam pa thob pa na / ji ltar gzhan la gzhan gyi rnam pas rtog pa'am /
translated: If it is the case that what is intended is obtained,üîΩthen how is it that one thing is conceived by the aspect of another,

original: 'khrul pa nyid yin par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'khrul pa nyid yin par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: or how is it that it is mistaken?

original: rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúAlso in another way‚Äù means that the object is not directly perceived.

original: ji ltar dkar po la ser po'i rang bzhin du 'khrul par rtog pa mthong ba de bzhin don gyi rang bzhin gsal ba yang mi gsal ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: ji ltar dkar po la ser po'i rang bzhin du 'khrul par rtog pa mthong ba de bzhin don gyi rang bzhin gsal ba yang mi gsal ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i phyir 'gal ba med do //
translated: Just as one sees the idea that a white object is of the nature of yellow, so the nature of the object, which is clear, is conceived in an unclear form.

original: yang na gal te rjes su dpag pa don gyi rang bzhin la ma reg pas 'khrul pa yin na ji ltar don la 'jug par byed pa yin snyam na /
analyzed: yang na gal te rjes su dpag pa don gyi rang bzhin la ma reg pas 'khrul pa yin na ji ltar don la 'jug par byed pa yin snyam na /
translated: Again, if inference is mistaken because it does not touch the nature of the object, how can it engage the object?

original: rnam gzhan gyis kyang zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam gzhan gyis kyang zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAlso in another way‚Äù means that it engages the object in another way.

original: rtog pa ni 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: rtog pa ni 'jug pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIdea‚Äù means engagement.

original: sbyor bar byed pa yin la /
analyzed: sbyor bar byed pa yin la /
translated: It is the engagement that causes the object to be engaged.

original: de ni dngos po la reg pa med par yang mthong ste /
analyzed: de ni dngos po la reg pa med par yang mthong ste /
translated: And that is seen to occur even without touching the object.

original: dper na lha sbyin mchod sbyin du rlom pa las 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na lha sbyin mchod sbyin du rlom pa las 'jug pa yin no //
translated: For example, Devadatta is engaged in sacrifice, although he does not touch the sacrifice.

original: yang na rjes su dpag pa'i rang bzhin las 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: yang na rjes su dpag pa'i rang bzhin las 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Or, not only is inference mistaken because it does not touch the object,

original: rtog pa'ang rnam pa gzhan du mthong ste /
analyzed: rtog pa'ang rnam pa gzhan du mthong ste /
translated: but also the idea is seen in another way.

original: rtogs pa ni mngon sum la bya'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa ni mngon sum la bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIdea‚Äù means direct perception.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba 'thob par bya ba'i dngos po la ma reg kyang tshad ma nyid yin par mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba 'thob par bya ba'i dngos po la ma reg kyang tshad ma nyid yin par mthong ngo //
translated: Otherwise, means that even without touching the object to be attained, it is seen as valid cognition.

original: gal te ji ltar bsam pa thob pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar bsam pa thob pa yin na /
translated: If it is as it is conceived,

original: thob par bya ba nyid snang ba yin no zhes ji ltar rtogs par mi byed snyam na /
analyzed: thob par bya ba nyid snang ba yin no zhes ji ltar rtogs par mi byed snyam na /
translated: why is it not understood that what is to be attained appears?

original: phyogs 'di la zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: phyogs 'di la zhes gsungs so //
translated: In response, In this case is stated.

original: ji bzhin mngon zhen min pa'i phyir //
analyzed: ji bzhin mngon zhen min pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is not just as it is conceived,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa dngos por 'dzin pa ni bkag zin to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa dngos por 'dzin pa ni bkag zin to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and so on. The conception of things has already been refuted. This is the meaning.

original: gal te rjes su dpag pa'i rtog pa don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin par lhag par zhen pa ji ltar yin te /
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pa'i rtog pa don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin par lhag par zhen pa ji ltar yin te /
translated: If the conception of inference is not just as it is, how is there excessive attachment?

original: mngon sum bzhin du mi lus ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa ni bzhin du zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mngon sum bzhin du mi lus ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa ni bzhin du zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because it is not like direct perception, there is no fault. This is the doubt. Just as is stated.

original: mngon sum la yang ngo de ni bsam pa la slu ba med pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum la yang ngo de ni bsam pa la slu ba med pa'o //
translated: In direct perception too, there is no deception in intention.

original: 'di la yang rjes su dpag pa la'o //
analyzed: 'di la yang rjes su dpag pa la'o //
translated: Here too, in inference.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni don ci lta ba bzhin zhe na zhe na pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni don ci lta ba bzhin zhe na zhe na pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Inference is just as the object is, i.e., it is just as the object is.

original: 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan no //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan no //
translated: The reply to that is ‚ÄúThis . . .‚Äù and so on.

original: tha snyad pa dag la ni mngon sum bzhin du rjes su dpag pa don ci lta ba bzhin mngon par zhen pa nyid do //
analyzed: tha snyad pa dag la ni mngon sum bzhin du rjes su dpag pa don ci lta ba bzhin mngon par zhen pa nyid do //
translated: For those who are conventional, inference is just as the object is, just like perception, i.e., it is just as the object is.

original: 'o na ji ltar rjes su dpag pa don ji bzhin ma yin pa rtogs par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar rjes su dpag pa don ji bzhin ma yin pa rtogs par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Well, then, how can there be an understanding of inference that is not just as the object is?

original: 'di ni 'chad par byed pa rnams kyis zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni 'chad par byed pa rnams kyis zhes gsungs so //
translated: The reply is ‚ÄúThis is explained by the commentators.‚Äù

original: rjes su dpag pa'i rtogs @105b pa ni don ci lta ba bzhin du ma yin par mngon par zhen pas 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rtogs pa ni 'chad par byed pa rnam pa nyid yin gyi tha snyad byed pa rnams kyi ni ma yin no zhes
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i rtogs @105b pa ni don ci lta ba bzhin du ma yin par mngon par zhen pas 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rtogs pa ni 'chad par byed pa rnam pa nyid yin gyi tha snyad byed pa rnams kyi ni ma yin no zhes
translated: The understanding of inference is mistaken because it is conceived to be just as the object is. The understanding of this is explained by the commentators, not by those who use conventional expressions.

original: bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: gal te rjes su dpag pa la bdag gis me thob par bya'o snyam pa'i bsam pa ji ltar yod de rang gi rnam pa tsam mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pa la bdag gis me thob par bya'o snyam pa'i bsam pa ji ltar yod de rang gi rnam pa tsam mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If one infers, how can one have the thought, ‚ÄúI will obtain fire‚Äù? Because one sees only its form.

original: de na bsam pa med pa'i phyir na de la bsam pa la mi slu ba yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de na bsam pa med pa'i phyir na de la bsam pa la mi slu ba yod pa yin no //
translated: Since there is no thought there, there is nondeception with respect to thought.

original: des na 'di ni de la yang yod pa'i phyir ro zhes ji ltar brjod snyam du dogs pa ni /
analyzed: des na 'di ni de la yang yod pa'i phyir ro zhes ji ltar brjod snyam du dogs pa ni /
translated: Therefore, how can one say that it exists there, since it exists there?

original: gzhan mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this is ‚Äúbecause of seeing something else.‚Äù

original: bum pa mthong ba ni snam bu la bsam pa 'byung ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bum pa mthong ba ni snam bu la bsam pa 'byung ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: The one who sees the pot does not have the thought of the cloth.

original: tha snyad byed pa po'i skye bo la ltos nas bsam pa la mi slu ba yin na ji ltar de las so sor nges pa'i don las don no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha snyad byed pa po'i skye bo la ltos nas bsam pa la mi slu ba yin na ji ltar de las so sor nges pa'i don las don no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is nondeceptive with respect to thought in reliance on the person who uses conventions, how can it be a means of knowledge with respect to a specific object?

original: de kho na la rigs pa la ltos nas ni 'khrul ba yin la gzhan la ltos nas ni bsam pa la mi slu ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de kho na la rigs pa la ltos nas ni 'khrul ba yin la gzhan la ltos nas ni bsam pa la mi slu ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is deceptive in reliance on reality, but it is nondeceptive with respect to thought in reliance on something else.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba gzhan mthong ba na yang gzhan la bsam pa byed pa nyid na'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba gzhan mthong ba na yang gzhan la bsam pa byed pa nyid na'o //
translated: When one sees this and also that, one is thinking of something else.üîΩIf conceptual thought is not ascertained with regard to the object, how can it engage in the object in a determinate manner?

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa don la nges pa ma yin na ni ji ltar de las so sor nges pa'i don la 'jug snyam du dogs pa sel bas /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa don la nges pa ma yin na ni ji ltar de las so sor nges pa'i don la 'jug snyam du dogs pa sel bas /
translated: In order to dispel this doubt, he says:

original: rnam gzhan gyis kyang rtogs pa mthong //
analyzed: rnam gzhan gyis kyang rtogs pa mthong //
translated: One sees that one understands by other means as well.

original: zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel pa ni /
translated: The commentary on this is:

original: des na zhes bya ba ste bag chags pa 'thus so //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ste bag chags pa 'thus so //
translated: Therefore, i.e., because of the possibility of error, one should not dispute.

original: gang gi de kho na nyid dngos po'i rang bzhin yongs su ma dpyad pa'i rjes su dpag pa la ste /
analyzed: gang gi de kho na nyid dngos po'i rang bzhin yongs su ma dpyad pa'i rjes su dpag pa la ste /
translated: One should not dispute with regard to the nature of things, the reality of which is not analyzed, i.e., is assumed.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin de la'o//
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin de la'o//
translated: One should not dispute with regard to the nature of things, the reality of which is analyzed.

original: ci'i phyir 'di brtsad par bya ba ma yin snyam na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di brtsad par bya ba ma yin snyam na /
translated: Why should one not dispute?

original: mthong ba la ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mthong ba la ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says: With regard to what is seen, etc.

original: mngon sum yang dngos po'i rang bzhin ma reg pa kho nar rjes su dpag pa bzhin du 'jug par byed pa yin zhes bstan pa'i phyir mngon sum la yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mngon sum yang dngos po'i rang bzhin ma reg pa kho nar rjes su dpag pa bzhin du 'jug par byed pa yin zhes bstan pa'i phyir mngon sum la yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: In order to show that perception also engages its object in the same way that inference does, without touching the intrinsic nature of the object, he says: With regard to perception as well.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩde yang zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / de yang zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: Why?

original: sgrub par byed pa'i mngon sum la yang ngo /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i mngon sum la yang ngo /
translated: It also refers to the direct perception that is the means of valid cognition.

original: ji ltar zhe na nye bar gnas pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na nye bar gnas pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: How so? It says, ‚Äúthat which is present.‚ÄùüîΩIf it is asked, ‚ÄúWhy is that?‚Äù

original: nyes na zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: nyes na zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir na /
translated: It says, ‚ÄúBecause inference is conceptual.‚Äù

original: thob par bya ba 'byung bar 'gyur la reg pa yod pas 'jug par byed par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: thob par bya ba 'byung bar 'gyur la reg pa yod pas 'jug par byed par 'gyur gyi /
translated: It is said that the object to be obtained arises, and contact exists, so it is engaged.

original: mngon sum ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not direct perception.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nye bar gnas pa tsam ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: nye bar gnas pa tsam ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: It says, ‚ÄúBecause mere presence . . .‚Äù

original: 'jug pa ni 'thob pa'i don du yin na de la yang byung zin pa zhugs pas ci bya /
analyzed: 'jug pa ni 'thob pa'i don du yin na de la yang byung zin pa zhugs pas ci bya /
translated: If engagement is for the sake of obtaining, then what is the use of engaging in that which has already arisen?

original: der yang zhes bya ba ni mngon sum la yang ngo //
analyzed: der yang zhes bya ba ni mngon sum la yang ngo //
translated: Also refers to direct perception.

original: de dang zhes bya ba ni da ltar 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang ngo //
analyzed: de dang zhes bya ba ni da ltar 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang ngo //
translated: That refers to the present.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni gcig tu lhan cig lhag par zhen pas na'i //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni gcig tu lhan cig lhag par zhen pas na'i //
translated: Therefore refers to the single simultaneous superimposition.

original: de lta bu'i de zhes bya ba ni mngon sum bzhin @106a * //
analyzed: de lta bu'i de zhes bya ba ni mngon sum bzhin @106a * //
translated: Such a so-called is just like perception.

original: nyid do // mtshungs pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa mngon sum dang ngo //
analyzed: nyid do // mtshungs pa nyid du zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa mngon sum dang ngo //
translated: Sameness means that inference is like perception.

original: mtshungs pa nyid mi 'thad par dogs pa bsu ba ni 'on kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mtshungs pa nyid mi 'thad par dogs pa bsu ba ni 'on kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The doubt that is anticipated is ‚ÄúBut . . . ‚Äù

original: mngon sum ni gcig tu lhag par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa skyed pa'i sgo nas 'jug par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: mngon sum ni gcig tu lhag par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa skyed pa'i sgo nas 'jug par byed pa yin la /
translated: Perception operates by way of generating a conception that is a single, special mode of apprehension.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Inference does not operate in that way.

original: rjes su dpag pa la yang de'i 'og tu 'byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gcig nyid du lhag par zhen pa las 'jug par byed pa yin te /üîΩmngon sum dang 'dra bar yin no zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la yang de'i 'og tu 'byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa gcig nyid du lhag par zhen pa las 'jug par byed pa yin te / mngon sum dang 'dra bar yin no zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
translated: Inference also operates from the conception of a single mode of apprehension that occurs later.üîΩIt is like perception.

original: de ni mi rigs te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúThat is not correct. . . . ‚Äù

original: gang gis de yang 'jug par byed pa nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: gang gis de yang 'jug par byed pa nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: By what is it that it also comes to operate as a mode of apprehension?

original: rjes su dpag pas nye bar gnas //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas nye bar gnas //
translated: It is present as an inference.

original: bzung ba na ni rnam par rtog pa gzhan lhag par 'byung ba nyid du gdon mi za ba yin no //
analyzed: bzung ba na ni rnam par rtog pa gzhan lhag par 'byung ba nyid du gdon mi za ba yin no //
translated: If it were apprehended, then it is certain that another conceptualization would arise.

original: rnam par rtog pa gzhan gyis kyang 'jug par byed pa nyid ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gzhan gyis kyang 'jug par byed pa nyid ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: How could it be that another conceptualization would cause engagement?

original: rnam rtog gzhan ni gnas par 'gyur //
analyzed: rnam rtog gzhan ni gnas par 'gyur //
translated: Another conceptualization would remain.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: This is what is stated.

original: des na de'i sgo nas de yang 'jug par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na de'i sgo nas de yang 'jug par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning is that it causes engagement through that.

original: 'di ltar rjes su dpag pas nye bar gnas pas 'dzin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar rjes su dpag pas nye bar gnas pas 'dzin zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúHow does it remain through inference?‚Äù

original: rang gi ngo bos bzung ba'i phyir zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos bzung ba'i phyir zhes sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause it is apprehended by its own nature‚Äù is supplied.

original: rnam par 'grel par ni gsal bar zhes bya ba rang gi ngo bo'i khyad par du byas pa'i yul rung ba gnas par mi shes pa //
analyzed: rnam par 'grel par ni gsal bar zhes bya ba rang gi ngo bo'i khyad par du byas pa'i yul rung ba gnas par mi shes pa //
translated: In the commentary, the phrase ‚Äúclearly‚Äù is supplied as a qualification of its own nature.

original: rang nyid shes phyir de shes yin //
analyzed: rang nyid shes phyir de shes yin //
translated: The meaning of the phrase ‚Äúbecause it is known by itself‚Äù is that it is known.

original: zhes bstan par bya ba'i don 'du ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bstan par bya ba'i don 'du ba yin no //
translated: This is the meaning of the phrase ‚Äúthat which is to be demonstrated.‚Äù

original: der yang ni rjes su dpag pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: der yang ni rjes su dpag pa la yang ngo //
translated: Also, in that case, it is inference.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa tha dad pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa tha dad pa med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOr‚Äù indicates the absence of a different conception.

original: de lta na 'o na de tshad ma yin no zhe na dngos po la rig pa med pa nyid ces smras so //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na de tshad ma yin no zhe na dngos po la rig pa med pa nyid ces smras so //
translated: If that is so, then it is valid cognition. He says, ‚ÄúThere is no awareness of an entity.‚Äù

original: 'o na mngon sum yang tshang mar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na mngon sum yang tshang mar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Well then, direct perception would not be valid cognition.

original: mngon sum zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: mngon sum zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúDirect perception.‚Äù

original: dngos po la reg pa ni tshad mar 'gyur ba'i rgyu mtshan ma yin no zhes lan 'debs pa ni de yang rung ba ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po la reg pa ni tshad mar 'gyur ba'i rgyu mtshan ma yin no zhes lan 'debs pa ni de yang rung ba ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is, ‚ÄúContact with an entity is not the reason for being valid cognition.‚Äù He says, ‚ÄúThat is also not correct.‚Äù

original: zhen pa mngon sum la yod yin //
analyzed: zhen pa mngon sum la yod yin //
translated: ‚ÄúAttachment exists in direct perception.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is nonconceptual.

original: 'o na rang bzhin de nyid ces bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 'o na rang bzhin de nyid ces bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa med pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúWell then, that very nature‚Äù is the nature of nonconceptuality.

original: rnam par rtog pa la yang 'jug par byed pa nyid med pa'i phyir na ji ltar de'i sgo nas mngon sum 'jug par byed pa yin zhes bya ba lan 'debs pa ni ;
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la yang 'jug par byed pa nyid med pa'i phyir na ji ltar de'i sgo nas mngon sum 'jug par byed pa yin zhes bya ba lan 'debs pa ni ;
translated: Since it does not engage in conceptuality, how can it engage in direct perception? The response is,

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ste 'jug par byed pa gang gis so //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ste 'jug par byed pa gang gis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy what‚Äù means by what engages.

original: 'on te 'jug par byed pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa skyed par byed pa nyid kyis 'jug par byed pa yin no zhe na de ni mi rigs te ci'i phyir zhe na de rang nyid ces gsungs so //
analyzed: 'on te 'jug par byed pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa skyed par byed pa nyid kyis 'jug par byed pa yin no zhe na de ni mi rigs te ci'i phyir zhe na de rang nyid ces gsungs so //
translated: But if it is the very production of the conception that is the engagement, that is illogical. Why? He says, ‚Äúit itself.‚Äù

original: 'di snyam du rang nyid mi 'jug par byed pa ma yin pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'di snyam du rang nyid mi 'jug par byed pa ma yin pa nyid yin la /
translated: One might think that it itself is not the engagement,

original: 'jug par byed pa'i rnam par @106b rtog pa bskyed pa'i sgo kho nas 'jug par byed pa yin no zhes dogs par byed pa ni gal te rnam rtog ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa'i rnam par @106b rtog pa bskyed pa'i sgo kho nas 'jug par byed pa yin no zhes dogs par byed pa ni gal te rnam rtog ces bya ba'o //
translated: but it is the engagement only by the door of producing the conception that engages.

original: lan ni / dngos 'dzin min par 'jug byed du //üîΩji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: lan ni / dngos 'dzin min par 'jug byed du // ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: The response is: How could it be the engagement without apprehending an entity?

original: mi 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: How could it be? It could not!

original: rnam par rtog pa dngos po 'dzin pa ma yin yang 'jug byed yin na ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dngos po 'dzin pa ma yin yang 'jug byed yin na ni /
translated: If the conception were the engagement even though it does not apprehend an entity,

original: rjes su dpag pa yang der 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang der 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: then inference would also be that.

original: de ltar yin yang zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar yin yang zhes bya ste /
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúEven though that is so.‚Äù

original: dngos po 'dzin pa ma yin yang gal te rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa ste yin na /
analyzed: dngos po 'dzin pa ma yin yang gal te rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa ste yin na /
translated: Even though it does not apprehend things, if it is the case that conceptualization is engaged,

original: de'i tshe rjes su dpag pa la yang 'jug par byed pa 'di cis mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de'i tshe rjes su dpag pa la yang 'jug par byed pa 'di cis mi 'dod de /
translated: then why not accept that inference is also engaged?

original: 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod par bya'o //
translated: It must be accepted.

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa'i 'jug par byed pa nyid ni tshad ma'i rgyu mtshan du mi 'dod pa kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa'i 'jug par byed pa nyid ni tshad ma'i rgyu mtshan du mi 'dod pa kho na ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it just the engagement of conceptualization that is not accepted as the reason for valid knowledge?

original: des na rjes su dpag pa yang de 'dod par bya ba'o zhes ci ste brjod na /
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pa yang de 'dod par bya ba'o zhes ci ste brjod na /
translated: So why is it said that inference must be accepted?

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa nyid bskyed pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa nyid bskyed pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is said that it is in virtue of generating conceptualization,

original: rnam par rtog pa tshad mar mi 'dod nas mngon sum de skyed pa'i sgo nas tshad ma ma yin pa ni tshad mar ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa tshad mar mi 'dod nas mngon sum de skyed pa'i sgo nas tshad ma ma yin pa ni tshad mar ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: then if conceptualization is not accepted as valid knowledge, how could that which generates it be valid knowledge?

original: rang nyid tshad ma ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa skyed pa'i sgo nas tshad mar 'gyur ro zhes mi rigs so //
analyzed: rang nyid tshad ma ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa skyed pa'i sgo nas tshad mar 'gyur ro zhes mi rigs so //
translated: It is not reasonable to say that it is valid knowledge in virtue of generating conceptualization that is not itself valid knowledge.

original: de'i phyir mngon sum par rtog pa skyed pa'i sgo nas 'jug par byed pa nyid du 'dod na /
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon sum par rtog pa skyed pa'i sgo nas 'jug par byed pa nyid du 'dod na /
translated: Therefore, if you maintain that it engages by generating a conception of direct perception,

original: de la yang de 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la yang de 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: then you must also maintain that it is direct perception.üîΩIf that is so,üîΩthen you are accepting that it engages by way of conception.

original: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog par 'jug par byed pa nyid du khas len pa yin na'o //
analyzed: de lta yin na zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog par 'jug par byed pa nyid du khas len pa yin na'o //
translated: Inference is like that,

original: rjes su dpag pa ni zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
translated: is a response to a doubt.

original: 'o na zhes bya ba ni lan te /
analyzed: 'o na zhes bya ba ni lan te /
translated: Well,

original: rnam par rtog pa ji ltar tshad ma yin zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ji ltar tshad ma yin zhes 'brel to //
translated: how can conception be valid cognition?

original: gzhan gyis der zhes smras te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis der zhes smras te /
translated: Another says that,

original: mngon sum dang rnam par rtog pa de gnyis kyi gnas bsam pas mngon sum gyi dngos po 'dzin pa'i phyir des bskyed pa'i rnam par rtog pa tshad ma ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum dang rnam par rtog pa de gnyis kyi gnas bsam pas mngon sum gyi dngos po 'dzin pa'i phyir des bskyed pa'i rnam par rtog pa tshad ma ma yin no zhe na /
translated: since it is a basis of both direct perception and conception, it is a direct perception that apprehends an entity, and therefore the conception generated by that is valid cognition.

original: lan mngon sum gyis dngos po 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes 'grel to //
analyzed: lan mngon sum gyis dngos po 'dzin pa ma yin no zhes 'grel to //
translated: The response is that direct perception does not apprehend an entity.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rnam par rtog pa zhes smos te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa zhes smos te /
translated: It is said, conception.

original: snga ma dang phyi mar gyur pa'i dngos po'i rgyun rnam par brtag par bya ba ste de la'o //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi mar gyur pa'i dngos po'i rgyun rnam par brtag par bya ba ste de la'o //
translated: The continuum of the entity that is past and future is to be examined.

original: de zhes bya ba ni mngon sum mo //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni mngon sum mo //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to direct perception.

original: de'i rgyun la zhes bya ba ni dogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rgyun la zhes bya ba ni dogs pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú Its continuum‚Äù refers to doubt.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyun la'o //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyun la'o //
translated: It is the continuum that will arise.

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: ‚Äú How?‚Äù refers to the reply.

original: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba'i skad cig la'o //
analyzed: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba'i skad cig la'o //
translated: ‚Äú In another‚Äù refers to the present moment.

original: gzhan la zhes bya ba 'byung bar 'gyur ba la'o //
analyzed: gzhan la zhes bya ba 'byung bar 'gyur ba la'o //
translated: ‚Äú In another‚Äù refers to the future.

original: de ltar yin no zhes bya ba ni skad cig la zhugs pas rgyun la zhugs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar yin no zhes bya ba ni skad cig la zhugs pas rgyun la zhugs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú It is like that‚Äù refers to the fact that one who is engaged in the moment is engaged in the continuum.

original: brjod pa ni rjes su dpag pa yang zhes bya @107a * //
analyzed: brjod pa ni rjes su dpag pa yang zhes bya @107a * //
translated: ‚Äú It is said‚Äù refers to inference.üîΩ‚Äú Or else‚Äù refers to the fact that one who is engaged in the object uses the expression in regard to inference that is a designation.

original: pa'o ; /'on te nye bar btags pas rjes su dpag pa la don la zhugs pas tha snyad byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i gzhan gyi lam zlog par byed pa ni de zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: pa'o ; /'on te nye bar btags pas rjes su dpag pa la don la zhugs pas tha snyad byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i gzhan gyi lam zlog par byed pa ni de zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the refutation of the other path.

original: mngon sum zhes bya ba ni zlog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum zhes bya ba ni zlog par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Direct perception‚Äù refers to the refutation.

original: yang rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag khyad par yod par dogs pa bsu nas sel ba ni mngon sum ni de'i rigs la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gzhan gyi sgo nas mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag khyad par yod par dogs pa bsu nas sel ba ni mngon sum ni de'i rigs la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Again, in another way, he anticipates and responds to the qualm that there is a difference between direct perception and inference: Direct perception is in its type, and so on.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyun gyi rigs dang po'i skad cig la'o //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyun gyi rigs dang po'i skad cig la'o //
translated: In the continuum that will arise, in the first moment.

original: de la yang ni skad cig dang po la yang ngo //
analyzed: de la yang ni skad cig dang po la yang ngo //
translated: And in that, in the first moment.

original: ji ltar zhe na mngon sum gyi zhes smos so //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na mngon sum gyi zhes smos so //
translated: How? It is said, ‚Äúlike direct perception.‚Äù

original: rjes su dpag pa bzhin du rnam par rtog pa yang dngos po'i yul can ma yin pa'i phyir na de'i rigs can la mi 'jug go //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa bzhin du rnam par rtog pa yang dngos po'i yul can ma yin pa'i phyir na de'i rigs can la mi 'jug go //
translated: Because conceptual cognition, like inference, does not have an existent thing as its object, it does not engage in its type.

original: de ltar na yang tshad ma yin na ni rjes su dpag pa la yang bzlog par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar na yang tshad ma yin na ni rjes su dpag pa la yang bzlog par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Even so, if it were valid cognition, it would not be refuted even in inference. This is the meaning.

original: gal te de'i rigs la mngon sum 'jug pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba lan yin na de'i tshe rjes su dpag pa la yang lan ni mtshungs so //
analyzed: gal te de'i rigs la mngon sum 'jug pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba lan yin na de'i tshe rjes su dpag pa la yang lan ni mtshungs so //
translated: If the response is that conceptual cognition is valid cognition because direct perception engages in its type, then the response is the same for inference.

original: ji ltar zhe na rjes su dpag pa'i yul zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na rjes su dpag pa'i yul zhes gsungs so //
translated: How? He says, ‚Äúthe domain of inference.‚Äù

original: tshang bang gis zhes bya ba ni de nyid gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: tshang bang gis zhes bya ba ni de nyid gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúLike a fire‚Äù makes this clear.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe domain of inference‚Äù is the doubt.

original: de ni mngon sum mo //
analyzed: de ni mngon sum mo //
translated: That is the direct perception.

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni lan no //
translated: ‚ÄúEverything‚Äù is the reply.

original: mtshungs pa nyid brjod pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mtshungs pa nyid brjod pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The similarity is stated: ‚Äújust as.‚Äù

original: ji ltar rjes su dpag pa'i yul la mngon sum mi 'jug pa de bzhin du mngon sum gyis phyis 'byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i yul la mngon sum mi 'jug pa ma yin nam ci /
analyzed: ji ltar rjes su dpag pa'i yul la mngon sum mi 'jug pa de bzhin du mngon sum gyis phyis 'byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i yul la mngon sum mi 'jug pa ma yin nam ci /
translated: Just as direct perception does not engage the domain of inference, in the same way, is it not the case that direct perception does not engage the domain of subsequent conception?

original: 'on kyang mngon sum mi 'jug pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang mngon sum mi 'jug pa kho na'o //
translated: But direct perception does not engage at all.

original: des na rjes su dpag pa'i yul du rnam par rtog pa yang tshad mar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pa'i yul du rnam par rtog pa yang tshad mar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, conception in regard to the domain of inference is not a valid cognition. This is the meaning.

original: gzhal bya gzhan la zhes bya ba ni tshang bang gnas pa'i me'i gsal ba la zhugs pa yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhal bya gzhan la zhes bya ba ni tshang bang gnas pa'i me'i gsal ba la zhugs pa yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn regard to another object of knowledge‚Äù means in regard to the fire that is the cause of the smoke.

original: des na rjes su dpag pa 'jug par byed pa dang tshad ma nyid du mngon sum gyis mi byed pa na 'di ni rnam par rtog par byed pa la yang mtshungs te des na mngon sum des ni rnam par rtog pa yang tshad mar byed par mi 'gyur
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pa 'jug par byed pa dang tshad ma nyid du mngon sum gyis mi byed pa na 'di ni rnam par rtog par byed pa la yang mtshungs te des na mngon sum des ni rnam par rtog pa yang tshad mar byed par mi 'gyur
translated: Therefore, when it is not the case that inference is engaged and direct perception is not engaged as a valid cognition, then it is the same for conceptual thought. Therefore, that direct perception does not make conceptual thought a valid cognition.

original: ro zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: ro zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: The statement

original: rnam rtog des bskyed mngon sum ci //
analyzed: rnam rtog des bskyed mngon sum ci //
translated: ‚ÄúHow can direct perception be produced by that conceptual thought?‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba'o //üîΩci ste yang mngon sum gyi yul dang rang bzhin yul gcig nyid du rnam par rtog pas zhen par byed //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o // ci ste yang mngon sum gyi yul dang rang bzhin yul gcig nyid du rnam par rtog pas zhen par byed //
translated: is the response.üîΩBut if one suspects that the object of direct perception and the object of conceptual thought are the same, and that conceptual thought is engaged in direct perception,

original: des na mngon sum gyi rnam par rtog pa tshad mar byas pa yin no zhes dogs na gcig tu lhag par zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na mngon sum gyi rnam par rtog pa tshad mar byas pa yin no zhes dogs na gcig tu lhag par zhes gsungs so //
translated: then the response is ‚Äúexclusively.‚Äù

original: gnyi ga la @107b ni rnam par rtog pa dang rjes su dpag pa dag la'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga la @107b ni rnam par rtog pa dang rjes su dpag pa dag la'o //
translated: Both refers to conceptual thought and inference.

original: rjes su dpag pa yang rang gi yul la mngon sum gyi yul gcig pa nyid lhag par zhen par byed de //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang rang gi yul la mngon sum gyi yul gcig pa nyid lhag par zhen par byed de //
translated: Inference also engages in the exclusive object of direct perception with regard to its own object.

original: des na mngon sum gyi rjes su dpag pa yang ci ste tshad mar mi byed /
analyzed: des na mngon sum gyi rjes su dpag pa yang ci ste tshad mar mi byed /
translated: Therefore, why should inference not be a valid means of cognition?

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa ni 'thob par bya ba'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa des na tshad ma yin gyi rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa ni 'thob par bya ba'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa des na tshad ma yin gyi rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin te /
translated: If conceptual thought apprehends the nature of the object to be attained, then it is a valid means of cognition, but it is not inference.üîΩTherefore, it is not a valid means of cognition.

original: des na tshad ma ma yin no zhes dogs pa bsu nas bshad pa /
analyzed: des na tshad ma ma yin no zhes dogs pa bsu nas bshad pa /
translated: In response to this doubt, it is explained:

original: dngos po thob par bya ba de'i spyi ni rnam par brtag par bya ba dang rjes su dpag par bya ba gnyi gar yang rnam par rtog pa dang rjes su dpag pa dag gis 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po thob par bya ba de'i spyi ni rnam par brtag par bya ba dang rjes su dpag par bya ba gnyi gar yang rnam par rtog pa dang rjes su dpag pa dag gis 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: The universal of that object to be attained is apprehended by both conceptual thought and inference, whether it is to be conceptually analyzed or inferred.

original: des na gnyi gar thob par yang bya ba'i rang bzhin nyid mi 'dzin pa'i phyir tshad ma 'am tshad ma ma yin pa nyid du mtshungs so //
analyzed: des na gnyi gar thob par yang bya ba'i rang bzhin nyid mi 'dzin pa'i phyir tshad ma 'am tshad ma ma yin pa nyid du mtshungs so //
translated: Therefore, since neither apprehends the nature of the object to be attained, they are equal in being valid or invalid.

original: lhag par brjod pa'i don du yang dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: lhag par brjod pa'i don du yang dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: In order to express the remainder, the doubt is anticipated:

original: rnam par brtag par bya ba'i me'i skad cig yin pa de dag gi dang po'i skad cig dbang po'i yul yin no //
analyzed: rnam par brtag par bya ba'i me'i skad cig yin pa de dag gi dang po'i skad cig dbang po'i yul yin no //
translated: The first moment of those moments of fire to be conceptually analyzed is the object of the sense faculty.

original: des bzung ba de'i 'dzin par 'gyur ba la rnam par rtog pa 'jug par byed pa yin pa'i phyir tshad ma yin gyi /
analyzed: des bzung ba de'i 'dzin par 'gyur ba la rnam par rtog pa 'jug par byed pa yin pa'i phyir tshad ma yin gyi /
translated: because it engages in the apprehension of that which is apprehended by that.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: But it is not inference.

original: lan ni gzhan skad cig dang po bzung ba ni gzhan rnam par brtag par bya ba 'byung bar 'gyur ba bzung ba ma yin no zhes dpyad zin pa ni ma yin nam /
analyzed: lan ni gzhan skad cig dang po bzung ba ni gzhan rnam par brtag par bya ba 'byung bar 'gyur ba bzung ba ma yin no zhes dpyad zin pa ni ma yin nam /
translated: The response: Isn‚Äôt it already analyzed that the first moment of apprehension does not apprehend the other that will occur, which is to be imagined?

original: de ma bzung na yang de'i yul can gyi rnam par rtog pa rjes su dpag pa bzhin tshad mar mi 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ma bzung na yang de'i yul can gyi rnam par rtog pa rjes su dpag pa bzhin tshad mar mi 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa'o //
translated: Even if it does not apprehend that, the conceptual cognition that has that as its object would not be valid cognition, like inference.

original: 'on te gang yang rung ba gzhan bzung bas ni gzhan bzung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te gang yang rung ba gzhan bzung bas ni gzhan bzung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: But if it is apprehended that something else is different, then it is not apprehended that something else is different,

original: bum pa bzung bas kyang snam bu bzung bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bum pa bzung bas kyang snam bu bzung bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it follows that if a pot is apprehended, a cloth is apprehended.

original: 'on kyang 'brel ba can bzung bas na 'byung bar 'gyur pas bzung ba yin no zhes dogs pa ni de dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'brel ba can bzung bas na 'byung bar 'gyur pas bzung ba yin no zhes dogs pa ni de dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But if it is apprehended that something related is different, then it is apprehended that something that will occur is different.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba de dang 'brel ba skad cig dang po ste bzung ba na 'byung bar 'gyur ba de bzung bar 'dod na'o //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba de dang 'brel ba skad cig dang po ste bzung ba na 'byung bar 'gyur ba de bzung bar 'dod na'o //
translated: If one wishes to apprehend the future object, then the first moment of the relation is apprehended.

original: 'brel pa 'dzin pa ji ltar mtshungs snyam na /
analyzed: 'brel pa 'dzin pa ji ltar mtshungs snyam na /
translated: How is the apprehension of the relation similar?

original: mngon sum las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu mthong zhing rjes su dpag pa las yang 'bras bu du ba la sogs pa'i rtags mngon sum gyis mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu mthong zhing rjes su dpag pa las yang 'bras bu du ba la sogs pa'i rtags mngon sum gyis mthong ba yin te /
translated: The conceptual cognition that arises from perception sees the cause of the future object, and from inference, the effect such as smoke is seen by perception.

original: des na 'brel pa 'dzin pa mtshungs so //
analyzed: des na 'brel pa 'dzin pa mtshungs so //
translated: Therefore, the apprehension of the relation is similar.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar mngon sum gyi 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i phyir na ma bzung ba la 'jug pa'i rnam par rtog pa tshad mar byed pa de bzhin du rjes su dpag @108a * //üîΩpa yang byed par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar mngon sum gyi 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i phyir na ma bzung ba la 'jug pa'i rnam par rtog pa tshad mar byed pa de bzhin du rjes su dpag @108a * // pa yang byed par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, just as perception is valid cognition because it apprehends the relation, in the same way, conceptual cognition that engages what is not apprehended is valid cognition, and inference also functions in the same way. This is the meaning.

original: ji ltar 'brel par khyad par med snyam na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar 'brel par khyad par med snyam na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: How is there no difference in the relation? It is stated: the relation of cause and effect.

original: rnam par rtog pa dang rjes su dpag pa'i yul 'bras bu dang rgyu dag gis /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang rjes su dpag pa'i yul 'bras bu dang rgyu dag gis /
translated: The object of conceptual thought and inference is the effect and cause.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i sgo nas 'brel pa ni gnyis kyis mngon sum gnyis las mtshungs so //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i sgo nas 'brel pa ni gnyis kyis mngon sum gnyis las mtshungs so //
translated: The relation is by way of cause and effect. The two are similar to the two direct perceptions.üîΩThus, one is a means of valid cognition and the other is not, is the claim of those who maintain that direct perception and inference are of the nature of what is to be attained.

original: des na gcig ni tshad mar byed la rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin zhes mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag ni thob par bya ba'i rang bzhin ngo bo mi 'dzin pa nyid kyis na tshad ma 'am cig shos dag tu mtshungs pa yin no zhes
analyzed: des na gcig ni tshad mar byed la rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin zhes mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag ni thob par bya ba'i rang bzhin ngo bo mi 'dzin pa nyid kyis na tshad ma 'am cig shos dag tu mtshungs pa yin no zhes
translated: But they are similar in being means of valid cognition, because they do not grasp the nature of what is to be attained.

original: bstan zin to //
analyzed: bstan zin to //
translated: This has been explained.

original: de ni khyad par gzhan sems pa na mngon sum nyid tshad ma yin gyi /üîΩrjes su dpag pa ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni rgyu las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni khyad par gzhan sems pa na mngon sum nyid tshad ma yin gyi / rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni rgyu las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When one thinks of another distinction, one says that direct perception is a means of valid cognition,üîΩbut inference is not.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu rtog pa'i rang bzhin ni tshad ma ma yin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rgyu rtog pa'i rang bzhin ni tshad ma ma yin pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason is that the nature of conceptual thought is not a means of valid cognition, because it is ascertained from the cause.üîΩBut if,

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
translated: is a doubt.

original: lan ni mngon sum nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgang la ma nges pa brjod pa ni de la ni mngon sum ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: lan ni mngon sum nyid ni zhes bya ba'o // gang la ma nges pa brjod pa ni de la ni mngon sum ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: The answer is: ‚ÄúDirect perception is of that which is present.‚ÄùüîΩAs for what is not ascertained, it is said that ‚Äúit is not direct perception.‚Äù

original: 'byung 'gyur ba la ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung 'gyur ba la ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: As for what is to come, it is said that ‚Äúit is not direct perception.‚Äù

original: 'on te de la yang de mngon sum nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de la yang de mngon sum nyid do zhe na /
translated: But if it is said that it is direct perception even in that case,

original: de'i rigs la zhes smos te /
analyzed: de'i rigs la zhes smos te /
translated: then it is said that ‚Äúit is of that type.‚Äù

original: 'byung ba'i rigs rgyu'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i rigs rgyu'o //
translated: The type of the element is the cause.

original: de la yang ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba la yang ngo //
analyzed: de la yang ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba la yang ngo //
translated: And it is also of that which is to come.

original: ji ltar na rtsod snyam du dogs na /üîΩme la sogs pa rjes su dpag pa'i yul la yang mngon sum nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar na rtsod snyam du dogs na / me la sogs pa rjes su dpag pa'i yul la yang mngon sum nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: How is there a dispute?üîΩIt is said that ‚Äúit is also the domain of inference,‚Äù because fire and so on are direct perception,

original: tshang bang la sogs pa de'i rigs la mngon sum zhugs pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: tshang bang la sogs pa de'i rigs la mngon sum zhugs pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: because the type of the smoke is engaged in the domain of direct perception, such as a kitchen.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la yang zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la yang zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said that ‚Äúit is also the domain of inference.‚Äù

original: rnam par rtog pa'i yul 'ba' zhig la yin par ni ma zad do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i yul 'ba' zhig la yin par ni ma zad do //
translated: It is not only the domain of conception.

original: gang zhig de'i rigs yin pa de ni tshang bang la sogs par mngon sum gyi yul du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig de'i rigs yin pa de ni tshang bang la sogs par mngon sum gyi yul du gyur pa yin no //
translated: That which is of that type is the domain of direct perception, such as smoke.

original: spyi'i yul can nyid yin yang /
analyzed: spyi'i yul can nyid yin yang /
translated: Although it is a universal,

original: 'di ni mngon sum gnyis kyi khyad par yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ni mngon sum gnyis kyi khyad par yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: it is said that this is the difference between the two direct perceptions.

original: der zhes bya ba rjes su dpag pa la'o //
analyzed: der zhes bya ba rjes su dpag pa la'o //
translated: Here, ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to inference.

original: 'di la ni rnam par rtog pa la'o //
analyzed: 'di la ni rnam par rtog pa la'o //
translated: Here, ‚Äúthis‚Äù refers to conception.

original: des na rnam par rtog pa bzhin du rjes su dpag pa tshad mar 'gyur ro bsams pa'o //
analyzed: des na rnam par rtog pa bzhin du rjes su dpag pa tshad mar 'gyur ro bsams pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is thought that inference is valid cognition like conception.

original: gzhan dag khyad par brjod pa ni /üîΩder ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag khyad par brjod pa ni / der ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Others state the difference:

original: rjes su dpag pa la'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to inference.üîΩ‚ÄúThis‚Äù refers to conception.

original: gsal ba gzhan tshad ma la sogs pa la yod pa la'o //
analyzed: gsal ba gzhan tshad ma la sogs pa la yod pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to a particular, such as a valid cognition.

original: 'dir ni rnam par rtog pa la'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni rnam par rtog pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHere‚Äù refers to conception.

original: de nyid la zhes bya ba ni gsal ba gcig la'o //
analyzed: de nyid la zhes bya ba ni gsal ba gcig la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to a single particular.

original: lan du yul mi mtshungs pa nyid ma yin no //üîΩci'i phyir @108b zhe na ;
analyzed: lan du yul mi mtshungs pa nyid ma yin no // ci'i phyir @108b zhe na ;
translated: The reply is that the objects are not similar.üîΩWhy?

original: 'byung ba dang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because it is said, ‚Äúthe elements and so on.‚Äù

original: rgyud gzhan las ldog pa yang mtshungs pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyud gzhan las ldog pa yang mtshungs pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is the same in terms of the reversal of the continuum.

original: rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang spyi'i yul can nyid du khyad par med do //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang spyi'i yul can nyid du khyad par med do //
translated: There is also no difference in being a cognition of a universal in another way.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and that which will occur.

original: de las gzhan las bzung ba ni gcig nyid la de dang rigs mthun pa'am mi mthun pa nyid du 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan las bzung ba ni gcig nyid la de dang rigs mthun pa'am mi mthun pa nyid du 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that one apprehends the same thing as similar or dissimilar in another place or time.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi lan gyi dogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi lan gyi dogs pa ste /
translated: In another place means in another time.

original: yul dang dus gzhan du mthong ba la 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang rigs gcig tu 'dzin pa'i phyir rigs 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: yul dang dus gzhan du mthong ba la 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang rigs gcig tu 'dzin pa'i phyir rigs 'dra ba yin no //
translated: It is similar because one apprehends what is seen in another place or time as the same type.

original: 'di ltar dus gzhan du sngon po bzung nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar dus gzhan du sngon po bzung nas /
translated: Thus, having apprehended blue at one time,

original: don du gnyer nas 'jug pas ni de 'thob pa yin la de'i rjes su dus gzhan du de mthong ba nyid las gang dang gang sngon po yin pa de dang de ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i sngon po dang rigs mtshungs pa yin te /
analyzed: don du gnyer nas 'jug pas ni de 'thob pa yin la de'i rjes su dus gzhan du de mthong ba nyid las gang dang gang sngon po yin pa de dang de ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i sngon po dang rigs mtshungs pa yin te /
translated: one seeks it and engages in order to obtain it. Later, at another time, one sees it and thinks, ‚ÄúThat is the blue that will occur, because it is similar to the blue that occurred before.‚Äù

original: des na sngon po mthong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: des na sngon po mthong ba bzhin no //
translated: Thus, one thinks, ‚ÄúThis is like the blue that was seen before.‚Äù

original: 'di yang sngon po yin no zhes nges par 'gyur ro zhe na /üîΩ'di yang lan du 'o na ni zhes bya pa'o ;
analyzed: 'di yang sngon po yin no zhes nges par 'gyur ro zhe na /üîΩ'di yang lan du 'o na ni zhes bya pa'o ;
translated: And one thinks, ‚ÄúThis is also blue.‚ÄùüîΩThe response to that is, ‚ÄúWell then, it follows that one would not apprehend the difference between the two.‚Äù

original: / ma nges pa yin no zhes brjod pa gang yin pa de spong ba'i dogs pa bsu ba ni /üîΩ'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: / ma nges pa yin no zhes brjod pa gang yin pa de spong ba'i dogs pa bsu ba ni / 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBut if it is not a cause,

original: gang na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: gang na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: then how is it that it is invariably concomitant with the effect?‚Äù

original: gdon mi za bar 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin na ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba de rgyu yin no zhes brjod pa ni gdon mi za bar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin na ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba de rgyu yin no zhes brjod pa ni gdon mi za bar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is invariably concomitant, then that which is invariably concomitant is the cause. This is what is said with the words ‚Äúif it is not a cause.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir de ltar 'byung bar 'gyur ba rgyu nyid yin pa'i gtan tshigs des na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar 'byung bar 'gyur ba rgyu nyid yin pa'i gtan tshigs des na'o //
translated: The reason why it is the cause is because it is invariably concomitant in this way.

original: 'jug par bya ba la ni thob par bya ba la'o //
analyzed: 'jug par bya ba la ni thob par bya ba la'o //
translated: With regard to the engagement, i.e., the object to be attained,

original: mngon sum gyi dngos po la reg pas tshad ma yin gyi gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi dngos po la reg pas tshad ma yin gyi gzhan ma yin te /
translated: it is a means of valid knowledge because it touches the object that is present, not because of anything else.

original: de med pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to the doubt that this is not so because it does not exist is:üîΩ‚ÄúBut if it is not a means of valid knowledge, then how is it that it is invariably concomitant with the effect?‚Äù

original: thob par bya ba ni yul med na mdun na gnas pa'i rnam pa nyid ni 'khrul pa dag la mtshungs pas na /
analyzed: thob par bya ba ni yul med na mdun na gnas pa'i rnam pa nyid ni 'khrul pa dag la mtshungs pas na /
translated: The object to be attained is not present. The mere aspect that is present is the same in errors.

original: des ni tshad ma dang cig shos su 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes lan 'debs pa ni thob par bya ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des ni tshad ma dang cig shos su 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes lan 'debs pa ni thob par bya ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer to that is ‚ÄúBut it is not the case that there is a valid cognition and something else.‚Äù

original: 'khrul pa yang da ltar ba khyad par med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'khrul pa yang da ltar ba khyad par med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚Äú There is no difference in the present‚Äù means that there is no difference in the present nondeceptive cognition.

original: don yod pa dang zhes bya ba ni khyad par yod par dogs pa bsu ba'o //
analyzed: don yod pa dang zhes bya ba ni khyad par yod par dogs pa bsu ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú If there is an object‚Äù anticipates the objection that there is a difference.

original: ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa 'gog pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú It is not so‚Äù rejects the objection.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it not so?

original: mi slu ba med par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi slu ba med par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Because there is no nondeception.‚Äù

original: mdun na gnas pa'i rnam pa nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mdun na gnas pa'i rnam pa nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no difference in the aspect of the object that is present before one.

original: rang nyid mi slu ba ma yin yang gzhan gyi mi slu ba las dngos po'i yul can nyid do zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang nyid mi slu ba ma yin yang gzhan gyi mi slu ba las dngos po'i yul can nyid do zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Even though it is not itself nondeceptive, it is still an object that has a nondeceptive object, because it is produced from a nondeceptive object.

original: lan ni de yang zhes bya ba ste //
analyzed: lan ni de yang zhes bya ba ste //
translated: The answer to that is ‚ÄúThat also is not so.‚Äù

original: @109a * // skyes bu gzhan gyi mi slu ba las dngos po'i yul can nyid yin pa de yang rjes su dpag pas rtogs par bya ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: @109a * // skyes bu gzhan gyi mi slu ba las dngos po'i yul can nyid yin pa de yang rjes su dpag pas rtogs par bya ba nyid yin te /
translated: The fact that the cognition of another person is non-deceptive with regard to the object, that too must be understood through inference,

original: mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not a direct perception.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i dngos po'i yul can ma yin pa na gzhan dngos po'i yul can du ji ltar rnam par 'jig par byed ;
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i dngos po'i yul can ma yin pa na gzhan dngos po'i yul can du ji ltar rnam par 'jig par byed ;
translated: If it is not an inference, how can it be a cognition of an object?

original: de bas na mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag ni khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag ni khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no difference between direct perception and inference.

original: 'o na ji ltar dngos po lam reg pa tshad ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar dngos po lam reg pa tshad ma yin zhe na /
translated: But how can a cognition that does not reach the object be a valid cognition?

original: de'i phyir zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes gsungs te /
translated: To this he says, ‚Äúbecause of that.‚Äù

original: sngar bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it was explained earlier.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni dngos po 'dzin par nye ba kho na ma yin na'o //üîΩgal te don 'di ltar rtsa ba dang 'grib ce na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni dngos po 'dzin par nye ba kho na ma yin na'o // gal te don 'di ltar rtsa ba dang 'grib ce na /
translated: Otherwise, if it did not approach the apprehension of the object,

original: de la 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de la 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
translated: if this is the root of the matter, he says, ‚Äúin that case.‚Äù

original: thob par bya ba'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo ni 'dzin pa'i phyir na 'khrul pas kyang rjes su dpag pa'i bdag nyid can gyi rtogs pa mthong ste tshad mas so //
analyzed: thob par bya ba'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo ni 'dzin pa'i phyir na 'khrul pas kyang rjes su dpag pa'i bdag nyid can gyi rtogs pa mthong ste tshad mas so //
translated: The nature of the object to be attained is grasped, and so even through error, there is a realization that has the nature of inference, as seen through a valid cognition.

original: dper na mngon sum du mngon par zhen bzhin du zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dper na mngon sum du mngon par zhen bzhin du zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: For example, just as in direct perception, there is the meaning of ‚Äúas if directly perceived.‚Äù

original: 'di'i bshad pa ni mngon sum la yang na 'jug par byed pa nyid ltar 'gyur te zhes bya ba nas nyis na mngon sum nyid tshad ma yin par 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: 'di'i bshad pa ni mngon sum la yang na 'jug par byed pa nyid ltar 'gyur te zhes bya ba nas nyis na mngon sum nyid tshad ma yin par 'gyur ba yin /
translated: The explanation of this is: ‚ÄúIn direct perception, it would be as if there were engagement,‚Äù and so on, up to ‚Äúif it were direct perception, it would be a valid cognition.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i bar du rgya cher brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i bar du rgya cher brjod pa yin no //
translated: It would not be inference.‚Äù This is stated extensively.

original: bshad pa gzhan gsungs pa ni yang na gal te 'jug pa'i don to zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bshad pa gzhan gsungs pa ni yang na gal te 'jug pa'i don to zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Another explanation is given: ‚ÄúOr, if it is the meaning of engagement.‚Äù

original: 'di yang des na ji ltar de kho na yongs su ma bcad par zhes bya bas bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di yang des na ji ltar de kho na yongs su ma bcad par zhes bya bas bshad zin to //
translated: This is also explained by ‚ÄúThen, how is that not ascertained?‚Äù

original: gal te thob par bya ba'i rang bzhin ma rtogs na 'o na ji ltar 'thob ce na /
analyzed: gal te thob par bya ba'i rang bzhin ma rtogs na 'o na ji ltar 'thob ce na /
translated: If the nature of the object to be attained is not realized, then how is it attained?

original: lan du don yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan du don yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is: because it is meaningful.

original: 'di nyid bshad pa ni yod pa ma yin pa de ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid bshad pa ni yod pa ma yin pa de ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is explained: ‚ÄúThat which does not exist . . .‚Äù

original: ci de ltar 'ba' zhig tu mthong ba yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: ci de ltar 'ba' zhig tu mthong ba yod dam zhe na /
translated: Is it only thus that seeing exists?

original: 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said: ‚ÄúIn this way . . .‚Äù

original: 'di snyam du thob pa 'di ni ma nges pa ste nges pa ni dngos po la reg pa med par mi 'thad do zhes dogs pa ni nges pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di snyam du thob pa 'di ni ma nges pa ste nges pa ni dngos po la reg pa med par mi 'thad do zhes dogs pa ni nges pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The doubt is: ‚ÄúThis attainment is uncertain, and it is not tenable that certainty is without contact with an entity.‚Äù The answer is: ‚Äúcertainty . . .‚Äù

original: lan ni 'brel pa'i zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lan ni 'brel pa'i zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The answer is: ‚Äúby the power of the connection . . .‚Äù

original: rtags dang 'brel pa'i stobs kyis so //
analyzed: rtags dang 'brel pa'i stobs kyis so //
translated: By the power of the connection with the reason.

original: des na 'thob pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad de yod pa nyid kyang 'brel pa can rtags yod pa las te /
analyzed: des na 'thob pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad de yod pa nyid kyang 'brel pa can rtags yod pa las te /
translated: Therefore, it is not only attainment that exists, but also existence itself, from the existence of the connected reason.

original: phyogs kyi chos nyid las so zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩ'brel pa 'dzin pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi rjes su dpag pa tshad ma yin gyi de med par ni mi 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos nyid las so zhes bya ba'i don to // 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi rjes su dpag pa tshad ma yin gyi de med par ni mi 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: The meaning is: from the property of the subject.

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The doubt is: ‚ÄúInference, which has the reason as its mark, is valid knowledge, but it would not be without that.‚Äù The answer is: ‚ÄúHow . . .‚Äù

original: mngon sum la yang zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: mngon sum la yang zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúDirect perception, too, . . .‚Äù

original: don dam par 'brel bar @109b nges par bya mi nus pa'i phyir gzhan dag rkang pa brkyang ba tsam gyis dogs par byed pa ni de lta bu nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don dam par 'brel bar @109b nges par bya mi nus pa'i phyir gzhan dag rkang pa brkyang ba tsam gyis dogs par byed pa ni de lta bu nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since it is not possible to ascertain a connection ultimately, others are suspicious of it merely on the basis of the statement, ‚ÄúIt is just like that.‚Äù

original: gnyi gar yang zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: gnyi gar yang zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúIn both cases . . .‚Äù

original: de lta bu nyid mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i lan ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gis 'brel pa rtogs pa gnyi gar yang mtshungs so ;
analyzed: de lta bu nyid mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i lan ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gis 'brel pa rtogs pa gnyi gar yang mtshungs so ;
translated: The response to the question, ‚ÄúWhy is that?‚Äù is ‚ÄúBecause we see just that.‚Äù It is the same in both cases, that is, when a connection is understood through direct perception and inference.

original: / de'i phyir gnyi ga tshad ma yin pa la rtsod pa med do //
analyzed: / de'i phyir gnyi ga tshad ma yin pa la rtsod pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no dispute that both are valid cognitions.

original: gal te rjes su dpag pa ltar /
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pa ltar /
translated: If, like an inference,

original: rnam par rtog pa ni tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar de zlar byas nas rjes su dpag pa tshad mar sgrub ces dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar de zlar byas nas rjes su dpag pa tshad mar sgrub ces dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: a conceptual cognition is not a valid cognition, then how can it be used to refute an inference and establish that it is a valid cognition?

original: 'on te der ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'on te der ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The response to this question is ‚ÄúBut in that case . . .‚Äù

original: thob par bya ba der ro //
analyzed: thob par bya ba der ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù refers to the object to be attained.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat itself‚Äù refers to the nonconceptual cognition.

original: des na rnam par rtog pa des rjes su dpag pa tshad mar mi grub po zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: des na rnam par rtog pa des rjes su dpag pa tshad mar mi grub po zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not established that inference is a valid cognition by that conceptual thought.

original: lan ni rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is ‚Äúinference.‚Äù

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni 'brel pa 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni 'brel pa 'dzin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat itself‚Äù means apprehending the relation.

original: khas mi len pa'i rgyu dogs par byed pa ni de nyid ces bya ba ste khyab pa 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: khas mi len pa'i rgyu dogs par byed pa ni de nyid ces bya ba ste khyab pa 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The cause of not accepting is suspected by ‚Äúthat itself,‚Äù which means apprehending the pervasion.

original: 'di ni rnam par rtog pa la yang mtshungs so zhes lan brjod pa ni rtog pa skye ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par rtog pa la yang mtshungs so zhes lan brjod pa ni rtog pa skye ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response that this is the same for conceptual thought is ‚Äúwhen conceptual thought arises.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rgyu dang zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: rgyu dang zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: It is stated, ‚Äúbecause of the cause.‚Äù

original: rgyu dang rnam pa thams cad sngar yod min zhes bya ba der ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang rnam pa thams cad sngar yod min zhes bya ba der ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThe cause and all aspects do not exist previously‚Äù is there.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHowever‚Äù is a suspicion.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i dus su ni de'i yul can gyi mngon sum yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i dus su ni de'i yul can gyi mngon sum yod pa ma yin te /
translated: At the time of inference, the direct perception that has it as its object does not exist.

original: des na rjes su dpag pa skyed par byed pa de ni tshad ma ma yin la /
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pa skyed par byed pa de ni tshad ma ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, that which produces inference is not a valid cognition.

original: rjes su dpag pa yang don sgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang don sgrub par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: And inference also does not establish the object.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni lan te /
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni lan te /
translated: No, is the reply.

original: dang po'i mngon sum gyi skad cig kho nar nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dang po'i mngon sum gyi skad cig kho nar nges pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because it is ascertained in the very first moment of direct perception.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
translated: But, is a doubt.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni tshad ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni tshad ma yin pa'o //
translated: If it were not so, is the reply.

original: 'o na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: 'o na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: But, is a doubt.

original: 'on te snga ma rnams thob par byed pa nges pa skyed pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te snga ma rnams thob par byed pa nges pa skyed pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that the former are not valid cognitions because they do not generate the ascertainment that obtains the object,

original: snga ma dag ces gsungs so //
analyzed: snga ma dag ces gsungs so //
translated: the former are said.

original: phyi ma rnams tshad ma ma yin pa ni grub pa dang bde ba mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi ma rnams tshad ma ma yin pa ni grub pa dang bde ba mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The latter are not valid cognitions because they are similar to that which is already established and that which is easy to do.

original: phyi ma rnams ji ltar tshad ma ma yin te /üîΩnges par 'byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: phyi ma rnams ji ltar tshad ma ma yin te / nges par 'byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
