translated: How are the latter not valid cognitions?üîΩBecause they are the factors conducive to penetrative insight.

original: the tshom za ba ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: the tshom za ba ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: Anticipating this doubt, he says, Doubt is.

original: gal te shes pa dang po yod kyang the tshom za na ji ltar de las nges pa yin pa nges so zhe na ni the tshom za ba ma yin te gnyi ga phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te shes pa dang po yod kyang the tshom za na ji ltar de las nges pa yin pa nges so zhe na ni the tshom za ba ma yin te gnyi ga phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If you say that even though the first cognition exists, if there is doubt, how can it be ascertained? It is not doubted, because both are mutually contradictory.

original: des na phyi ma rnams nye bar sbyor ba med pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to//
analyzed: des na phyi ma rnams nye bar sbyor ba med pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to//
translated: Therefore, the meaning is that the later ones are not applied, and so they are not valid cognitions.

original: @110a * // 'dis ni ji skad du shes pa'i skad cig dang po nyid kyis don bzung zhing nang du 'dus pa'i zhen pas nges par yang byas pa yin te de ma nges na yul de la 'dzin par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni gsal ba yin te
analyzed: @110a * // 'dis ni ji skad du shes pa'i skad cig dang po nyid kyis don bzung zhing nang du 'dus pa'i zhen pas nges par yang byas pa yin te de ma nges na yul de la 'dzin par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni gsal ba yin te
translated: This clarifies the statement: ‚ÄúBy the first moment of cognition itself, the object is apprehended and ascertained by internal fixation, because if it is not ascertained, it is not tenable to apprehend that object.‚Äù

original: / gang gi phyir tshad ma'i bya ba nges par mthar thug pas yongs su rdzogs pa la ni the tshom yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: / gang gi phyir tshad ma'i bya ba nges par mthar thug pas yongs su rdzogs pa la ni the tshom yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Because the activity of valid cognition is definitely completed, there is no doubt.

original: thams cad du de ltar yin par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du de ltar yin par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that everything would be like that.

original: 'on te snga ma rnams zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba ste /
analyzed: 'on te snga ma rnams zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba ste /
translated: Or, if one says ‚Äúthe former,‚Äù that is a hypothetical objection.

original: the tshom gyis zin pa'i byed pa can yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: the tshom gyis zin pa'i byed pa can yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it is an activity that is accompanied by doubt.

original: de lta yin zhes bya ba ni tshad ma ma yin pa nyid yin na'o //
analyzed: de lta yin zhes bya ba ni tshad ma ma yin pa nyid yin na'o //
translated: If it is so, i.e., if it is not a means of valid cognition,

original: de las 'jug pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mngon sum snga ma las so //
analyzed: de las 'jug pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mngon sum snga ma las so //
translated: then there is no engagement with it, i.e., with the means of valid cognition, because of the prior direct perception.

original: 'ga' yang zhes bya ba ni mngon sum snga ma'am phyi ma yang ste mdun na gnas pa'i rnam pa can nyid du khyad par phyir /
analyzed: 'ga' yang zhes bya ba ni mngon sum snga ma'am phyi ma yang ste mdun na gnas pa'i rnam pa can nyid du khyad par phyir /
translated: No one, i.e., neither the prior nor the subsequent direct perception, has a mode of being that is present in front of it.

original: rjes su dpag pa yang khyed kyi ltar na tshad ma ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang khyed kyi ltar na tshad ma ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Inference is also not a means of valid cognition, according to you.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'jug pa las sngar gyi 'jug par byed pa nyid ma nges pa'i phyir na the tshom za ba'i phyir yul la 'jug pa yang tshad ma kho na las yin no zhes brjod pa ni re zhig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'jug pa las sngar gyi 'jug par byed pa nyid ma nges pa'i phyir na the tshom za ba'i phyir yul la 'jug pa yang tshad ma kho na las yin no zhes brjod pa ni re zhig ces bya ba'o //
translated: For this very reason, since the prior engagement is not ascertained as the engaging cause, the engagement with the object is also only from a means of valid cognition, because of the doubt.

original: de ltar 'jug pa khas len na ni the tshom gyis 'jug pa de ni rjes su dpag pa la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: de ltar 'jug pa khas len na ni the tshom gyis 'jug pa de ni rjes su dpag pa la yang mtshungs so //
translated: If one accepts engagement in this way, then that engagement by doubt is similar in inference as well.

original: des na gang gis de kho na tshad ma yin la /
analyzed: des na gang gis de kho na tshad ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, it is valid knowledge with regard to reality.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin par 'gyur ba /
translated: But it is not inference.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa las khyad du 'phags pa ci zhig yod /
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa las khyad du 'phags pa ci zhig yod /
translated: What is the difference between it and direct perception?

original: de ltar rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang rtogs pa mthong zhes bya ba'i rgya cher bshad nas mjug sdud pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //üîΩbshad pa snga ma gnyis la ni rtog pa 'khrul pa'i rjes su dpag gi rang bzhin dang 'jug pa'i rang bzhin du bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang rtogs pa mthong zhes bya ba'i rgya cher bshad nas mjug sdud pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o // bshad pa snga ma gnyis la ni rtog pa 'khrul pa'i rjes su dpag gi rang bzhin dang 'jug pa'i rang bzhin du bstan pa yin la /
translated: Having explained the passage beginning with ‚ÄúOne sees with another aspect,‚Äù he concludes, ‚ÄúTherefore‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: 'dir ni mngon sum yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'dir ni mngon sum yin par 'dod do //
translated: In the first two explanations, it is taught that it is inference following a mistaken conception, but here it is asserted to be direct perception.

original: gzhan gyi rang bzhin du zhes bya ba ni thob par bya ba las gzhan gyi rang bzhin du'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rang bzhin du zhes bya ba ni thob par bya ba las gzhan gyi rang bzhin du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAnother nature‚Äù means a nature that is different from the object to be attained.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba thob par bya ba las gzhan la rtogs pa nyid ga la yang zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba thob par bya ba las gzhan la rtogs pa nyid ga la yang zhes 'brel to //
translated: ‚ÄúAnother‚Äù is connected to ‚Äúhow can there be realization?‚Äù which is different from the object to be attained.

original: gzhan ci 'dra ba zhig ces dogs na /
analyzed: gzhan ci 'dra ba zhig ces dogs na /
translated: Fearing that it is not clear what ‚Äúanother‚Äù means, he says,üîΩ‚ÄúWhat is it like?‚Äù

original: dngos po'i ngo bo zhes bya ba ni dbang pos gzung bar bya ba'i skad cig dang po dang / rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba rang bzhin pa'i bzung ba la zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo zhes bya ba ni dbang pos gzung bar bya ba'i skad cig dang po dang / rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba rang bzhin pa'i bzung ba la zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The so-called entity is the first moment apprehended by the sense faculty, and the so-called nature is the subsequent apprehension.

original: de'i phyir 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po la ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag khyad par 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po la ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag khyad par 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no difference at all between perception and inference with regard to an entity that will occur.

original: gal te yul gcig nyid yin na 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te yul gcig nyid yin na 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the object is the same, then what?

original: gnyi ga thob par bya ba'i yul gcig nyid yin @110b na tshad ma'i dbye bsgrub pa'i don du nye bar bkod pa'i gzhal bya'i dbye ba ji ltar 'grub ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnyi ga thob par bya ba'i yul gcig nyid yin @110b na tshad ma'i dbye bsgrub pa'i don du nye bar bkod pa'i gzhal bya'i dbye ba ji ltar 'grub ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: If the object to be attained is the same, how is the division of the object of evaluation established for the purpose of proving the division of valid cognition? This is the meaning.

original: lan ni gsal ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni gsal ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is clarity.

original: gsal ba mngon sum la mi gsal ba de'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gsal ba mngon sum la mi gsal ba de'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: Clarity is understood by perception, and the unclear nature is understood by inference.

original: sgro 'dogs la ni gsal ba rjes su dpag pa la yang dus phyis 'byung ba'i mngon sum gyis rtogs pas sgro 'dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs la ni gsal ba rjes su dpag pa la yang dus phyis 'byung ba'i mngon sum gyis rtogs pas sgro 'dogs pa yin no //
translated: As for superimposition, it is understood by a subsequent clear and non-conceptual perception, and thus it is superimposition.

original: rnam par brtag par bya ba ni mi gsal ba yin la /
analyzed: rnam par brtag par bya ba ni mi gsal ba yin la /
translated: What is to be investigated is unclear,

original: gzhan ni gsal ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan ni gsal ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: while the other is clear. This is the meaning.

original: gsal ba la yang phyi rol du sgro 'dogs pa ni rjes su dpag pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: gsal ba la yang phyi rol du sgro 'dogs pa ni rjes su dpag pa kho na yin te /
translated: As for the clear, the superimposition of external objects is only inference,

original: rjes su dpag pa gzhan bzhin no zhes brjod pa ni yang na rnam pa gzhan du yin te zhes bya ba ste tshad ma'i yul gyi dbye ba brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i lhag ma'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa gzhan bzhin no zhes brjod pa ni yang na rnam pa gzhan du yin te zhes bya ba ste tshad ma'i yul gyi dbye ba brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i lhag ma'o //
translated: just like another inference. This is what is being said. Or, in another way, the classification of the objects of valid cognition should be stated. This is the remainder.

original: de ltar mdun na gnas pa'i rnam pa can gang du 'byung bar 'gyur ba rtogs pa der ni de'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pa tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar mdun na gnas pa'i rnam pa can gang du 'byung bar 'gyur ba rtogs pa der ni de'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pa tshad ma yin no //
translated: Thus, wherever the form that exists in front arises, there inference of its nature is valid cognition.

original: da ni mngon sum gang yin snyam na /
analyzed: da ni mngon sum gang yin snyam na /
translated: Now, what is perception?

original: lhag pas zhes gsungs te lhag ma ni khyad par du 'phags pa ste /
analyzed: lhag pas zhes gsungs te lhag ma ni khyad par du 'phags pa ste /
translated: The remainder is superior.

original: shin tu goms pa las rnam par rtog pa la mi ltos pa ste de ma 'ongs pa don du gnyer bas da ltar ba la 'jug pa ni mngon sum kho na tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: shin tu goms pa las rnam par rtog pa la mi ltos pa ste de ma 'ongs pa don du gnyer bas da ltar ba la 'jug pa ni mngon sum kho na tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: But when one has become very familiar with it, it is not dependent on conceptual thought. Therefore, when one is engaged in the present in order to seek the future, it is only perception that is a valid cognition.

original: phyed phyi ma rnam par 'grel pa ni gang du shin tu zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyed phyi ma rnam par 'grel pa ni gang du shin tu zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The second half is explained by ‚Äúwhen one has become very familiar with it.‚Äù

original: de lta ma yin nam zhes bya ba ne rnam par rtog pa la rag las pas 'jug par byed pa nyid yin pa'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin nam zhes bya ba ne rnam par rtog pa la rag las pas 'jug par byed pa nyid yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIs it not so?‚Äù means that it is engaged in by being dependent on conceptual thought.

original: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni gal te gang la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid gsal bar byed pa ni gal te gang la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is clarified by ‚ÄúIf it were not so.‚Äù

original: mngon sum nyid ma bung ba 'dzin pa nyid kyi tshad ma yin gyi //
analyzed: mngon sum nyid ma bung ba 'dzin pa nyid kyi tshad ma yin gyi //
translated: It is only perception that is a valid cognition in the apprehension of the present.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not conceptual thought.üîΩBecause it is the opposite.

original: bzlog pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The doubt is expressed by ‚ÄúIf it were not so.‚Äù

original: dpyad zin to zhes bya ba ni ci rnam par rtog pa la 'jug par byed pa nyid yod dam zhes bya ba der ro //
analyzed: dpyad zin to zhes bya ba ni ci rnam par rtog pa la 'jug par byed pa nyid yod dam zhes bya ba der ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThis has already been analyzed‚Äù refers to ‚ÄúIs it not so that conceptual thought is engaged in?‚Äù

original: des ni rnam par 'jog pas so //
analyzed: des ni rnam par 'jog pas so //
translated: Because it is established by that.

original: ldan du zin kyang ni 'brel du zin kyang ngo //
analyzed: ldan du zin kyang ni 'brel du zin kyang ngo //
translated: Even if it were to be possessed, even if it were to be related,

original: 'on kyang ste zhes bya ba rnam par rtog pas so //
analyzed: 'on kyang ste zhes bya ba rnam par rtog pas so //
translated: nevertheless, i.e., by way of conceptual differentiation.

original: lan ni mngon sum zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lan ni mngon sum zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The answer is: ‚Äúperception.‚Äù

original: rnam par rtog pa nyid kyis 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa nyid kyis 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because it operates by way of conceptual differentiation, that is the meaning.

original: de med na yang zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa ste mngon sum med na yang ngo //
analyzed: de med na yang zhes bya ba ni rtogs pa ste mngon sum med na yang ngo //
translated: Even if it does not exist, i.e., even if perception does not exist.

original: 'o na zhes bya ba ni lan no //üîΩphyogs 'di la yang lan btab zin zhes bya ba bshad pa'i don du dogs pa bsu ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na zhes bya ba ni lan no // phyogs 'di la yang lan btab zin zhes bya ba bshad pa'i don du dogs pa bsu ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Now, i.e., the answer.üîΩIn order to explain that the answer has already been given to this position, the objection is anticipated: ‚ÄúBut if it is said that the object of conceptual differentiation is not the object of perception, then the object of perception is not the object of conceptual differentiation.

original: 'o na mngon sum yang zhes bya ba ni lan no //üîΩ'on te ji ltar rnam par rtog pa tshad @111a * //
analyzed: 'o na mngon sum yang zhes bya ba ni lan no // 'on te ji ltar rnam par rtog pa tshad @111a * //
translated: Now, i.e., the answer.

original: ma ma yin zhes dogs na /
analyzed: ma ma yin zhes dogs na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúHow is conceptual differentiation not a valid cognition?‚Äù

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the answer is: ‚ÄúBecause it is not independent.‚Äù

original: mngon sum 'og rol zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum 'og rol zhes bya ba ni dogs pa bsu ba'o //
translated: The objection is anticipated: ‚ÄúBut perception is dependent.‚Äù

original: mngon sum gyi 'og rol gyi dus su 'jug pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa la mngon sum nus pa yod pa yin na zhes rnam par dbye ba bsgyur te 'brel to //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi 'og rol gyi dus su 'jug pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa la mngon sum nus pa yod pa yin na zhes rnam par dbye ba bsgyur te 'brel to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúif perception were to have the power to engage conceptual thought that operates after the perception‚Äù is to be supplied.

original: chod pas na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: chod pas na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause it is obstructed‚Äù is the response.

original: sgrub par byed pa dam pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa dam pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no valid cognition that is a supreme means of valid knowledge.

original: chod kyang zhes bya ba ni mngon sum mo //
analyzed: chod kyang zhes bya ba ni mngon sum mo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúeven though it is obstructed‚Äù refers to perception.

original: de lta na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: de lta na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin that case‚Äù is the response.

original: shes pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dogs pa ste /
analyzed: shes pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dogs pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause it is not consciousness‚Äù is the objection.

original: mig la sogs pa ni bems po ma yin pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ni bems po ma yin pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: The meaning is that visual consciousness and so on are not valid cognitions because they are not sentient beings.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag tu zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag tu zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin the case of the immediately preceding condition‚Äù is the response.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni 'jug par bya ba ma yin pa'i rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni 'jug par bya ba ma yin pa'i rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin the case of another‚Äù means in the case of a form that is not being perceived.

original: yul mtshungs pa nyid ni zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: yul mtshungs pa nyid ni zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe similarity of the object‚Äù is the response.

original: de tshad mar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de tshad mar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it would be a valid cognition.

original: 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i dogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i dogs pa ste /
translated: The doubt is: ‚ÄúIt is only a change.‚ÄùüîΩIf the immediately preceding condition is just the similarity of the object, then it is only a valid cognition.

original: de ma thag pa'i rkyen yul mtshungs pa nyid yin na tshad mar 'gyur ba kho na'o zhe na ma yin te zhes bya ba'i lan te /
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen yul mtshungs pa nyid yin na tshad mar 'gyur ba kho na'o zhe na ma yin te zhes bya ba'i lan te /
translated: The answer is: ‚ÄúNo.‚Äù

original: tshad ma zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: tshad ma zhes 'brel to //
translated: The word ‚Äúvalid cognition‚Äù is connected.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: de la zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de la zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause of that.‚Äù

original: shes pa med phyir ro zhes yongs su gcod par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'jug pa'i yul shes pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes pa med phyir ro zhes yongs su gcod par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'jug pa'i yul shes pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because of the absence of consciousness, it is not the object of engagement of consciousness, because it is not a determiner.

original: ji ltar mi shes pa zhe na skad cig ma snga ma zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar mi shes pa zhe na skad cig ma snga ma zhes gsungs so //
translated: How is it not known? He says, ‚Äúthe previous moment.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir de ltar mngon sum tshad ma yin pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar mngon sum tshad ma yin pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of that, direct perception is a valid cognition.

original: yongs su gcod par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ma grub par dogs pa bsu ba ni 'on te yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su gcod par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ma grub par dogs pa bsu ba ni 'on te yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because it is not a determiner, the reason is not established. Anticipating that, he says, ‚ÄúBut if it is not a determiner.‚Äù

original: de ltar na yang zhes bya ba ni lan te shes pa ma yin pa nyid ma grub na yang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar na yang zhes bya ba ni lan te shes pa ma yin pa nyid ma grub na yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúEven so‚Äù is the answer. Even if it is not established that it is not consciousness,

original: gzung ba 'dzin pas zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba 'dzin pas zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
translated: The objection is: ‚Äúbecause of the apprehension of the apprehended object.

original: lan ni 'jug par byed pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni 'jug par byed pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äù The answer is: ‚Äúbecause of the engagement.

original: rnam par rtog pa med par ni mngon sum 'jug byed du ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med par ni mngon sum 'jug byed du ma mthong ngo //
translated: ‚Äù We do not see that non-conceptual perception is an engagement.

original: des na rnam par rtog pa nyid 'jug par byed pa yin pas na tshad ma yin no ;
analyzed: des na rnam par rtog pa nyid 'jug par byed pa yin pas na tshad ma yin no ;
translated: Therefore, since conceptualization itself is the engagement, it is a valid cognition.

original: / ci dang 'dra ba zhe na /
analyzed: / ci dang 'dra ba zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: dper na zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The example is:

original: skad cig ma nyid rjes su dpog pa ni mngon sum gyi bzung ba la yang tshad ma yin pa de bzhin du rnam par rtog pa yang yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid rjes su dpog pa ni mngon sum gyi bzung ba la yang tshad ma yin pa de bzhin du rnam par rtog pa yang yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The inference of momentariness is a valid cognition with regard to what is apprehended by perception. In the same way, conceptualization is also. This is the meaning.

original: bzung ba la zin pa 'dzin pa yang 'jug par byed pa'i phyir ji ltar tshad ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: bzung ba la zin pa 'dzin pa yang 'jug par byed pa'i phyir ji ltar tshad ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that the apprehension of the apprehended object in the apprehension is a valid cognition, because it is an engagement?

original: @111b snang ba tsam gyis ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: @111b snang ba tsam gyis ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says: ‚Äúmerely by the appearance.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: ‚Äù Why is that?

original: skad cig ces smras so //
analyzed: skad cig ces smras so //
translated: He says: ‚Äúbecause of the momentariness.

original: 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes bya ba ni dogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes bya ba ni dogs pa ste /
translated: ‚Äù The objection is: ‚Äúit is just a change.

original: mngon sum gyis bzung bar ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis bzung bar ro //
translated: ‚Äù It is with regard to what is apprehended by perception.

original: skad cig ma zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: skad cig ma zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: ‚ÄúMoment‚Äù means ‚Äúreply.‚Äù

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBut‚Äù means ‚Äúdoubt.‚Äù

original: lan ni rnam par rtog pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni rnam par rtog pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reply is ‚ÄúConceptualization also.‚Äù

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni tha snyad sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni tha snyad sgrub pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù means ‚Äúthe establishment of convention.‚Äù

original: tshad mar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de'i rang bzhin rjes su dpog pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: tshad mar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni de'i rang bzhin rjes su dpog pa nyid kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúValid cognition‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause of the very inference of its nature.‚Äù

original: gal te de lta na gnyi ga yul gcig yin pa ji ltar yul gyi dbye bas tha dad par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na gnyi ga yul gcig yin pa ji ltar yul gyi dbye bas tha dad par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If that is so, how can there be a difference in the object, since both have the same object?

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore,

original: gang gi phyir rjes su dpag pa yang tshad ma yin pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rjes su dpag pa yang tshad ma yin pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: because inference is also a valid cognition,

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag 'byung par 'gyur ba'i yul 'jug par byed pa nyid du mtshungs pa yin pa yang bzung ba'i snang ba gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i dbye bas zhes bya bas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag 'byung par 'gyur ba'i yul 'jug par byed pa nyid du mtshungs pa yin pa yang bzung ba'i snang ba gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i dbye bas zhes bya bas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it is also similar to direct perception in being a means of engagement with the object that is to be produced, because of the difference between the clear and unclear appearance of the object.

original: ci'i phyir / bsam pa la ni slu med phyir //
analyzed: ci'i phyir / bsam pa la ni slu med phyir //
translated: Why? Because there is no deception in the intention.

original: 'khrul ba yin yang tshad ma nyid //
analyzed: 'khrul ba yin yang tshad ma nyid //
translated: Even though it is erroneous, it is still a valid cognition.

original: ces bya ba legs par brjod pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni des na gzhan gyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba legs par brjod pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni des na gzhan gyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is a good statement.

original: gal te mi slu ba med pa ji ltar gzhan gyis ngo bos rtogs she na /
analyzed: gal te mi slu ba med pa ji ltar gzhan gyis ngo bos rtogs she na /
translated: If it is not non-deceptive, how can it be a valid cognition?

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How?

original: mi slu ba las tshad ma yin yang /
analyzed: mi slu ba las tshad ma yin yang /
translated: Even though it is a valid cognition because it is non-deceptive,

original: tshad ma yang 'khrul pa dang 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba dper brjod pa ni /
analyzed: tshad ma yang 'khrul pa dang 'gal ba med do zhes bya ba dper brjod pa ni /
translated: it is not contradictory for it to be erroneous.

original: de kho na rig pa la rjes su dpag pa 'khrul pa yin yang tha snyad pa rnams la mi slu ba la ltos nas tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: de kho na rig pa la rjes su dpag pa 'khrul pa yin yang tha snyad pa rnams la mi slu ba la ltos nas tshad ma yin te /
translated: An example is that even though an inference is erroneous with respect to the knowledge of reality, it is a valid cognition with respect to the conventional world, because it is non-deceptive.

original: nor bu'i 'od la nor bur shes pa 'khrul pa yin yang /
analyzed: nor bu'i 'od la nor bur shes pa 'khrul pa yin yang /
translated: Even though the cognition of a jewel is erroneous with respect to the light of a jewel,

original: tha snyad pa la mi slu ba yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: tha snyad pa la mi slu ba yin pa bzhin no //
translated: it is non-deceptive with respect to the conventional world.

original: sgo gseb kyi bu ga na yod pa'i nor bu dbyibs kyi khyad par gang la yod pa de ni de skad ces brjod do //
analyzed: sgo gseb kyi bu ga na yod pa'i nor bu dbyibs kyi khyad par gang la yod pa de ni de skad ces brjod do //
translated: The jewel that has the special shape of a hole in a key is called that.

original: sgron ma'i 'od ces bya ba la yang sgo gseb kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa thams cad rjes su 'jug go //
analyzed: sgron ma'i 'od ces bya ba la yang sgo gseb kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa thams cad rjes su 'jug go //
translated: The light of the lamp is also like this, and so on, with the hole of the door and so forth.

original: khyad par med mod ces bya ba ni gnyi ga la yang sgo gseb kyi bu ga'i yul na nor bu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med mod ces bya ba ni gnyi ga la yang sgo gseb kyi bu ga'i yul na nor bu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no difference means that in both cases, the gem is not present in the place of the hole of the door.

original: 'ga' zhig ni yod pa kho na'o zhes bya ba ni nor bu'i 'od la'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni yod pa kho na'o zhes bya ba ni nor bu'i 'od la'o //
translated: But there is something present, means that the light of the gem is present.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni thob pas byas pa'i khyad par yod pas so //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni thob pas byas pa'i khyad par yod pas so //
translated: Therefore, means that because there is a difference made by attainment.

original: don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa'i shes pa yang gnod byed ma skyes na 'jug byed du mthong ngo zhes brjod pa ni nor bu ma mthong yang zhes bya ba ni /üîΩgal te 'khrul pa'i phyir na ji ltar gcig tshad ma @112a * //
analyzed: don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa'i shes pa yang gnod byed ma skyes na 'jug byed du mthong ngo zhes brjod pa ni nor bu ma mthong yang zhes bya ba ni / gal te 'khrul pa'i phyir na ji ltar gcig tshad ma @112a * //
translated: It is said that even when the object of error is not produced, one sees that which engages it, and even when the gem is not seen, and so on.

original: yin la gzhan ni ma yin zhe na 'khrul lo cog ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yin la gzhan ni ma yin zhe na 'khrul lo cog ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: If one asks, How is it that one is valid cognition and the other is not, because of error? it is said, All error....

original: ji ltar mi mtshungs snyam na /
analyzed: ji ltar mi mtshungs snyam na /
translated: If one thinks, How are they not similar?

original: tshogs pa'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: tshogs pa'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said, The collection....

original: rgyu tha dad las tha dad par ni gdon mi za bar 'dod dgos te /
analyzed: rgyu tha dad las tha dad par ni gdon mi za bar 'dod dgos te /
translated: It must be accepted that different effects arise from different causes.üîΩOtherwise, the various would become one.

original: de lta ma yin na sna tshogs gcig tu 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni shes pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na sna tshogs gcig tu 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni shes pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is said because of the existence of consciousness.

original: 'on kyang 'ga' zhig kho na'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'ga' zhig kho na'o //
translated: However, it is not so.

original: de lta ma yin na ji ltar 'khrul pa'i phyir gnyi ga tshad ma ma yin pa de bzhin du shes pa nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir thams cad 'khrul par 'gyur bas na mngon sum yang de bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ji ltar 'khrul pa'i phyir gnyi ga tshad ma ma yin pa de bzhin du shes pa nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir thams cad 'khrul par 'gyur bas na mngon sum yang de bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, just as the two are not valid cognitions because of being erroneous, in the same way, all would be erroneous because there is no difference in being consciousness. Therefore, direct perception would be like that.

original: gang gi phyir tshogs pa'i dbye bas tha dad pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshogs pa'i dbye bas tha dad pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the difference due to the difference in the collection, that is why.

original: 'khrul pa nyid yin na ji ltar mi slu bas 'gyur snyam du dogs pa bsu ba nas /
analyzed: 'khrul pa nyid yin na ji ltar mi slu bas 'gyur snyam du dogs pa bsu ba nas /
translated: If it is just erroneous, how could it be nondeceptive?

original: dpe brjod pa ni tshogs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dpe brjod pa ni tshogs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The example is stated in the line ‚Äúthe difference in the collection.‚Äù

original: ji ltar dngos po nyid la sogs par khyad par dang ldan par 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'khrul pa nyid du khyad par med kyang rgyu'i khyad par las 'ga' zhig mi slu ba dang ldan par 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po nyid la sogs par khyad par dang ldan par 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'khrul pa nyid du khyad par med kyang rgyu'i khyad par las 'ga' zhig mi slu ba dang ldan par 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: Just as a thing can be qualified as real, etc., in the same way, although there is no difference in error, some are qualified as non-deceptive due to the difference in causes.

original: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that others are not.

original: yang na gang gi phyir tshogs pa'i khyad par las khyad par de 'brel ba'i don gyis bskyed pa nyid gang la yod pa de ni de dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na gang gi phyir tshogs pa'i khyad par las khyad par de 'brel ba'i don gyis bskyed pa nyid gang la yod pa de ni de dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Or, because the difference is produced from the difference in the collection, that which has the meaning of connection is possessed by that.

original: des na 'khrul pa nyid yin yang mi spu ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na 'khrul pa nyid yin yang mi spu ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, although it is error, it is non-deceptive. This is the meaning.

original: rjes su dpag pa 'khrul pa las gzhan khyad par yod par brjod pa ni 'brel ba'i las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa 'khrul pa las gzhan khyad par yod par brjod pa ni 'brel ba'i las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement that there is a difference other than from erroneous inference is called the meaning of connection.

original: tshad ma skyes pa ste mngon sum skye pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma skyes pa ste mngon sum skye pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
translated: The cause of the arising of valid cognition, i.e., the cause of the arising of perception.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mngon par 'dod pa 'thob pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mngon par 'dod pa 'thob pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: For that very reason, it is the cause of obtaining the desired object.

original: dpe ston pa ni 'jug par byad pa'i mngon sum skye ba de ni rgyu mtshan de'i rang bzhin gyi rtags kyis bskyed pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: dpe ston pa ni 'jug par byad pa'i mngon sum skye ba de ni rgyu mtshan de'i rang bzhin gyi rtags kyis bskyed pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de bzhin no //
translated: The example is: just as that which is a knowledge inferring the nature of the reason for the arising of the direct perception that engages it.

original: mngon sum gyi don can gyi rjes su dpag pa bzhin du /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi don can gyi rjes su dpag pa bzhin du /
translated: Just as the direct perception is the object of the inference,

original: rjes su dpag pa ni tshad ma nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni tshad ma nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the inference is valid knowledge. This is the meaning.

original: bsgrub par bya ba ni rnam par 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba ni rnam par 'grel pa ni /
translated: The object to be established is the explanation.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The inference is what is called that.

original: mngon sum skye ba ni dus phyis 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum skye ba ni dus phyis 'byung ba'o //
translated: The arising of the direct perception is what occurs later.

original: dper rnam par 'grel pa ni mngon sum yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dper rnam par 'grel pa ni mngon sum yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The example is explained as follows: Just as the direct perception is also.

original: gal te mngon sum gyi sngon po la rjes su dpag pa med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum gyi sngon po la rjes su dpag pa med pa ma yin nam /
translated: If the direct perception of blue is not without inference,

original: ji ltar de dpe yin snyam na 'di ltar zhes @112b gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar de dpe yin snyam na 'di ltar zhes @112b gsungs so //
translated: how can that be an example? It is said to be like this.

original: sngon po'i mngon sum ni ma goms pa'o //
analyzed: sngon po'i mngon sum ni ma goms pa'o //
translated: The direct perception of blue is not familiar.

original: gal te nges pa yod na 'jug byed yin la /
analyzed: gal te nges pa yod na 'jug byed yin la /
translated: If there is certainty, it is engaging.

original: nges pa yang de'i rang bzhin gyis rjes su dpag pa yin no //
analyzed: nges pa yang de'i rang bzhin gyis rjes su dpag pa yin no //
translated: Certainty is also an inference by the nature of that.

original: des na mngon sum tshad mar byed pa rjes su dpag pa tshad mar bsgrubs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na mngon sum tshad mar byed pa rjes su dpag pa tshad mar bsgrubs so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the one who makes direct perception a valid cognition establishes inference as a valid cognition. This is the meaning.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i rgyu mtshan can mi slu ba'i rang bzhin gyi mngon sum yin par bgyid pa ni /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'i rgyu mtshan can mi slu ba'i rang bzhin gyi mngon sum yin par bgyid pa ni /
translated: The direct perception that has the reason of inferential valid cognition and is non-deceptive by nature is made to be

original: de bzhin rjes dpag ces bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin rjes dpag ces bya ste /
translated: like that, called inference.

original: 'jug par byed pa min zhes bya ba rjes su 'jug par bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa min zhes bya ba rjes su 'jug par bya ba'o //
translated: Not an engaging agent means that which is to be engaged.

original: mngon sum zhes bya ba ni dus phyis 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum zhes bya ba ni dus phyis 'byung ba'o //
translated: Direct perception is that which arises later.

original: 'o na 'di gnyis la khyad par ci yod snyam na mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gnyis kyi khyad par ni 'di nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'o na 'di gnyis la khyad par ci yod snyam na mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gnyis kyi khyad par ni 'di nyid yin te /
translated: If one thinks, What is the difference between these two? this is precisely the difference between direct perception and inference.

original: myong ba'i rjes dpag nyid 'jug byed ma yin pa la ma yin yang 'jug par byed pa'i mngon sum la yang sngar de'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pa la gdon mi za bar ltos par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: myong ba'i rjes dpag nyid 'jug byed ma yin pa la ma yin yang 'jug par byed pa'i mngon sum la yang sngar de'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pa la gdon mi za bar ltos par bya ba yin te /
translated: Even though the inference of experience is not an engaging agent, the direct perception that is an engaging agent must also undoubtedly rely on the prior inference by the nature of that.

original: de lta ma yin na der mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na der mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, it would not be a means of valid cognition.

original: 'das pa'i me la sogs pa bsgrub pa ma yin yang me la sogs pa sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa la lar ni gdon mi za bar phyis kyi mngon sum la ltos par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'das pa'i me la sogs pa bsgrub pa ma yin yang me la sogs pa sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa la lar ni gdon mi za bar phyis kyi mngon sum la ltos par bya ba yin te /
translated: Even though the past fire, etc., are not established, in some cases, the inference establishing the fire, etc., must depend on the subsequent perception, without fail.

original: de lta ma yin na so sor nges pa'i yul la the tshom za ba dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na so sor nges pa'i yul la the tshom za ba dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, it would not be free from doubt with regard to the object of particular cognition.

original: gnyi ga las gcig kyang gzhan la mi ltos pa zhes bya ba'i khyad par ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga las gcig kyang gzhan la mi ltos pa zhes bya ba'i khyad par ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no difference in the sense that one of the two does not depend on the other.

original: ji skad brjod pa'i snga ma dang phyi ma'i dngos po 'gog par byed pa'i phyed phyi mas khyad par yod par dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: ji skad brjod pa'i snga ma dang phyi ma'i dngos po 'gog par byed pa'i phyed phyi mas khyad par yod par dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: The second half of the verse anticipates the doubt that there is a difference, since it refutes the priority and posteriority as stated:

original: rjes su dpag las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúInference is not dependent on perception.‚Äù

original: 'di rkang pa gnyis pa 'chad pa ni ci ste yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di rkang pa gnyis pa 'chad pa ni ci ste yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The second line of the verse explains ‚Äúif it were not so.‚Äù

original: mngon sum ni rjes su dpag pa sngon du 'gro ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: mngon sum ni rjes su dpag pa sngon du 'gro ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Perception is not preceded by inference.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir khyad par yod pas ji ltar khyad par med nges zhes bya ba'i dogs pa'i don to //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir khyad par yod pas ji ltar khyad par med nges zhes bya ba'i dogs pa'i don to //
translated: because inference is preceded by direct perception, there is a difference. The meaning of the question is: ‚ÄúHow can there be no difference?‚Äù

original: gal te mngon sum skyes pas na rjes su dpag pa la mi ltos kyang tha snyad ni ltos pa kho na ste /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum skyes pas na rjes su dpag pa la mi ltos kyang tha snyad ni ltos pa kho na ste /
translated: If it is argued that although direct perception arises without depending on inference, convention definitely depends on it,

original: de lta ma yin na tshad ma nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na tshad ma nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: because otherwise it would not be tenable that it is a valid cognition,

original: de yang mi rung ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de yang mi rung ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then that is also unacceptable.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa tsam gyis so //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa tsam gyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù means ‚Äúby mere reflexive awareness.‚Äù

original: tshad ma yin yang zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med pa las gzhan ma grub bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshad ma yin yang zhes bya ba ni gnyis su med pa las gzhan ma grub bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúEven though it is a valid cognition‚Äù means that it is not established as anything other than nondual.

original: 'di nyid brjod pa ni mngon sum rang rig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid brjod pa ni mngon sum rang rig ces bya ba'o //
translated: This is stated in ‚Äúdirect perception is reflexive awareness.‚Äù

original: tha dad par yang mi 'grub bo zhes sbyar ro //üîΩde'i @113a * //
analyzed: tha dad par yang mi 'grub bo zhes sbyar ro // de'i @113a * //
translated: It is also not established as different.

original: phyir zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyir zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause it depends on inference.‚Äù

original: de ni mngon sum mo //
analyzed: de ni mngon sum mo //
translated: That is direct perception.

original: rkang pa dang po 'chad pa ni /üîΩmngon sum ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rkang pa dang po 'chad pa ni / mngon sum ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The first line of the verse is explained:

original: rjes su dpag pa'i dbang gis byung ba'i mngon sum mo //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i dbang gis byung ba'i mngon sum mo //
translated: ‚ÄúDirect perception‚Äù is the direct perception that arises by the power of inference.

original: mngon sum ni tha snyad la rjes su dpag pa la ltos so zhes rigs kyi rjes su dpag pa ni de la ltos pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum ni tha snyad la rjes su dpag pa la ltos so zhes rigs kyi rjes su dpag pa ni de la ltos pa ma yin te /
translated: Direct perception depends on inference in the case of conventional [objects], but the inference of a logical reason does not depend on that,

original: rang nyid nges pa'i bdag nyid can yin pas na tha snyad du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang nyid nges pa'i bdag nyid can yin pas na tha snyad du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has the nature of being ascertained by itself and thus functions conventionally.

original: mngon sum la ltos pa med pa nyid brjod pa ni /
analyzed: mngon sum la ltos pa med pa nyid brjod pa ni /
translated: To state that it does not depend on direct perception,

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it says ‚Äúthus.‚Äù

original: mngon sum la ma ltos na ji ltar don thob snyam na /
analyzed: mngon sum la ma ltos na ji ltar don thob snyam na /
translated: If it does not depend on direct perception, how does it attain its object?

original: nyid las zhes smos te /
analyzed: nyid las zhes smos te /
translated: It says ‚Äúfrom itself,‚Äù

original: rjes su dpag pa las so //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa las so //
translated: from inference.

original: de ma yin te zhes bya ba ni mngon sum la mi ltos pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ma yin te zhes bya ba ni mngon sum la mi ltos pa nyid do //
translated: That is not so, that it does not depend on direct perception.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mngon sum min na zhes smos te /
analyzed: mngon sum min na zhes smos te /
translated: It says ‚Äúif it is not direct perception,‚Äù

original: dus phyis 'byung ba med par ro //
analyzed: dus phyis 'byung ba med par ro //
translated: if it does not arise later.

original: dus phyis 'byung bar mngon sum nyid kyis /
analyzed: dus phyis 'byung bar mngon sum nyid kyis /
translated: If it arises later, it is direct perception itself.

original: so sor nges pa'i yul gyi khyad par can gyi me mthong bar nus pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: so sor nges pa'i yul gyi khyad par can gyi me mthong bar nus pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is able to see fire that has a particular object that is ascertained.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni phyogs kyi chos kyi stobs kyi yul gyi khyad par can rnam par 'jug par byed pa yin yang so sor nges pa'i yul gyi khyad par can nyid ni rnam par 'jig par byed pa ma yin te nges mngon sum la ltos pa yin
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni phyogs kyi chos kyi stobs kyi yul gyi khyad par can rnam par 'jug par byed pa yin yang so sor nges pa'i yul gyi khyad par can nyid ni rnam par 'jig par byed pa ma yin te nges mngon sum la ltos pa yin
translated: Although inference is engaged in having a particular object that is the power of the property of the subject, it is not engaged in a particular object that is ascertained, because it depends on direct perception.

original: no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: This is what is said in the line:

original: rjes su dpag pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúInference is not a valid means of knowledge.‚Äù

original: de ci'i phyir snyam na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir snyam na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rtsig pa la sogs pas zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rtsig pa la sogs pas zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said: ‚Äúbecause of walls, etc.‚Äù

original: gal te de lta na yang rjes su dpag pa mngon sum la ji ltar ltos snyam na rtsig pa'i phyi rol gyi zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang rjes su dpag pa mngon sum la ji ltar ltos snyam na rtsig pa'i phyi rol gyi zhes gsungs so //
translated: Even so, how does inference depend on direct perception? It is said: ‚Äúbecause of the outside of the wall.‚Äù

original: ci ste yang med de de ni yul ma nges pa can kho na yin te /
analyzed: ci ste yang med de de ni yul ma nges pa can kho na yin te /
translated: But if it does not exist, then it has only an indefinite object.

original: des na mngon sum gyi so sor nges pa'i yul dang 'dzin ces dogs na /
analyzed: des na mngon sum gyi so sor nges pa'i yul dang 'dzin ces dogs na /
translated: Therefore, if one doubts that it grasps the particular object of direct perception,

original: yul so sor zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: yul so sor zhes bya bar ro //
translated: it is said: ‚Äúthe particular object.‚Äù

original: rjes su dpag par rtogs par mi skye bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag par rtogs par mi skye bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: It would not be born from inference,

original: des mngon sum gyis yul gyi nges pa 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des mngon sum gyis yul gyi nges pa 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because it apprehends the object with certainty through direct perception.

original: rjes su dpag pa dang nor bu'i 'od la nor bur shes pa dag ni the tshom dang phyin ci log dag gis so sor nges pa'i yul ma bzung bar mtshungs so zhes brjod pa ni //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa dang nor bu'i 'od la nor bur shes pa dag ni the tshom dang phyin ci log dag gis so sor nges pa'i yul ma bzung bar mtshungs so zhes brjod pa ni //
translated: The knowledge that the light of a gem is a gem and inference are similar in not apprehending a certain object, because of doubt and error.

original: nor bu'i 'od la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nor bu'i 'od la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The knowledge that the light of a gem is a gem is like inference.

original: 'on te nyes pa 'di ni nor bu'i 'od la nor bur shes pa kho na yin gyi rjes su dpag pa'i ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te nyes pa 'di ni nor bu'i 'od la nor bur shes pa kho na yin gyi rjes su dpag pa'i ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But this fault is only in the knowledge that the light of a gem is a gem, and not in inference.

original: the tshom za dang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: the tshom za dang zhes gsungs so //
translated: The word ‚Äúdoubt‚Äù is stated.

original: nor bu'i 'od la nor bu'i shes pa las rjes su dpag pa'i khyad par dogs par byed pa ni 'on te yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nor bu'i 'od la nor bu'i shes pa las rjes su dpag pa'i khyad par dogs par byed pa ni 'on te yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The doubt that the knowledge that the light of a gem is a gem is different from inference is expressed by ‚ÄúBut if you say that . . . ‚Äù

original: rjes su dpag pa'i yul nges pa la yang the tshom gyi bdag nyid yin @113b pa'i phyir na de la 'jug par byed pa nyid du 'thad pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni gnyi ga'i cha la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i yul nges pa la yang the tshom gyi bdag nyid yin @113b pa'i phyir na de la 'jug par byed pa nyid du 'thad pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni gnyi ga'i cha la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: And because the object of inference is ascertained, it is not tenable that it engages it, since it has the nature of doubt. This is what is said in ‚Äúboth parts.‚Äù

original: phyin ci log ni de lta ma yin pa des ni 'jug par byed par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni phyin ci log ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log ni de lta ma yin pa des ni 'jug par byed par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni phyin ci log ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But error is not like that, so it would engage it. This is what is said in ‚Äúerror is not like that.‚Äù

original: the tshom ni zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: the tshom ni zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
translated: Doubt is explained in ‚Äúdoubt is.‚Äù

original: cha gnyis su zhen pa des na ston par byed pa ma yin pa des na de la 'jug par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: cha gnyis su zhen pa des na ston par byed pa ma yin pa des na de la 'jug par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since it is attached to two parts, it does not teach, so it does not engage it. This is the meaning.

original: gang gi phyir the tshom gyis der 'jug par byed pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang me tsam nyid yul khyad par yod par sgro 'dogs pas 'jug par byed pa yin pa des na cha tshod pa med pa des zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir the tshom gyis der 'jug par byed pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang me tsam nyid yul khyad par yod par sgro 'dogs pas 'jug par byed pa yin pa des na cha tshod pa med pa des zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because doubt does not engage it, but rather engages it by superimposing the mere existence of fire as a particular object, it is said, ‚Äúsince it lacks a portion.‚Äù

original: gal te de ltar yin na mngon sum nyid yul nges par byed pa yin pa'i phyir tshad ma yin gyi rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin na mngon sum nyid yul nges par byed pa yin pa'i phyir tshad ma yin gyi rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin te /
translated: If that is so, then since direct perception itself ascertains the object, it is a valid cognition, but it is not inference,

original: yul nye bar ma bstan pa zhig pa'i phyir ro zhe na /üîΩma yin te rjes su dpag pa 'ba' zhig yul la khyad par med pa rtogs pa de nyid mngon sum gyi yul nges par rnam par 'jig par byed pa des na mngon sum dang lhan cig bya ba gcig pa can gyi rjes su dpag pa ni yul khyad
analyzed: yul nye bar ma bstan pa zhig pa'i phyir ro zhe na / ma yin te rjes su dpag pa 'ba' zhig yul la khyad par med pa rtogs pa de nyid mngon sum gyi yul nges par rnam par 'jig par byed pa des na mngon sum dang lhan cig bya ba gcig pa can gyi rjes su dpag pa ni yul khyad
translated: because it does not reveal a previously unknown object.

original: par yod pa las byung ba nyes pa bdag gir byed pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: par yod pa las byung ba nyes pa bdag gir byed pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: That is not so, because inference alone is the ascertainment of the object, and that itself destroys the object of direct perception. Therefore, inference, which has the same function as direct perception, does not incur the fault of arising from a distinguished object.üîΩThis is the intended meaning.

original: nor bu'i 'od la nor bur shes pa'i phyin ci log kyang rjes su dpag pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa na bya ba tha dad pa'i nyes pa dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni nor bu'i 'od la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nor bu'i 'od la nor bur shes pa'i phyin ci log kyang rjes su dpag pa dang lhan cig tu gyur pa na bya ba tha dad pa'i nyes pa dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni nor bu'i 'od la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Also, the error of knowing a gem's light as the gem, when it occurs together with inference, does not incur the fault of having a different function. This is stated in the gem's light.

original: rjes su dpag pa las spong ba yin pa'i zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa las spong ba yin pa'i zhes 'brel to //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is connected with ‚Äúis excluded by inference.‚Äù

original: rjes su dpag pa las zhes bya ba ni gang zhig nor bu'i rnam pa snang ba de ni yul gzhan na yod pa'i nor bu las 'khrul pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa las zhes bya ba ni gang zhig nor bu'i rnam pa snang ba de ni yul gzhan na yod pa'i nor bu las 'khrul pa med pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúBy inference‚Äù means that whatever appears in the form of a gem is not erroneously inverted with respect to the gem that exists in another place,

original: dper na sngon nyams su myong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sngon nyams su myong ba bzhin no //
translated: just as it was experienced before.

original: sgo gseb kyi bu gan yang nor bu'i rnam pa snang ba yin no zhes bya ba'i de lta bu'i rang bzhin can las te /
analyzed: sgo gseb kyi bu gan yang nor bu'i rnam pa snang ba yin no zhes bya ba'i de lta bu'i rang bzhin can las te /
translated: The crevice in the wall also appears in the form of a gem.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas nye bar bstan pa las sngar nyid the tshom dang phyin ci log tu gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩde ltar na nor bu'i 'od la nor bur shes pa tshad ma yin pa nyid kyi dper bkod pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
