translated: The answer is ‚Äúin this case. ‚ÄùüîΩIn the ultimate sense, the cognition of the gem is the same as the cognition of the pillar, etc.

original: ji ltar ka ba la sogs pa'i shes pa nges pa la ltos pa rang gi yul las 'das pas de'i yul la mngon sum yin pa de bzhin du 'di la nor bur shes pa yin pas de ltar mtshungs pas na /
analyzed: ji ltar ka ba la sogs pa'i shes pa nges pa la ltos pa rang gi yul las 'das pas de'i yul la mngon sum yin pa de bzhin du 'di la nor bur shes pa yin pas de ltar mtshungs pas na /
translated: Just as the cognition of the pillar, etc., dependent on ascertainment, having passed beyond its own object, is a perception with regard to its object, so also is the cognition of the gem. Thus, it is the same.

original: mngon par rlom pa tshad ma yin pa las khyad par du 'grub pa ni log pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon par rlom pa tshad ma yin pa las khyad par du 'grub pa ni log pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is a wrong means of valid cognition, because it is not established as a means of valid cognition.

original: des na ma goms pa'i gnas skabs ni thams cad la 'jug pa'i yul ston par byed pa ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa sdom pa rtsom na yin gyi re re ni ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni ;
analyzed: des na ma goms pa'i gnas skabs ni thams cad la 'jug pa'i yul ston par byed pa ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa sdom pa rtsom na yin gyi re re ni ma yin zhes gsungs pa ni ;
translated: Therefore, in the context of non-familiarity, both direct perception and inference are taught as means of valid cognition that engage all objects, but not individually.

original: de ni gnyi ga tshad ma nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni gnyi ga tshad ma nyid ces bya'o //
translated: That is called the validity of both.

original: sgo gseb kyi bu ga'i yul gyi nor bu'i rnam pa can gyi nor bu'i 'od kyi shes pa ni 'di nor bu'o zhes nges pa'i yul gyi nor bu la mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin gyi rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: sgo gseb kyi bu ga'i yul gyi nor bu'i rnam pa can gyi nor bu'i 'od kyi shes pa ni 'di nor bu'o zhes nges pa'i yul gyi nor bu la mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin gyi rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: The cognition of the form of a jewel in the light of a jewel in the hole of a key-door is a direct means of valid cognition with regard to the jewel that is the object of the ascertainment This is a jewel, but it is not an inferential means of valid cognition.

original: de'i rjes su gang zhig nor bu'i rnam par snang ba zhes bya ba'i rjes su dpag pa yang nor bu de nyid la phyin ci log zlog par byed pa'i tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i rjes su gang zhig nor bu'i rnam par snang ba zhes bya ba'i rjes su dpag pa yang nor bu de nyid la phyin ci log zlog par byed pa'i tshad ma yin no //
translated: The inference that follows it, which is called that which appears in the form of a jewel, is also a means of valid cognition that reverses error with regard to that very jewel.

original: ji ltar ka ba la sogs pa'i shes pa mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin pa de'i rjes la the tshom za ba na de'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pa yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar ka ba la sogs pa'i shes pa mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin pa de'i rjes la the tshom za ba na de'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pa yin pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as the cognition of a pillar, etc. is a valid cognition of direct perception, and after that, when there is doubt, the inference of its nature.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag la /
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag la /
translated: As for direct perception and inference,

original: tshad ma gzhan ni yod la zhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin du rjes su dpag pa dang mngon sum mo //üîΩmngon par rlom pa med pas tha dad pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan ni yod la zhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin du rjes su dpag pa dang mngon sum mo // mngon par rlom pa med pas tha dad pa yin no zhe na /
translated: there is another valid cognition, which is inference and direct perception, respectively.üîΩIf you say that they are different because they are not conceited,

original: mngon par rlom pa med pa zhes bya ba de tsam gyis ni dngos po tha dad par 'gyur pa ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mngon par rlom pa med pa zhes bya ba de tsam gyis ni dngos po tha dad par 'gyur pa ma yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said that mere non-conceit does not make things different.

original: mngon par rlom pa de yod pa med pa dag la ni 'di la ni 'od la nor bur shes pa dang ka bar shes pa dang gnyis khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon par rlom pa de yod pa med pa dag la ni 'di la ni 'od la nor bur shes pa dang ka bar shes pa dang gnyis khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In the absence of that conceitedness, there is no difference between the cognition of light and the cognition of a pillar.

original: gang gi phyir khyad par med pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir khyad par med pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference.

original: mngon sum ma ma zhes bya ba la ni rang gi lugs so //
analyzed: mngon sum ma ma zhes bya ba la ni rang gi lugs so //
translated: As for direct perception, etc., it is our own system.

original: yang na rjes su dpag pa nyid ces bya ba ni sh'akya blo'i lugs so //
analyzed: yang na rjes su dpag pa nyid ces bya ba ni sh'akya blo'i lugs so //
translated: Or else, the system of ≈öƒÅkyabuddhi is that it is inference itself.

original: 'di ltar @115b nor bu'i 'od la nor bur shes pa ni 'khrul pa yin la mi slu bas tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar @115b nor bu'i 'od la nor bur shes pa ni 'khrul pa yin la mi slu bas tshad ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the cognition of a gem in the light of a gem is mistaken, but it is a valid cognition because it is non-deceptive.

original: gal te de lta na mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa las gzhan pa'i tshad ma gsum par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de lta na mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa las gzhan pa'i tshad ma gsum par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If that is so, it follows that there is a third valid cognition other than perception and inference,

original: 'di ltar 'di re zhig mngon sum mi 'du ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di re zhig mngon sum mi 'du ste /
translated: because this is not included in perception,

original: 'khrul ba'i phyir dang rtog pa dang bcas pa'i phyir /üîΩrjes su dpag pa'ang ma yin te rtags las skyes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul ba'i phyir dang rtog pa dang bcas pa'i phyir / rjes su dpag pa'ang ma yin te rtags las skyes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is mistaken and because it is conceptual.üîΩIt is not inference because it does not arise from a reason.

original: tshad ma ma yin pa yang ma yin te dngos po la mi slu ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pa yang ma yin te dngos po la mi slu ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: It is not a nonvalid cognition because it is nondeceptive with regard to things.

original: 'di la brjod pa tshad ma gzhan du thal ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa tshad ma gzhan du thal ba ma yin te /
translated: In response to this, it is said that it does not follow that it is another valid cognition,

original: rjes su dpag pa kho nar 'du ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa kho nar 'du ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is included in inference alone.

original: 'di ltar rjes su dpag pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid ni 'brel pa can gyi don gzhan las lkog tu gyur pa'i don rtogs pa ni rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes rjes su dpag pa yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar rjes su dpag pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid ni 'brel pa can gyi don gzhan las lkog tu gyur pa'i don rtogs pa ni rjes su dpag pa yin no zhes rjes su dpag pa yin /
translated: Thus, the general definition of inference is: ‚ÄúInference is the cognition of a thing not in contact with the senses through a thing that is related to it.‚Äù

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid de ma thag tu 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid de ma thag tu 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The general definition of inference will be explained immediately below.

original: 'dir ni nor bu dang 'brel pa'i nor bu'i 'od ni de'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dang nor bu'i 'od de las kyang nor bur 'khrul pa skye bas na /
analyzed: 'dir ni nor bu dang 'brel pa'i nor bu'i 'od ni de'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dang nor bu'i 'od de las kyang nor bur 'khrul pa skye bas na /
translated: Here, the light of the gem, which is related to the gem, is the effect of the gem, and from that light of the gem, the error of the gem arises.

original: de'i 'bras bu'i rtags las skyes pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu'i rtags las skyes pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, because it arises from the reason of its effect, it is only inference.

original: gal te rtags du ba las rtags can las shes pa skye ba nas du ba nyid la me sgron 'dogs pas 'jug pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang yul phyogs gzhan du yin no //
analyzed: gal te rtags du ba las rtags can las shes pa skye ba nas du ba nyid la me sgron 'dogs pas 'jug pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang yul phyogs gzhan du yin no //
translated: If the cognition of the thing to be inferred arises from the reason, smoke, it is not that the light of the fire is superimposed on the smoke itself, but rather on another place.

original: nor bur 'khrul pa ni rtags nor bu'i 'od nyid la rtags can sgro 'dogs par byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: nor bur 'khrul pa ni rtags nor bu'i 'od nyid la rtags can sgro 'dogs par byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: The error of the gem is the superimposition of the thing to be inferred on the light of the gem itself, which is the reason.

original: de las chir 'gyur 'di tsam gyis ni 'brel pa can las skyes pa nyams pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de las chir 'gyur 'di tsam gyis ni 'brel pa can las skyes pa nyams pa ma yin no //
translated: But this much is not a denial of the fact that the cognition has arisen from a related object.

original: yul gzhan du sgro 'dogs pa lag pa yod do zhes bya ba 'di tsam zhig brjod par bya ba yin na ni /
analyzed: yul gzhan du sgro 'dogs pa lag pa yod do zhes bya ba 'di tsam zhig brjod par bya ba yin na ni /
translated: If the mere statement ‚ÄúThe object exists‚Äù is to be made in regard to another place,

original: yul de nyid du nor bu thob par byed pa nyid kyis ni tshad mar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: yul de nyid du nor bu thob par byed pa nyid kyis ni tshad mar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: then the cognition is not valid in regard to that very place, because it is the cause of the attainment of the jewel.

original: nor bu tsam thob pas rjes su dpag pa yin pa sus kyang bzlog tu med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nor bu tsam thob pas rjes su dpag pa yin pa sus kyang bzlog tu med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: And it is undeniable that the inference is of the jewel alone, because of the attainment of the jewel.

original: thams cad la yang yul la 'khrul pa ni 'dod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: thams cad la yang yul la 'khrul pa ni 'dod pa kho na'o //
translated: And in all cases, error in regard to the object is admitted.

original: nor bur 'khrul pa rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog par dran pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: nor bur 'khrul pa rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog par dran pa med do zhe na /
translated: But there is no memory of the concomitance and nonconcomitance of the error in regard to the jewel.

original: med mod de tsam gyis rjes su dpag par mi 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: med mod de tsam gyis rjes su dpag par mi 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: But even though there is none, it is not the case that there is no inference of that much.

original: gang zhig rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa ma dran par mod kho nar du ba las me rtogs pa'i shes pa de rjes su dpag par mi 'dod dam cig / tshul gsum pa'i rtags las de skyes pa yin @116a * //
analyzed: gang zhig rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa ma dran par mod kho nar du ba las me rtogs pa'i shes pa de rjes su dpag par mi 'dod dam cig / tshul gsum pa'i rtags las de skyes pa yin @116a * //
translated: Or do you not want to accept that the cognition which understands fire from smoke is an inference, because it does not remember the concomitance?

original: te ; de tsam gyis na rjes su dpag pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: te ; de tsam gyis na rjes su dpag pa nyid yin no //
translated: It is produced from a mark having three modes, and that much is what it means to be an inference.

original: sgo gseb kyi bu ga'i yul gyi nor bu'i 'od shes pas khang pa'i phug gi yul na nor bu'i rang bzhin ma bzung ba'i phyir na ji ltar mngon sum yin te /
analyzed: sgo gseb kyi bu ga'i yul gyi nor bu'i 'od shes pas khang pa'i phug gi yul na nor bu'i rang bzhin ma bzung ba'i phyir na ji ltar mngon sum yin te /
translated: Since the cognition of the light of a jewel in the opening of a door does not apprehend the nature of the jewel in the interior of a house, how can it be perception?

original: ka ba la sogs pa'i shes pa ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin shes pa ma yin yang de'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i phyir mngon sum yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ka ba la sogs pa'i shes pa ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin shes pa ma yin yang de'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa'i phyir mngon sum yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The cognition of a pillar, etc., is not the cognition of the nature of what is to be produced, but it is perception because it apprehends its nature.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba thob par bya ba'i rang bzhin de la bzung na /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba thob par bya ba'i rang bzhin de la bzung na /
translated: If it apprehends that nature of what is to be produced, which is to be attained,

original: shes ba dang shes bya'i rang bzhin de nam gzhan gyi 'byung bar 'gyur ba las gzhan 'dzin pa'i shes pa snga ma de ni gnyi ga la yang mtshungs pa nyid do //
analyzed: shes ba dang shes bya'i rang bzhin de nam gzhan gyi 'byung bar 'gyur ba las gzhan 'dzin pa'i shes pa snga ma de ni gnyi ga la yang mtshungs pa nyid do //
translated: The nature of the cognition and the cognized is the same in both cases, i.e., in the case of the prior cognition apprehending the other, and in the case of the other.

original: des na gnyi ga la yang mngon sum yin pa'am yang na ni 'ga' yang ma yin no //
analyzed: des na gnyi ga la yang mngon sum yin pa'am yang na ni 'ga' yang ma yin no //
translated: Thus, either both are direct perception, or neither is.

original: de'i rang bzhin ma bzung ba de ltar thob ce na /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ma bzung ba de ltar thob ce na /
translated: If the nature of that is not apprehended, how can it be obtained?

original: gnyi ga ltar yang zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang zhes gsungs te /
translated: The response is ‚Äúin both cases.‚Äù

original: de'i bdag nyid dam de las byung ba'i 'brel pa las kyang ngo //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid dam de las byung ba'i 'brel pa las kyang ngo //
translated: Either in the nature of that, or in the connection that arises from that.

original: de skad du yod do //üîΩde bdag de las byung ba yi //
analyzed: de skad du yod do // de bdag de las byung ba yi //
translated: This is stated.üîΩThe power of that, which arises from that,

original: mthu yis zhes pa tshad ma nyid //
analyzed: mthu yis zhes pa tshad ma nyid //
translated: is valid cognition.

original: ces bshad zin to //
analyzed: ces bshad zin to //
translated: This has already been explained.

original: thob par bya ba'i zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: thob par bya ba'i zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTo be obtained‚Äù will be explained.

original: ji ltar khyad par med de /
analyzed: ji ltar khyad par med de /
translated: How is there no difference?

original: gang gi phyir nor bu dang de'i 'od la ni snang ba tha dad pa yod do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir nor bu dang de'i 'od la ni snang ba tha dad pa yod do //
translated: Because there is a difference in the appearance of the gem and its light.

original: des na mig ser por shes pa bzhin du nor bu snang ba tsam ni mngon sum ltar snang ba yin no zhes dogs na ni nor bu snang ba ni nor bu nyid dang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na mig ser por shes pa bzhin du nor bu snang ba tsam ni mngon sum ltar snang ba yin no zhes dogs na ni nor bu snang ba ni nor bu nyid dang zhes gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, if you suspect that the mere appearance of the jewel is like the direct perception of the knowledge that the eye is yellow, then it is said that the appearance of the jewel is the jewel itself.

original: des na nor bu'i 'od la nor bu snang ba tsam ma yin te /
analyzed: des na nor bu'i 'od la nor bu snang ba tsam ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the light of the jewel is not merely the appearance of the jewel.

original: bden pa'i nor bu'i snang ba dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa'i nor bu'i snang ba dang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference between the appearance of the jewel and the true jewel.

original: gal te snang ba khyad par med kyang nor bu'i 'od la nor bur shes pa ni yul la 'khrul pa yin la nor bu'i shes pa ni de lta ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te snang ba khyad par med kyang nor bu'i 'od la nor bur shes pa ni yul la 'khrul pa yin la nor bu'i shes pa ni de lta ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If the appearance is not different, but the knowledge of the jewel in the light of the jewel is mistaken with respect to the object, but the knowledge of the jewel is not like that,

original: de la la lar ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de la la lar ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: then it is said that in some places.

original: 'khrul pa nyid du yang khyad par yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'khrul pa nyid du yang khyad par yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no difference even in being mistaken.

original: spyi'i zhes pa las spyi ni me tsam mo //
analyzed: spyi'i zhes pa las spyi ni me tsam mo //
translated: From the general, the general is just fire.

original: de'i rjes su dpag pa ni 'dir 'ga' zhig na me yod do snyam pa'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes su dpag pa ni 'dir 'ga' zhig na me yod do snyam pa'i shes pa ste /
translated: Inference of that is the knowledge here that thinks, Fire exists somewhere.

original: de ni gnyi ga la yang 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni gnyi ga la yang 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: That is mistaken with respect to both.

original: 'dis ni tshu rol mdzes pa la sogs pa gsal ba ma yin no zhes mjug sdud pa ni //
analyzed: 'dis ni tshu rol mdzes pa la sogs pa gsal ba ma yin no zhes mjug sdud pa ni //
translated: This concludes the summary.

original: des na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù means:

original: ji ltar rigs pa ma yin snyam na /
analyzed: ji ltar rigs pa ma yin snyam na /
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúHow is it not reasonable? ‚Äù

original: mngon sum yang zhes bya @116b ba'o ;
analyzed: mngon sum yang zhes bya @116b ba'o ;
translated: ‚Äú Even direct perception‚Äù is the response.

original: / rang gi ngo bo la ltos nas ma 'khrul pa nyid yin na ni thams cad kyang ma 'khrul pa nyid yin du 'gyur ba des na tshad ma dang gzhan pa'i rnam par dbye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni rang gi ngo bo la ni zhes
analyzed: / rang gi ngo bo la ltos nas ma 'khrul pa nyid yin na ni thams cad kyang ma 'khrul pa nyid yin du 'gyur ba des na tshad ma dang gzhan pa'i rnam par dbye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni rang gi ngo bo la ni zhes
translated: If it were non-erroneous in relation to its own nature, then everything would be non-erroneous. Therefore, there would be no distinction between valid cognition and other [cognitions]. This is stated in ‚ÄúIn relation to its own nature, however. . . . ‚Äù

original: bya ba'o // de ltar zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo la ltos pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: bya ba'o // de ltar zhes bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo la ltos pa nyid kyis so //
translated: ‚Äú In that case‚Äù means in relation to its own nature.

original: gang de lta na zhes bya ba ni mngon sum yang 'khrul pa yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang de lta na zhes bya ba ni mngon sum yang 'khrul pa yin pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú If that is so‚Äù means even direct perception is erroneous.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni dran par byed do //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni dran par byed do //
translated: ‚Äú In this regard‚Äù reminds [the reader].

original: de ltar ni zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar ni zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú In that case‚Äù is the objection.

original: gsal ba dang mi gsal bar ro //
analyzed: gsal ba dang mi gsal bar ro //
translated: ‚Äú Clear and unclear‚Äù is the response.üîΩ‚Äú If that is so‚Äù is the objection.

original: gang zhig ces bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba ni lan no //
translated: ‚Äú What is that? ‚Äù is the response.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ni rang rgyud nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni rang rgyud nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy which‚Äù refers to the self-sense, etc.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni 'dzin pa po rang dbang nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni 'dzin pa po rang dbang nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat itself‚Äù refers to the self-sense, etc.

original: gal te don gyi nus pa las blo skye ba de ni rang rgyud nyid dang / bar chad med par 'dzin pa yin pas de ni mngon sum yin te /
analyzed: gal te don gyi nus pa las blo skye ba de ni rang rgyud nyid dang / bar chad med par 'dzin pa yin pas de ni mngon sum yin te /
translated: If the cognition arises from the potentiality of the object, it is the self-sense, and it is the apprehension without interruption, so it is perception.

original: don gyi nus pa nyid ji ltar rtogs snyam na /
analyzed: don gyi nus pa nyid ji ltar rtogs snyam na /
translated: How is the potentiality of the object itself understood?

original: rjes 'gro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rjes 'gro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúconcomitant‚Äù is supplied.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni rang dbang du 'dzin pa'i don las gzhan zhes bya ba gzhan gyi dbang gis gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni rang dbang du 'dzin pa'i don las gzhan zhes bya ba gzhan gyi dbang gis gzung bar bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that‚Äù means that the object of the self-sense is apprehended as other than the object of the heterosense.

original: dngos su snang ba yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos su snang ba yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe direct appearance‚Äù is supplied.

original: rkang pa lhag ma 'grel pa ni /
analyzed: rkang pa lhag ma 'grel pa ni /
translated: The commentary supplies the rest of the verse:

original: gal la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it is not so, etc.‚Äù

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid las so //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid las so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the same way‚Äù means from the specific property.

original: ji ltar de dbang po las 'das pa yin snyam na /
analyzed: ji ltar de dbang po las 'das pa yin snyam na /
translated: How can it be beyond the senses?

original: de la ni zhes gsungs te gang zhig bag chags sad pas snang ba'i yul du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de la ni zhes gsungs te gang zhig bag chags sad pas snang ba'i yul du gyur pa'o //
translated: The word then is used in the sense of when.

original: ji ltar rjes su dpag pa'i yul dbang po las 'das te dngos po nyid las rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes phyir rgol ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rjes su dpag pa'i yul dbang po las 'das te dngos po nyid las rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes phyir rgol ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The opponent's objection is stated in the words because the object of inference is beyond the senses, it is understood from the thing itself. The response to this is given in the words if you say....

original: 'on te rjes su dpag pas rnam par rtog kyang me'i rang bzhin ma rtogs pa'i phyir lkog tu gyur pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te rjes su dpag pas rnam par rtog kyang me'i rang bzhin ma rtogs pa'i phyir lkog tu gyur pa yin no snyam na /
translated: If it is thought that although it is conceived by inference, it is hidden because the nature of fire is not understood,

original: de'i rnam pa las zhes smras so //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa las zhes smras so //
translated: the response is given in the words from its form....

original: des na zhes bya bas ni rjes su dpag pas so //
analyzed: des na zhes bya bas ni rjes su dpag pas so //
translated: The word then refers to inference.

original: gang zhig ces bya ba ni me'i rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba ni me'i rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The words that which... refer to the specific characteristic of fire.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'i dogs pa bsu ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'i dogs pa bsu ba'o //
translated: The word if introduces the opponent's objection.

original: 'ongs zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: 'ongs zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The response is given in the words it is not....

original: 'on te brgya la rgol ba 'di ltar khas len no snyam na /
analyzed: 'on te brgya la rgol ba 'di ltar khas len no snyam na /
translated: If it is thought that in some cases the opponent may accept this,

original: de ni de ltar zhes smras te dbang po'i byed pa med pas lkog tu gyur pa nyid yin par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de ltar zhes smras te dbang po'i byed pa med pas lkog tu gyur pa nyid yin par ni ma yin te /
translated: the response is given in the words it is not... It is not the case that it is hidden because there is no activity of the senses.

original: yid la sogs pa'i mngon sum med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid la sogs pa'i mngon sum med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that there would be no direct perception of the mental faculty, etc.

original: gang gi phyir rjes su dpag pa dngos po'i rang bzhin mthong ba yang yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rjes su dpag pa dngos po'i rang bzhin mthong ba yang yin la /
translated: Because inference is the seeing of the nature of an entity,

original: lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can gang yin par ni 'gal ba de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can gang yin par ni 'gal ba de'i phyir ro //
translated: and it is the subject that has an object that is hidden, this is contradictory.

original: mi snang ba lkog tu gyur pa'i yul gang la yod pa de la de skad ces @117a * //
analyzed: mi snang ba lkog tu gyur pa'i yul gang la yod pa de la de skad ces @117a * //
translated: That which has an object that is not manifest and hidden is called ‚Äúthat which has a hidden object.‚Äù

original: brjod do // gal te rjes su dpog pa'i rtog pa de lta bu yin na /
analyzed: brjod do // gal te rjes su dpog pa'i rtog pa de lta bu yin na /
translated: If the conception of inference is like this,

original: de'i tshe dngos mthong min te /
analyzed: de'i tshe dngos mthong min te /
translated: then at that time it is not the seeing of an entity,

original: dngos po 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it does not apprehend an entity.

original: dngos po mthong ba yin na yang lkog tu gyur pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: dngos po mthong ba yin na yang lkog tu gyur pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: If it were the seeing of an entity, it would not be hidden.

original: rtog pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtog pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is said.

original: 'di nyid rnam par 'grel pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid rnam par 'grel pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The analysis of this is ‚ÄúIf it is the seeing of an entity. . . .‚Äù

original: dngos po la zhes bya ba ni phyed snga ma 'chad pa ste bskal pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po la zhes bya ba ni phyed snga ma 'chad pa ste bskal pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúof an entity‚Äù in the first half of the verse is explained as ‚Äúof a hidden entity.‚Äù

original: khyed kyi lugs la yang rjes su dpag pa lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can nyid du mi 'grub bo zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: khyed kyi lugs la yang rjes su dpag pa lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can nyid du mi 'grub bo zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
translated: In your system, inference is not established as having a hidden object.

original: 'o na spyi'i zhes bya ba'o //üîΩ'di ni 'chad pa ni de la spyi ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na spyi'i zhes bya ba'o // 'di ni 'chad pa ni de la spyi ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is: But in your system, too, there is no establishment of a hidden object.üîΩThe explanation of this is: In your system, too, there is no establishment of a hidden object.

original: brgyud pas dngos po'i yul can nyid du dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: brgyud pas dngos po'i yul can nyid du dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: Anticipating the objection that it is an object of a thing by way of a continuum, it is said:

original: mtshan par byas pa'i spyis mtshon par nges /
analyzed: mtshan par byas pa'i spyis mtshon par nges /
translated: By the generality that is indicated, there is certainty of indication.

original: dngos po rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /üîΩspyi dang khyad par gyi rang bzhin dag gis mtshon par srid pas na /
analyzed: dngos po rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhe na / spyi dang khyad par gyi rang bzhin dag gis mtshon par srid pas na /
translated: Because of the understanding of the thing, one might say.

original: dri ba ni khyad par rang bzhin gang gis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dri ba ni khyad par rang bzhin gang gis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since it is possible to indicate by the natures of generality and particularity, the question is: By what particular nature?

original: khyad par gyi mtshon pa las nyes pa brjod pa ni /üîΩgal te zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: khyad par gyi mtshon pa las nyes pa brjod pa ni / gal te zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The statement of the fault from the indication of the particular is:

original: khyad par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par rtogs pa'o //
translated: If, by the particular nature, there is the understanding of the particular,üîΩthen there is the understanding of the particular from sound, etc.

original: sgra la sogs pa nyid las zhes bya ba ni mtshon par byas pa'i rmi lam ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa nyid las zhes bya ba ni mtshon par byas pa'i rmi lam ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: not from the indicated generality in a dream.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bar mdo'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bar mdo'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: For that very reason, it is said: In between.

original: spyis mtshan pa la yang nyes ba brjod pa ni /
analyzed: spyis mtshan pa la yang nyes ba brjod pa ni /
translated: The fault in the case of the indication by the universal is stated:

original: spyi'i rang bzhin gyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyi'i rang bzhin gyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: by the nature of the universal.

original: 'o na khyad par nyid kyis mtshon no snyam na /
analyzed: 'o na khyad par nyid kyis mtshon no snyam na /
translated: If you think that it is indicated by the particular itself,

original: bshad zin pa'i nyes pa tshad yod par byas nas gzhan brjod pa ni khyad par gyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bshad zin pa'i nyes pa tshad yod par byas nas gzhan brjod pa ni khyad par gyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the other fault is stated, having made the previously stated fault limited: by the particular.

original: spyi snang ba dang khyad par ni mi snang ba na lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can nyid du zhes bya bar dogs pa bsu ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyi snang ba dang khyad par ni mi snang ba na lkog tu gyur pa'i yul can nyid du zhes bya bar dogs pa bsu ba ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the universal appears and the particular does not appear, then the doubt is anticipated: Is it a subject that has an imperceptible object?

original: 'di yang zhes bya ba ni lan te /
analyzed: 'di yang zhes bya ba ni lan te /
translated: The answer is: This also.

original: sangs rgyas pa'i lugs la'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa'i lugs la'o //
translated: This is in the Buddhist system.

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'o //
translated: How? is the dispute.

original: de yul nyid yin zhes bya ba ni yul yin pa'o //
analyzed: de yul nyid yin zhes bya ba ni yul yin pa'o //
translated: Is that itself the object?

original: de la zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The answer is: That.

original: ma brtags zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: ma brtags zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The answer is: Unanalyzed.

original: thams cad du zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: thams cad du zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The answer is: Everywhere.

original: ci la lar de ltar mthong ngam snyam du dogs na /
analyzed: ci la lar de ltar mthong ngam snyam du dogs na /
translated: If you doubt that it is seen in some places in that way,

original: lhas byin zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: lhas byin zhes gsungs so //
translated: it is said: Devadatta.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni dogs pa ste mtshungs pa mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni dogs pa ste mtshungs pa mthong ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the doubt, the appearance of similarity.

original: 'dir slu ba yin na rjes su dpag pa la yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dir slu ba yin na rjes su dpag pa la yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that if there is deception, then there is also inference.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni slu ba nyid 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni slu ba nyid 'gog pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNo‚Äù is the refutation of deception.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'chad pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'chad pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause of the explanation.‚Äù

original: 'chad par 'gyur pa'i rgyu des gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur pa'i rgyu des gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the reason for the explanation?

original: 'brel pa las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause of the connection.‚Äù

original: gal te bag chags kyi stobs las byung ba'i phyir rjes su dpag pa @117b 'khrul pa nyid yin na gang gis mi slu bar gyur pa'i don dang 'brel pa ni /
analyzed: gal te bag chags kyi stobs las byung ba'i phyir rjes su dpag pa @117b 'khrul pa nyid yin na gang gis mi slu bar gyur pa'i don dang 'brel pa ni /
translated: If inference is deceptive because it arises from the power of latent impressions, then why is it connected with a nondeceptive object?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te 'di zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te 'di zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Anticipating this doubt, he says, ‚ÄúIf it is this . . .‚Äù

original: don ni rjes su dpag par bya ba'o //
analyzed: don ni rjes su dpag par bya ba'o //
translated: The object is what is to be inferred.

original: ma yin zhes bya ba ni bag chags 'ba' zhig dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba nges pa 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin zhes bya ba ni bag chags 'ba' zhig dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba nges pa 'gog pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNo‚Äù is the refutation of the certainty that it is connected only with latent impressions.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bag chags zhes gsungs te sad par byed pa'i rtags kyang ngo //
analyzed: bag chags zhes gsungs te sad par byed pa'i rtags kyang ngo //
translated: The sign that awakens the latent impressions is also that.

original: de lta na yang ji ltar don dang 'brel ba yin snyam na /
analyzed: de lta na yang ji ltar don dang 'brel ba yin snyam na /
translated: Even so, how is there a relation to the object?

original: don ni bag chags sad par byed pa de dang 'brel pas rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: don ni bag chags sad par byed pa de dang 'brel pas rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes 'brel to //
translated: The object is related to the awakening of the latent impressions, because it is the cause.

original: 'di nyid ces bya ba ni don dang 'brel pa'o ;
analyzed: 'di nyid ces bya ba ni don dang 'brel pa'o ;
translated: This very is the relation to the object.üîΩIf the object is not examined by the understanding of itself, how can it be related to that? It is said that it is not seen.üîΩOr, if something is not understood by itself, how can it be understood by another? It is said that it is not seen.

original: / gal te don rang gi go bas ma brtags na ji ltar der 'brel pa med pa yin snyam na ma mthong zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: / gal te don rang gi go bas ma brtags na ji ltar der 'brel pa med pa yin snyam na ma mthong zhes gsungs so //
translated: Or, if something is not understood by itself, how can it be understood by another? It is said that it is not seen.

original: yang na gal te yang gang zhig rang gi ngo bos ma rtogs pa de gzhan gyis brtags kyang de yod do zhes gang las yin te /üîΩgtso bo la sogs pa ni de ltar rtogs kyang yod pa ni ma yin no zhes dogs na /üîΩma mthong zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yang na gal te yang gang zhig rang gi ngo bos ma rtogs pa de gzhan gyis brtags kyang de yod do zhes gang las yin te / gtso bo la sogs pa ni de ltar rtogs kyang yod pa ni ma yin no zhes dogs na / ma mthong zhes gsungs so //
translated: Or, if something is not understood by itself, how can it be understood by another? It is said that it is not seen.üîΩOr, if something is not understood by itself, how can it be understood by another? It is said that it is not seen.

original: rang gi rang bzhin mthong ba gzhan las rtogs pa ha cang thal ba spong ba ni gal te zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rang gi rang bzhin mthong ba gzhan las rtogs pa ha cang thal ba spong ba ni gal te zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Or, if something is not understood by itself, how can it be understood by another? It is said that it is not seen.üîΩOr, if something is not understood by

original: bsgrub par bya ba brten pa'i chos can nam /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba brten pa'i chos can nam /
translated: The property to be established is the property of the subject.

original: yang na chos can de du ba gang la yod pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i chos dang 'brel pa can de nges pa nyid de nges par byed pa yin na de'i tshe gzhan go bar byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yang na chos can de du ba gang la yod pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i chos dang 'brel pa can de nges pa nyid de nges par byed pa yin na de'i tshe gzhan go bar byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Or, the property of the subject that is related to the proving property that is present in the smoke is the very ascertainment. If it is the producer of ascertainment, then it is the other‚Äôs understanding.

original: gang gi ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba gzhan tsam gyis ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba gzhan tsam gyis ma yin no //
translated: It is not just the other‚Äôs mere consequence.

original: rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Its own nature‚Äù will be explained.

original: 'brel pa chos can dang bsgrub bya dag dang ngo //
analyzed: 'brel pa chos can dang bsgrub bya dag dang ngo //
translated: The relation is between the property of the subject and the probandum.

original: gang gi 'brel pa zhes khyad par du byed pa gang yang rung ba las rtogs pa nyes pa ci yod snyam na gzhan la zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi 'brel pa zhes khyad par du byed pa gang yang rung ba las rtogs pa nyes pa ci yod snyam na gzhan la zhes gsungs te /
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúWhat is wrong with the qualification ‚Äòthe relation of which‚Äô in ‚Äòthe understanding from that relation‚Äô?‚Äù then ‚Äúthe other‚Äù is stated.

original: de'i phyir 'brel pa can kho na las rtogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'brel pa can kho na las rtogs pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the understanding is only from the related object.

original: gzhan tsam rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin no zhes gnas so //
analyzed: gzhan tsam rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin no zhes gnas so //
translated: It is not from the mere other by its own nature.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bshad pa gal te rten dang zhes bya ba la chos can dang / de dang zhes bya ba la bsgrub par bya ba dang ngo //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bshad pa gal te rten dang zhes bya ba la chos can dang / de dang zhes bya ba la bsgrub par bya ba dang ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is said: ‚ÄúIf it is said that the basis . . .‚Äù The subject is the basis. ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the probandum.

original: 'di la ji ltar zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa nyid 'chad pa ni 'brel pa las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la ji ltar zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa nyid 'chad pa ni 'brel pa las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of the objection, ‚ÄúHow is that?‚Äù is ‚ÄúFrom a connection . . . .‚Äù

original: 'dra ba las kyang zhes bya ba ni ma 'brel pa las so //
analyzed: 'dra ba las kyang zhes bya ba ni ma 'brel pa las so //
translated: ‚Äú From a similarity . . . ‚Äù means from a nonconnection.

original: thal ba de nyid do zhes bya ba ni gzhan tsam las rtogs pa la brjod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: thal ba de nyid do zhes bya ba ni gzhan tsam las rtogs pa la brjod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú That is the reductio‚Äù refers to the statement of the reductio.

original: @118a * // de lta bu nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i lan 'chad pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: @118a * // de lta bu nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i lan 'chad pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of the answer, ‚ÄúBecause it is seen in that way,‚Äù is ‚ÄúNo . . . ‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i 'bad pa rtsol ba dang / sogs pa'i sgra ma 'brel pa'i 'dra ba mthong ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba'i 'bad pa rtsol ba dang / sogs pa'i sgra ma 'brel pa'i 'dra ba mthong ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The effort that is to be made is the effort that is to be made in the explanation, and the words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù refer to seeing a similarity that is not a connection, and so on.

original: de dag gis bskyed pa'i dran pa ni gzhan du rjes su dpag pa dang mi mthun pa nyid du gyur pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dag gis bskyed pa'i dran pa ni gzhan du rjes su dpag pa dang mi mthun pa nyid du gyur pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The memory that is produced by those is not in accordance with the inference in another place.

original: skyes pa yin pa'i phyir de nyid brjod pa ni /üîΩ'di ni yul 'di ni yod pa yin no zhes yul la sogs pas khyad par gyur pa'i rnam par gnas pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces brjod do //
analyzed: skyes pa yin pa'i phyir de nyid brjod pa ni / 'di ni yul 'di ni yod pa yin no zhes yul la sogs pas khyad par gyur pa'i rnam par gnas pa gang la yod pa de la de skad ces brjod do //
translated: The term ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to the fact that it is a product.üîΩThat which is qualified by a place, etc., is said to ‚Äúhave a place,‚Äù etc.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni 'di las bzlog pa yin no zhes gsungs pa ni yul du byed ces gsungs te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni 'di las bzlog pa yin no zhes gsungs pa ni yul du byed ces gsungs te /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúInference is the opposite of that‚Äù means that it is the opposite of perception.

original: khyad par can dran pa yin no zhes rjes su 'jug go //
analyzed: khyad par can dran pa yin no zhes rjes su 'jug go //
translated: The word ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to the memory of a qualified object.

original: 'dri ba'i dran pa de ga las yin snyam na /
analyzed: 'dri ba'i dran pa de ga las yin snyam na /
translated: From what is the memory of the question derived?

original: de rten dang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de rten dang zhes gsungs so //
translated: The root text states, ‚Äúfrom its basis.‚Äù

original: bsgrub par bya ba de dang de'i rten dang 'brel pa'i rtags las so //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba de dang de'i rten dang 'brel pa'i rtags las so //
translated: The memory of the question is derived from a reason that is related to the object to be established and its basis.

original: 'di nyid 'chad pa ni chos can dang dbang bsgrub bya dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid 'chad pa ni chos can dang dbang bsgrub bya dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is explained in the line ‚Äúthe subject, the power, and the object to be established.‚Äù

original: 'bad rtsol la sogs pa las ni zhes bya ba ni phyed snga ma 'chad pa ste /
analyzed: 'bad rtsol la sogs pa las ni zhes bya ba ni phyed snga ma 'chad pa ste /
translated: The first half of the root text states, ‚Äúfrom effort, etc.‚Äù

original: nus pa'i dngos po rtogs pa ni yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: nus pa'i dngos po rtogs pa ni yin no zhes 'brel to //

original: de ltar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar zhes gsungs so //

original: de zhes bya ba 'bad par rtsol bas na'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba 'bad par rtsol bas na'o //

analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni bzung zin pa 'dzin pas na'o //

analyzed: 'on 'dra ba'i mthong bas bskyed pa'i dran pa ni tshad ma yin no zhes dogs pa 'dra ba bzung ba las zhes gsungs so //

original: ba men ni lang ji lta ba de lta bu'o zhes nye bar bstan pa'i ngag thos pa brog tu bzung na /
analyzed: ba men ni lang ji lta ba de lta bu'o zhes nye bar bstan pa'i ngag thos pa brog tu bzung na /

analyzed: ba lang dang 'dra ba'i men mthong ba las ba men 'di dang 'dra ba ni ba lang de yin no zhes rtogs pa ni nye bar 'jal ba'o //

analyzed: gal te de lta na yang ji ltar tshad ma ma yin snyam na 'dra ba nyid ni zhes gsungs so //

analyzed: 'di dang 'dra bar lkog tu gyur pa rtogs pa ni rang gi ngo bos kyang nges pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: shing gi zhes gsungs so //

analyzed: gang zhig dpe la shing gi don bya ba byed pa'am /

analyzed: mes skyed pa'i du ba la sogs pa mthong ba de ni 'di yin no zhes brtags so zhes kha bskang ste /

analyzed: de'i khong nas phyung ba du ba la sogs pa'i rgyu nyid dang / sha pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu nyid do //

original: de'i phyir don yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir don yang zhes gsungs so //

analyzed: mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin gyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The similarity is understood here also, where it is said, It is momentary because it exists, by saying, The nature of impermanence.

original: gzhan gyi ni dngos po gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ni dngos po gzhan gyi'o //

original: gal te 'bras bu las ni 'dra ba rtogs kyi rang bzhin las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu las ni 'dra ba rtogs kyi rang bzhin las ni ma yin te /
translated: If the similarity is understood from the effect, not from the nature,
