analyzed: dpe med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni kha cig go //
translated: because there is no example, some say.

original: de spang ba'i phyir bshad pa ni rjes su dpag pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de spang ba'i phyir bshad pa ni rjes su dpag pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: To refute that, it is explained, The inference...

original: 'das pa dang da ltar ba'i bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa yang rnam pa de lta bu'i rtags las 'gyur na 'dra bar rtogs pa kho na'o zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'das pa dang da ltar ba'i bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa yang rnam pa de lta bu'i rtags las 'gyur na 'dra bar rtogs pa kho na'o zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: If the understanding of the past and present probandum also comes from a reason of that same kind, then it is said that it is only an understanding of similarity.

original: khyad par 'ga' zhig gis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par 'ga' zhig gis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy some particular‚Äù means by a particular reason.

original: thal ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni zhes bya bar rjes su 'jug go //
analyzed: thal ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni zhes bya bar rjes su 'jug go //
translated: ‚ÄúBy the nature of smoke, etc.‚Äù is to be supplied.

original: ji ltar na gnyi ga ci rigs par go bar byed pa yin snyam na /
analyzed: ji ltar na gnyi ga ci rigs par go bar byed pa yin snyam na /
translated: How is it that both are understood in any way?

original: 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //üîΩdu ba la sogs pa'i dngos po gang zhig khyab pa'i dus su lan cig ji ltar de rgyu nye bar gnas pa can nam /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes gsungs so // du ba la sogs pa'i dngos po gang zhig khyab pa'i dus su lan cig ji ltar de rgyu nye bar gnas pa can nam /
translated: Thus, he says,

original: nye bar gnas pa can ma yin par rnam pa gang gis mthong ba de ni gzhan tshe /
analyzed: nye bar gnas pa can ma yin par rnam pa gang gis mthong ba de ni gzhan tshe /
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever thing, such as smoke, etc., is seen at the time of the pervasion, once, in whatever way, as having its cause present or not present,

original: rjes su dpag pa'i dus de lta bur te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i dus de lta bur te /
translated: at that time, later, when there is inference,

original: rang bzhin de gnyis kyis dran pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin de gnyis kyis dran pa ste /
translated: one remembers that nature in that way.

original: nye bar gnas pa'am nye bar mi gnas pa'i rgyu can du mi 'dzin pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i bdag nyid sad par byed pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: nye bar gnas pa'am nye bar mi gnas pa'i rgyu can du mi 'dzin pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i bdag nyid sad par byed pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The cause of the arousal of the memory is the inference which does not apprehend the object as being present or not present.

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni dran pa sad pa las ma 'das par ci rigs par zhes bya ba ni gang du ji ltar rigs pa der skyes bu de ltar 'jug par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni dran pa sad pa las ma 'das par ci rigs par zhes bya ba ni gang du ji ltar rigs pa der skyes bu de ltar 'jug par byed pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù means that the arousal of the memory is not beyond the scope of the inference. ‚ÄúAs is appropriate‚Äù means that the person engages in the inference in whatever way is appropriate.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i dran pa'i stobs kyis ni zhugs pa yin yang mi slu ba ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni gzhan du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i dran pa'i stobs kyis ni zhugs pa yin yang mi slu ba ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni gzhan du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that way‚Äù means that even though the person engages in the inference through the power of memory, it is not the case that the inference is not nondeceptive. ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means that the inference is nondeceptive.

original: khyab pa'i dus sa sngon gyi mthong ba las g-yos te dran pa ste /üîΩdu ba las bzlog pa sbrang bu'i tshogs pa la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyab pa'i dus sa sngon gyi mthong ba las g-yos te dran pa ste / du ba las bzlog pa sbrang bu'i tshogs pa la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The memory is aroused from the prior perception of the pervasion.üîΩIt is not the case that the pervasion is not established because smoke exists in a swarm of bees, which is the opposite of fire.

original: de'i tshe ni me'i rgyun can nyid du nges pa las sbrang bu'i tshogs pa la sogs pa de lta bu 'jug pa yin yang /
analyzed: de'i tshe ni me'i rgyun can nyid du nges pa las sbrang bu'i tshogs pa la sogs pa de lta bu 'jug pa yin yang /
translated: At that time, the person engages in the inference in that way, even though the existence of fire is ascertained through the existence of smoke.

original: lhag par zhen par byas pa'i dngos po la mi slu ba dang 'brel pa ni rnyed par dka' ba kho na'o //
analyzed: lhag par zhen par byas pa'i dngos po la mi slu ba dang 'brel pa ni rnyed par dka' ba kho na'o //
translated: But it is very difficult to find a thing that is related to nondeception, especially when one is attached to it.

original: 'o na ji @119b ltar dran pa ni mi slu ba dang 'brel bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji @119b ltar dran pa ni mi slu ba dang 'brel bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How then is memory related to nondeception?

original: mngon sum zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mngon sum zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says: ‚Äúbecause it is based on perception.‚Äù

original: du ba la sogs pa'i rtags dran pa ni mngon sum de la brten pa mi slu ba yin no //
analyzed: du ba la sogs pa'i rtags dran pa ni mngon sum de la brten pa mi slu ba yin no //
translated: The memory of a reason such as smoke is nondeceptive in relation to that perception.

original: ji ltar 'di mi slu ba yin pa de gzhan du sngon mthong ba'i me'i 'bras bu nyid gal te du ba la sogs pa la rjes su dpag pa'i bdag nyid kyi dran pa skye ba yin na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di mi slu ba yin pa de gzhan du sngon mthong ba'i me'i 'bras bu nyid gal te du ba la sogs pa la rjes su dpag pa'i bdag nyid kyi dran pa skye ba yin na /
translated: How is it nondeceptive? If the memory of fire, which was previously seen as the effect of smoke, arises in relation to smoke,

original: de'i tshe tshad ma yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i tshe tshad ma yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: then it is a valid cognition, but not otherwise.

original: gal te mthong ba 'khrul bas na //
analyzed: gal te mthong ba 'khrul bas na //
translated: If the seeing is mistaken,

original: zhes bya ba chu'i rnam pa can mthong ba ni smig rgyu'i tshogs la yang yod pas na chu la 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba chu'i rnam pa can mthong ba ni smig rgyu'i tshogs la yang yod pas na chu la 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: The seeing that has the aspect of water is mistaken in relation to water, because it exists in a mirage.

original: des na mthong ba 'khrul pas na de bzhin yin yang de mthong ba bzhin dran pa yin yang chu dran pa ni tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: des na mthong ba 'khrul pas na de bzhin yin yang de mthong ba bzhin dran pa yin yang chu dran pa ni tshad ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the seeing is mistaken, even though it is as it is seen, even though it is remembered as it is seen, the memory of water is a valid cognition.

original: de bzhin du du ba la sogs pa'i rtags dran pa yang tshad mar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar pha rol gyis bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du du ba la sogs pa'i rtags dran pa yang tshad mar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar pha rol gyis bsams pa'o //
translated: In the same way, the memory of the reason, smoke, etc., is not a valid cognition.

original: rang rig pa'i mthar thug pa'i mthong ba ni rang bzhin gnyis pas 'khrul pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rang rig pa'i mthar thug pa'i mthong ba ni rang bzhin gnyis pas 'khrul pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The ultimate seeing of reflexive awareness is not mistaken by the two natures.

original: 'on kyang dran pa rnam pa gzhan du gyur pa las yin no zhes lan brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang dran pa rnam pa gzhan du gyur pa las yin no zhes lan brjod pa ni /
translated: However, the response is that it is from the transformation of memory.

original: mthong ba 'khrul pa de yang ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mthong ba 'khrul pa de yang ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That mistaken seeing is also.

original: rnam pa gzhan du byung ba nyid brjod pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du byung ba nyid brjod pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The occurrence of the transformation is stated as follows.

original: smig rgyu'i tshogs pa mthong ba ni dmigs pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: smig rgyu'i tshogs pa mthong ba ni dmigs pa med pa yin te /
translated: The seeing of the collection of a mirage is without an object.

original: lhag par shes par byas pa'i chu dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag par shes par byas pa'i chu dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the water that is the object of the special knowledge is not an object.

original: gal te de lta na yang tshad ma ji ltar ma yin snyam na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang tshad ma ji ltar ma yin snyam na /
translated: Even though it is like that, how is it not a valid cognition?

original: dran pa rnam pa gzhan du yin zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: dran pa rnam pa gzhan du yin zhes gsungs te /
translated: Memory is of a different kind.

original: mthong ba ji lta ba bzhin du dran pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang 'di ni chu'o zhes bya bar ni /
analyzed: mthong ba ji lta ba bzhin du dran pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang 'di ni chu'o zhes bya bar ni /
translated: Memory is not like seeing, but rather, ‚ÄúThis is water.‚Äù

original: des na ni tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na ni tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it is not a valid cognition. This is the meaning.

original: des na mthong ba de ni smig rgyu'i tshogs kyi dmigs pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: des na mthong ba de ni smig rgyu'i tshogs kyi dmigs pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: Therefore, that seeing is associated with the objective support of a mirage.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa yang de mthong ba de bzhin te mthong ba'i rjes su 'brangs nas dran pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa yang de mthong ba de bzhin te mthong ba'i rjes su 'brangs nas dran pa ma yin te /
translated: That which is associated with the objective support is not memory that follows after seeing and sees in the same way as that seeing.

original: des na tshad mar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na tshad mar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not a valid cognition.

original: 'on te tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: But if it is not a valid cognition,

original: mthong ba go ci ste tshad ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mthong ba go ci ste tshad ma yin no zhe na /
translated: why is seeing a valid cognition?

original: dran pas zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dran pas zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúMemory.‚Äù

original: mthong ba btang snyoms su gnas kyang dran pa nyid kyang phyi rol gyi yul can du rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba btang snyoms su gnas kyang dran pa nyid kyang phyi rol gyi yul can du rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: Even though seeing remains indifferent, memory itself is posited as having an external object.

original: ji lta ba bzhin rnam par 'jog pa'i dran pa ni tshad ma yin gyi gzhan du tshad ma ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni dran pa de yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin rnam par 'jog pa'i dran pa ni tshad ma yin gyi gzhan du tshad ma ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni dran pa de yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The memory that posits things as they are is a valid cognition, but other than that, it is not a valid cognition.

original: yang gal te mthong ba yod kyang gang gis de tshad ma yin par 'gyur ba rnam pa gzhan du dran par ji ltar 'gyur zhes dogs na /üîΩdran pa der yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yang gal te mthong ba yod kyang gang gis de tshad ma yin par 'gyur ba rnam pa gzhan du dran par ji ltar 'gyur zhes dogs na / dran pa der yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: If seeing exists, how could memory be of a different aspect, since that would make it a valid cognition?

original: gang @120a * //
analyzed: gang @120a * //
translated: The response to that is, ‚ÄúThat memory is also . . .‚Äù

original: gi phyir gsal ba ma yin pa las dran pa rnam pa gzhan du min pa de'i phyir gsal ba'i stobs kyis ni de nyid du zhes bya ba 'bras bu nyid la sogs par dmigs shing gtan la 'bebs pa'i 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dag las ni'o //
analyzed: gi phyir gsal ba ma yin pa las dran pa rnam pa gzhan du min pa de'i phyir gsal ba'i stobs kyis ni de nyid du zhes bya ba 'bras bu nyid la sogs par dmigs shing gtan la 'bebs pa'i 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dag las ni'o //
translated: If memory were not of a different aspect from the non-clarity, then because of the power of clarity, it would be observed and ascertained in the effect itself, such as in the effect of natural outflow.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni nye bar mi mthong zhing dmigs pa rnam pa med par ni dran pa 'khrul par 'gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni nye bar mi mthong zhing dmigs pa rnam pa med par ni dran pa 'khrul par 'gyur pa yin no //
translated: If it were not observed in that way, memory would be mistaken.

original: gang gi phyir mthong ba rang nyid la brten pa'i nyes pa ma yin pa des na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mthong ba rang nyid la brten pa'i nyes pa ma yin pa des na'o //
translated: Because the fault does not lie with the seeing itself, but with the person who sees.

original: slu ba ni 'khrul pa'i zhes bya ba'i ming can no //
analyzed: slu ba ni 'khrul pa'i zhes bya ba'i ming can no //
translated: ‚ÄúDeceiving‚Äù is a synonym for ‚Äúerroneous.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir gtan la phebs pa'i 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dag las mthong ba'i don dran pa de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gtan la phebs pa'i 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dag las mthong ba'i don dran pa de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because the result of the ascertainment and the nature of the ascertainment are both remembered, therefore,

original: de yang mi dran pa'o //
analyzed: de yang mi dran pa'o //
translated: it is not remembered.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bshad pa ni tshe zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bshad pa ni tshe zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFor that very reason‚Äù means ‚Äúfor the very reason that it is an inference.‚Äù

original: yang na gal te ji ltar rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa de bzhin du rang gi ngo bo dang 'brel pa las kyang yin no //
analyzed: yang na gal te ji ltar rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa de bzhin du rang gi ngo bo dang 'brel pa las kyang yin no //
translated: Or, if it is just as it is understood in its own nature, then it is also related to its own nature.

original: des na rang gi 'khrul par 'gyur ba rjes su dpag pas rang gi ngo bo mi rtogs par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des na rang gi 'khrul par 'gyur ba rjes su dpag pas rang gi ngo bo mi rtogs par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Therefore, how could it be that the inference of one‚Äôs own error does not understand its own nature?

original: de tshe zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de tshe zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúAt that time‚Äù is stated.

original: 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i dus su mthong ba dang 'dra bar rjes su dpag par bya ba'i go bar byed pa yin la go bar bya ba yang yin gyi /
analyzed: 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i dus su mthong ba dang 'dra bar rjes su dpag par bya ba'i go bar byed pa yin la go bar bya ba yang yin gyi /
translated: When the relation is apprehended, the object to be inferred is understood in the same way that it was seen.

original: de'i dus su des 'di khyab pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ma yin te /üîΩdes ni go byed rjes su 'gro ba de dang 'dra bar de'i spyi'i ngo bo nyid du rtogs kyi /
analyzed: de'i dus su des 'di khyab pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ma yin te / des ni go byed rjes su 'gro ba de dang 'dra bar de'i spyi'i ngo bo nyid du rtogs kyi /
translated: But it is not that at that time it is said that this is pervaded by that.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the understanding is of the general nature of that which is similar to the understanding, not of its own nature.

original: yang na spyi'i gang zhig go bar byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa 'gro ba'i byed pa des rtogs par bya ba lkog tu gyur pa'i don rtogs so //
analyzed: yang na spyi'i gang zhig go bar byed pa'i rjes su dpag pa 'gro ba'i byed pa des rtogs par bya ba lkog tu gyur pa'i don rtogs so //
translated: Or else, the object to be understood, which is hidden, is understood by that activity of inference which is the understanding of the general.

original: lung dang don gyi go ba la sogs pa 'brel pa 'dzin pa la mi ltos pa dag ni rang gi ngo bos lam de lta ma yin par yang go bar byed pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lung dang don gyi go ba la sogs pa 'brel pa 'dzin pa la mi ltos pa dag ni rang gi ngo bos lam de lta ma yin par yang go bar byed pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa ni des na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said that scripture, understanding of the meaning, etc., which do not depend on apprehending a relation, are not by their own nature understanding even if they are like that.

original: yang ci'i phyir khyad par du mi rtogs snyam na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir khyad par du mi rtogs snyam na /
translated: Why is it not understood as a specific?

original: go bar bya ba mi rtogs pa ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: go bar bya ba mi rtogs pa ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe cognition of the object is not understood‚Äù means that the particular is not understood.

original: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the result of that?

original: go bar byed pa de yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: go bar byed pa de yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúThat cognition is also‚Äù means that the cognition of the general is also not understood.

original: de zhes bya ba go bar byed pa la gnas pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba go bar byed pa la gnas pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the cognition of the general.

original: gal te de lta na yang ci'i phyir khyad par mi rtogs snyam na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang ci'i phyir khyad par mi rtogs snyam na /
translated: Even if that is so, why is the particular not understood?

original: go bar byed pa'i spyi'i ni go bar bya ba'i khyad par lam nges pa yin zhes brjod pa ni du ba la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: go bar byed pa'i spyi'i ni go bar bya ba'i khyad par lam nges pa yin zhes brjod pa ni du ba la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The cognition of the general is said to be uncertain with regard to the particular object to be cognized. ‚ÄúSmoke, etc.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni thams cad la mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni thams cad la mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means because it is seen everywhere.

original: de las ni du ba la sogs pa'i spyi las so //
analyzed: de las ni du ba la sogs pa'i spyi las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that‚Äù means from the general of smoke, etc.

original: khyad par ni rtsva las byung ba dang lo ma las byung ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par ni rtsva las byung ba dang lo ma las byung ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe particular‚Äù means that which arises from grass, that which arises from leaves, etc.

original: khyad par zhes bya ba @120b ni dogs pa ste /
analyzed: khyad par zhes bya ba @120b ni dogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe particular‚Äù is a doubt.

original: rtags kyi'o // rtogs so zhes bya ba ni khyad par nyid do //
analyzed: rtags kyi'o // rtogs so zhes bya ba ni khyad par nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúIs understood‚Äù means the particular is understood.

original: khyad par nye bar mtshon pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par nye bar mtshon pa ma yin no //
translated: The particular is not indicated.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nang tshan gyi zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: nang tshan gyi zhes gsungs so //
translated: The word internal is used in the phrase internal division.

original: 'ga' zhig gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas rtogs pa bo'i khyad par la ltos te khyad par nye bar mtshon par dogs pa bsu nas shin tu khyad par gyur pa ni mtshon par byed mi nus so //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas rtogs pa bo'i khyad par la ltos te khyad par nye bar mtshon par dogs pa bsu nas shin tu khyad par gyur pa ni mtshon par byed mi nus so //
translated: In response to the doubt that the particular is indicated in dependence on the particular of the object of knowledge, he says it is not possible to indicate a very particular.

original: zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: This is what is said:

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: No, it is not so.üîΩ

original: gal te tsandan gyi du ba las tsandan gyi rtogs pa ni kho na ma yin nam des na ji ltar khyad par mtshon par mi nus pa zhe na /
analyzed: gal te tsandan gyi du ba las tsandan gyi rtogs pa ni kho na ma yin nam des na ji ltar khyad par mtshon par mi nus pa zhe na /
translated: If the particular of sandalwood is not the only one that arises from the smoke of sandalwood, then how is it that it is not possible to indicate the particular?

original: khyad par nye bar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: khyad par nye bar zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says the particular is not indicated.

original: der ni rtags la'o //
analyzed: der ni rtags la'o //
translated: Here, in that refers to the reason.

original: tsandan gyi du ba la rigs mthun pa dang mi mthun pa ma lus pa las ldog pa'i rang bzhin go bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tsandan gyi du ba la rigs mthun pa dang mi mthun pa ma lus pa las ldog pa'i rang bzhin go bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The smoke of sandalwood does not cause the understanding of the nature that is the opposite of all that is of the same type and that is of a different type,

original: mtshon par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshon par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not possible to indicate it.

original: 'on kyang nang gi spyi'i rang bzhin dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid kyi nye bar mtshon pa'i phyi ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang nang gi spyi'i rang bzhin dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid kyi nye bar mtshon pa'i phyi ro //
translated: However, the external particular is indicated by the internal general nature that has the nature of a particular.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gang srid pa de tsam zhig ces gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gang srid pa de tsam zhig ces gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúonly that much as is possible.‚Äù

original: rnam pa thams cad rtogs pa ni rtags kyi gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni skyes bu khyad par can no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad rtogs pa ni rtags kyi gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni skyes bu khyad par can no //
translated: The realization of all aspects is the special person.

original: de ni rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: That is inference.

original: gal te lkog tu gyur pa yang spyi mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa las khyad par gyi rang bzhin du rtogs pa yod pa yin nam zhes dogs pa ni khyad par mthong ba las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te lkog tu gyur pa yang spyi mthong ba'i rjes su dpag pa las khyad par gyi rang bzhin du rtogs pa yod pa yin nam zhes dogs pa ni khyad par mthong ba las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the hidden is also understood as the nature of a specific object from inference that sees the universal, then there is doubt.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: No, is the answer.

original: 'di nyid ces bya ba ni lkog tu gyur pa go bar byed pa nyid du rjes su 'gro ba spyi'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa nyid na'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid ces bya ba ni lkog tu gyur pa go bar byed pa nyid du rjes su 'gro ba spyi'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa nyid na'o //
translated: This very is the hidden, which is understood as the nature of the universal that pervades.

original: yang na lkog tu gyur pa ni go bar byed pa'i rjes su 'gro ba spyi'i rang bzhin du rtogs par 'gyur mod //
analyzed: yang na lkog tu gyur pa ni go bar byed pa'i rjes su 'gro ba spyi'i rang bzhin du rtogs par 'gyur mod //
translated: Or, the hidden is understood as the nature of the universal that pervades the understood.

original: de lta na yang de rjes su dpag pa ji ltar yin zhes dogs na /
analyzed: de lta na yang de rjes su dpag pa ji ltar yin zhes dogs na /
translated: Even so, how is that inference?

original: tshul gsum pa'i rtags las skyes pa ni rjes su dpag pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: tshul gsum pa'i rtags las skyes pa ni rjes su dpag pa kho na yin te /
translated: That which is produced from a trimodal logical reason is inference alone.

original: gzhan gyi go bar byed pa nyid du ni mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi go bar byed pa nyid du ni mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: Because it is not tenable that it causes the understanding of others.

original: 'brel pa can gyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa can gyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúpossessing a connection‚Äù is stated.

original: 'brel pa can sgrub par byed pa dang / chos can dag dang ngo //
analyzed: 'brel pa can sgrub par byed pa dang / chos can dag dang ngo //
translated: The proof of the one possessing a connection and the subject are the two.

original: gang gi phyir lkog tu gyur pa'i rigs pa mtha' dag ni rjes su dpag pa kho na yin pa des na lkog tu gyur pa rnams kyi sgrub par byed pa ni gcig kho nar nges pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir lkog tu gyur pa'i rigs pa mtha' dag ni rjes su dpag pa kho na yin pa des na lkog tu gyur pa rnams kyi sgrub par byed pa ni gcig kho nar nges pa yin te /
translated: Since all reasoning that is hidden is inference alone, therefore the proof of hidden objects is ascertained to be one alone.üîΩIt is not scripture and so on.

original: lung la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lung la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: gcig kho na go bar byed pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las snyam na /
analyzed: gcig kho na go bar byed pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las snyam na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúWhy is it that it alone causes understanding?‚Äù

original: mtshan nyid gzhan zhes gsungs so //üîΩgal te gzhal bya gzhan gyi zhes bya ba ni shin tu lkog tu gyur pa mtho ris la sogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i @121a * //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gzhan zhes gsungs so //üîΩgal te gzhal bya gzhan gyi zhes bya ba ni shin tu lkog tu gyur pa mtho ris la sogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i @121a * //
translated: The term ‚Äúanother characteristic‚Äù is stated.üîΩIf you ask, ‚ÄúWhat is the proof of the other object?‚Äù

original: yul can gzhal bya gzhan gang la yod pa de ni tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: yul can gzhal bya gzhan gang la yod pa de ni tshad ma yin te /
translated: That which exists in any other object of valid knowledge is a means of valid knowledge.

original: lung yin no //
analyzed: lung yin no //
translated: It is scripture.

original: de lta ma yin na gsum pa la mi 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gsum pa la mi 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, one would not engage in the third.

original: des na mtshan ma gnyis su nges pa mi 'grub bo zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'i don to //
analyzed: des na mtshan ma gnyis su nges pa mi 'grub bo zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the point of the dispute is that the ascertainment of the two signs is not established.

original: lan 'debs pa ni 'debs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lan 'debs pa ni 'debs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The reply is:

original: lung yang gtso bo'i don la mi slu ba nyid kyis thams cad mkhyen pa 'grub pa dang mthun pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu nyid kyis rjes su dpag pa kho na'o //
analyzed: lung yang gtso bo'i don la mi slu ba nyid kyis thams cad mkhyen pa 'grub pa dang mthun pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu nyid kyis rjes su dpag pa kho na'o //
translated: Scripture is inference itself by the reason of being a cause of inference, because it is not deceptive with regard to the primary meaning and is consistent with the establishment of omniscience.

original: mtho ris kyi sgrub par byed pa la sogs pa ni lung tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: mtho ris kyi sgrub par byed pa la sogs pa ni lung tshad ma yin te /
translated: The establishment of heaven, etc. is a valid means of knowledge of scripture,

original: yul gnyis rnam par dag pas na don la lhur phyogs pa'i the tshom gyis 'jug pa yin no zhes dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: yul gnyis rnam par dag pas na don la lhur phyogs pa'i the tshom gyis 'jug pa yin no zhes dgongs pa yin no //
translated: because it is engaged by doubt that is directed toward the object, due to the purity of the two objects.

original: gzhal bya ni tshad ma 'grub pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhal bya ni tshad ma 'grub pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin te /
translated: The object of valid knowledge is not the reason for the establishment of the valid means of knowledge,

original: bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: because it is the opposite.

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù is the word.

original: tshad ma yang rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis grub pa kho na sgrub par byed par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bshad pa ni tshad ma'i rang gi ngo bo ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshad ma yang rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis grub pa kho na sgrub par byed par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bshad pa ni tshad ma'i rang gi ngo bo ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: And the proof of the establishment of the valid cognition is only by the direct perception of self-awareness. This is what is said in ‚ÄúThe nature of the valid cognition . . .‚Äù

original: gal te gzhal bya gnyis las tshad ma gnyis su las brjod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te gzhal bya gnyis las tshad ma gnyis su las brjod pa ma yin nam /
translated: If it is said that the two valid cognitions are stated from the perspective of the two objects,

original: de ni ji ltar shes pa'i rnam pa tha dad pa las yin par brjod ce na /
analyzed: de ni ji ltar shes pa'i rnam pa tha dad pa las yin par brjod ce na /
translated: how is it that they are stated from the perspective of the different aspects of consciousness?

original: rang rig pa ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rang rig pa ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: This is what is said in ‚ÄúSelf-awareness . . .‚Äù

original: gal te de lta na 'o na gzhal bya gnyis phyir zhes bya ba 'di'i don ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na 'o na gzhal bya gnyis phyir zhes bya ba 'di'i don ci yin zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then what is the meaning of ‚Äúbecause of the two objects‚Äù?

original: bshad pa ni gzhal bya gnyis phyir zhes bya ba ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bshad pa ni gzhal bya gnyis phyir zhes bya ba ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: The explanation is this. ‚ÄúBecause of the two objects‚Äù is stated in ‚Äúbecause of the two objects.‚Äù

original: don du lhag par mos pa'i yul gyi rnam pa gnyis sgrub pa'i don du de skad brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: don du lhag par mos pa'i yul gyi rnam pa gnyis sgrub pa'i don du de skad brjod pa yin no //
translated: It is stated in that way for the purpose of establishing the two aspects of the object that is the domain of the belief in the real nature of things.

original: gal te gzhal bya gcig kho na'am /
analyzed: gal te gzhal bya gcig kho na'am /
translated: If there is only one object,

original: yang na spyi dang rang gi mtshan nyid dang gnyi ga zhes bya ba gsum ma yin nam /
analyzed: yang na spyi dang rang gi mtshan nyid dang gnyi ga zhes bya ba gsum ma yin nam /
translated: Or else, are there not three kinds of objects of knowledge: the universal, the particular, and both?

original: des na mngon par 'dod pa ji ltar 'grub snyam na /üîΩrang gi rnam pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na mngon par 'dod pa ji ltar 'grub snyam na / rang gi rnam pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: How then is the desired conclusion established?üîΩThe word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is stated in order to eliminate that.

original: gcig ces bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid dam spyi'i mtshan nyid gcig kho na'o //
analyzed: gcig ces bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid dam spyi'i mtshan nyid gcig kho na'o //
translated: ‚Äú One‚Äù means either the particular or the universal.

original: gsum pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gnyi ga ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gnyi ga ma yin pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù refers to neither.

original: de ltar tshad ma gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i rnam pa gnyis nyams su myong ba las nyams su myong ba rnam par phye ba gnyis yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar tshad ma gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i rnam pa gnyis nyams su myong ba las nyams su myong ba rnam par phye ba gnyis yin gyi /
translated: Thus, the phrase ‚Äútwo kinds of valid cognition‚Äù and so on indicates that the two kinds of valid cognition are distinguished on the basis of two different aspects of the same object of knowledge, not on the basis of two different objects of knowledge.

original: gcig ma yin la gzhan yang ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig ma yin la gzhan yang ma yin no zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: It is not one, nor is it different.

original: da ni gzhal bya gnyis po 'di ni rnam par byed pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: da ni gzhal bya gnyis po 'di ni rnam par byed pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: Now, these two objects of knowledge are distinguished,

original: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid gcig yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i bdag nyid gcig yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but there is no single entity that is both.

original: gang gi de'i yul can rnam pa gsum par 'gyur de bzhin gang gis gcig kho na tshad @121b mar 'gyur ba rang gi mtshan nyid gcig kho na yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi de'i yul can rnam pa gsum par 'gyur de bzhin gang gis gcig kho na tshad @121b mar 'gyur ba rang gi mtshan nyid gcig kho na yang ma yin no //
translated: But it is not so, because the three aspects of the object are not the same.

original: de ltar na gsum mam gcig nyid ni gzhal bya gnyis kyis 'gog par byed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar na gsum mam gcig nyid ni gzhal bya gnyis kyis 'gog par byed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus, the three or the one are refuted by the two objects.

original: gzhal bya gnyis ni mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //üîΩsngar ni gzhal bya gzhan med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhal bya gnyis ni mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'o // sngar ni gzhal bya gzhan med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the two objects are seen.

original: gsum pa la sogs pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gsum pa la sogs pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ma yin la /
translated: Previously, it was not said that the three and so on are not so because there is no other object.

original: da ni gzhan med kyang gnyis po de gcig tu gyur pa'i gsum las 'phen pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par yin no //
analyzed: da ni gzhan med kyang gnyis po de gcig tu gyur pa'i gsum las 'phen pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par yin no //
translated: Now, even though there is no other, it is said that the two are not projected as three by becoming one. This is the difference.

original: rnam par bshad pa yang kho na ltar bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa yang kho na ltar bshad par bya'o //
translated: The explanation should be explained in the same way.

original: gal te rang gi mtshan nyid gcig kho na spyi dang khyad par gyi rang bzhin gyis rtogs pa yul bzhin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: gal te rang gi mtshan nyid gcig kho na spyi dang khyad par gyi rang bzhin gyis rtogs pa yul bzhin pa'i phyir na /
translated: If the one own characteristic is understood as the nature of the universal and the particular, like the object,

original: gzhal bya gnyis pa med pa ma yin nam zhes dogs pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhal bya gnyis pa med pa ma yin nam zhes dogs pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The doubt that the second object of valid knowledge does not exist is expressed by ‚ÄúBut if . . . .‚Äù

original: spyi med par ni logs shig tu gzhal bya ma yin pa'i phyir na rang gi mtshan nyid gcig kho na rnam pa gnyis kyis rtogs par byed pa yin no zhes lan brjod pa ni kho na'ang 'dod ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: spyi med par ni logs shig tu gzhal bya ma yin pa'i phyir na rang gi mtshan nyid gcig kho na rnam pa gnyis kyis rtogs par byed pa yin no zhes lan brjod pa ni kho na'ang 'dod ces bya ba'o //
translated: Since a universal is not a separate object of valid knowledge apart from the particular, the reply is that the particular alone is understood in two ways. ‚Äú We also accept‚Äù is the statement of that reply.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid las gzhan 'o na ci ltar gzhal bya gnyis yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid las gzhan 'o na ci ltar gzhal bya gnyis yin zhe na /
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the particular. ‚Äú How can it be the two objects of valid knowledge?‚Äù

original: de nyid ces gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid ces gsungs so //
translated: ‚Äú That itself‚Äù is stated.

original: med pa zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ni gzhal bya ma yin pa bsgrub par bya ba ma nges pa yin te /
analyzed: med pa zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ni gzhal bya ma yin pa bsgrub par bya ba ma nges pa yin te /
translated: The reason ‚Äúbecause it does not exist‚Äù proves that the particular is not an object of valid knowledge, but it is not certain.

original: med pa'i gzhal bya yod pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: med pa'i gzhal bya yod pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because the particular is an object of valid knowledge, the reply is, ‚ÄúMoreover . . . .‚Äù

original: dngos po yang yin par rang bzhin gyis med par ni gzhan gyi ltar na gzhal bya yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: dngos po yang yin par rang bzhin gyis med par ni gzhan gyi ltar na gzhal bya yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: ‚Äú It is a thing‚Äù is stated because the particular is an object of valid knowledge. ‚Äú It is not nonexistent‚Äù is stated because the particular is not an object of valid knowledge. ‚Äú It is not nonexistent by nature‚Äù is stated because the particular is not an object of valid knowledge. ‚Äú It is not nonexistent‚Äù is stated because the particular is not an object of valid knowledge.üîΩ‚Äú It is not nonexistent by nature‚Äù is stated because the particular is not an object of valid knowledge. ‚Äú It is not nonexistent‚Äù is stated because the particular is not an object of valid knowledge. ‚Äú It is not nonexistent by nature‚Äù is stated because the particular is not an object of valid knowledge. ‚Äú It is not nonexistent‚Äù is stated because the particular is not an object of valid knowledge. ‚Äú It is not nonexistent by nature‚Äù is stated because the particular is not an object of valid knowledge. ‚Äú It is not nonexistent‚Äù is stated because the particular is not an object of valid knowledge. ‚Äú It is not nonexistent by nature‚Äù is stated because the particular is not an object of valid knowledge. ‚Äú It is not nonexistent‚Äù is stated because the particular is not an object of valid knowledge. ‚Äú It is not nonexistent by nature‚Äù is stated because the particular is not an object of valid knowledge. ‚Äú It is not nonexistent‚Äù is stated because the particular is not an object of valid knowledge. ‚Äú It is not nonexistent by nature‚Äù is stated because the particular is not an object of valid knowledge. ‚Äú It is not nonexistent‚Äù is stated because the particular is not an object of valid knowledge. ‚Äú It is not nonexistent by nature‚Äù is stated because the particular is not an object of valid knowledge. ‚Äú It is not nonexistent‚Äù is stated because the particular is not an object of valid knowledge. ‚Äú It is not nonexistent by nature‚Äù is stated

original: spyi'i yul can gyi rjes dpag tshad ma yin mod /
analyzed: spyi'i yul can gyi rjes dpag tshad ma yin mod /
translated: It is a valid cognition that has a universal as its object.

original: med pa nges pa'i rang bzhin ni tshad ma gnyis par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med pa nges pa'i rang bzhin ni tshad ma gnyis par 'gyur ro //
translated: But the nature of the ascertainment of nonexistence is a second type of valid cognition.üîΩWhether it is inference or something else, it is the same.

original: de ni rjes su dpag pa'am gzhan yin na yang rung ste khyad par med do zhes brjod pa ni de la tshad ma zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni rjes su dpag pa'am gzhan yin na yang rung ste khyad par med do zhes brjod pa ni de la tshad ma zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is called valid cognition.

original: gal te dbang po ni yod pa gsal bar byed pa yin pas de'i khyad par med pa yang gsal bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te dbang po ni yod pa gsal bar byed pa yin pas de'i khyad par med pa yang gsal bar byed pa yin te /
translated: If you think that since the sense faculty is that which illuminates the existent, it also illuminates the particular,

original: dbang po byed pa dang ldan pas de rtogs par mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa med pa /üîΩdbang skyes zhes gsungs so //üîΩde las rnam par dbye ba mthong bas de dran pa de med par nges pas byung bas na bdag nyid skye ba ni dbang po la ltos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po byed pa dang ldan pas de rtogs par mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa med pa / dbang skyes zhes gsungs so // de las rnam par dbye ba mthong bas de dran pa de med par nges pas byung bas na bdag nyid skye ba ni dbang po la ltos pa ma yin no //
translated: because it is seen that the sense faculty, which is the agent, is that which illuminates,üîΩthen the sense faculty is not the agent.üîΩBecause it is seen that the sense faculty is differentiated from the object, the memory of that sense faculty does not arise from the sense faculty.

original: gal te dran pa de med par nges pas byung bas na bdag nyid skye ba ni dbang po la ltos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te dran pa de med par nges pas byung bas na bdag nyid skye ba ni dbang po la ltos pa ma yin no //
translated: Because it is seen that the sense faculty is differentiated from the object, the memory of that sense faculty does not arise from the sense faculty.üîΩIf you think that the sense faculty is the agent because it is seen that the sense faculty is the cause of the arising of the memory of the object,üîΩthen the sense faculty is not the agent.

original: gal te dran pa la sogs par bsgrubs pa'i dbang po med par shes pa'i rgyu ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dran pa la sogs par bsgrubs pa'i dbang po med par shes pa'i rgyu ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúAre not the sense faculties, such as memory, etc., the cause of consciousness?‚Äù

original: don gyi stobs la zhes gsungs so //üîΩdon @122a * //üîΩnye ba dang mi nye ba dag las shes pa'i snang ba tha dad pa dang ldan pa ni des skyes pa yin na /
analyzed: don gyi stobs la zhes gsungs so // don @122a * // nye ba dang mi nye ba dag las shes pa'i snang ba tha dad pa dang ldan pa ni des skyes pa yin na /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúThe power of the object.‚ÄùüîΩThe difference in the appearance of consciousness from the proximity or non-proximity of the object is due to the object.

original: dngos po nye ba dang mi nye ba dag las mi snang ba tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po nye ba dang mi nye ba dag las mi snang ba tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: But there is no difference in the non-appearance of consciousness from the proximity or non-proximity of the object.

original: khyad par med par dmigs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'on te don gyis skyed par byed pa nyid ni dmigs pa kho na yin pa'i gzhan ni ma yin la /
analyzed: khyad par med par dmigs pa'i phyir ro // 'on te don gyis skyed par byed pa nyid ni dmigs pa kho na yin pa'i gzhan ni ma yin la /
translated: This is because it is observed without distinction.

original: de ni dngos po med pa la yang khyad par med do snyam pa don gyi nus pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni dngos po med pa la yang khyad par med do snyam pa don gyi nus pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you think that the object is the cause of the production of consciousness, but not of the other, and that there is no distinction in the non-existence of the object, then the root text states, ‚ÄúThe power of the object.‚Äù

original: nye ba dang mi nye ba dag las snang ba tha dad pa la mi ltos par de dmigs pa tsam gyis don skyed par byed pa nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: nye ba dang mi nye ba dag las snang ba tha dad pa la mi ltos par de dmigs pa tsam gyis don skyed par byed pa nyid yin na ni /
translated: If the object is the cause of the production of consciousness, but not of the other, and if the object is the cause of the production of consciousness merely by being perceived, not in dependence on the difference in the appearance of consciousness from the proximity or non-proximity of the object,

original: du bas me rtogs pa la yul dang thal ba las me rtogs na dus kyis bar chod pa dang / sogs pa'i sgra rtags rags mos phra mo shes pa na /üîΩrang bzhin gyis bskal pa yin yang dbang bskyed pa nyid yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: du bas me rtogs pa la yul dang thal ba las me rtogs na dus kyis bar chod pa dang / sogs pa'i sgra rtags rags mos phra mo shes pa na / rang bzhin gyis bskal pa yin yang dbang bskyed pa nyid yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: And if a subtle object is known from a gross sign, then the object is temporally remote.

original: de'i tshe ni dbang po'i byed pas yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe ni dbang po'i byed pas yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But if the object is generated by the sense faculty, then it is not existent by the operation of the sense faculty.

original: de la dbang po gzhan du zhugs pa yin na 'di yang ci ste mi 'dod /
analyzed: de la dbang po gzhan du zhugs pa yin na 'di yang ci ste mi 'dod /
translated: If you accept that the sense faculty is engaged in another object, why not accept that this is the case?

original: nye ba dang ring ba dang las snang ba tha dad pa med pa ni des ma bskyed pa'i gtan tshigs 'dir khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nye ba dang ring ba dang las snang ba tha dad pa med pa ni des ma bskyed pa'i gtan tshigs 'dir khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no difference in the absence of proximity and distance and the appearance of the object, and the absence of generation by that is not a reason here.

original: yang na gal te dbang po las med pa nges pa na de ji ltar tshad ma gzhan yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang na gal te dbang po las med pa nges pa na de ji ltar tshad ma gzhan yin zhe na /
translated: Or, if it is ascertained that the object does not exist due to the sense faculty, how can it be another valid knowledge?

original: med la dbang bskyed blo min te //
analyzed: med la dbang bskyed blo min te //
translated: It is not a cognition that generates the knowledge of nonexistence.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: This is stated.

original: 'di ga las snyam na /
analyzed: 'di ga las snyam na /
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúWhere is this stated?‚Äù

original: don gyi ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: don gyi ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is stated in the line ‚Äúof the object.‚Äù

original: gal te dbang po'i shes pa don gyi nus pa la mi ltos na de'i tshe du ba las me rtogs pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gal te dbang po'i shes pa don gyi nus pa la mi ltos na de'i tshe du ba las me rtogs pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: If the sense consciousness did not depend on the potentiality of the object, then, as before, ‚Äúwhen fire is cognized from smoke,‚Äù and so on.

original: de la ni zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i rnam par shes pa la'o //
analyzed: de la ni zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i rnam par shes pa la'o //
translated: ‚Äú In that case‚Äù refers to the sense consciousness.

original: gal te ro la sogs pa bzhin du med pa las yang dbang po'i byed pa yod pa nyid ma yin nam dngos po'i khyad par du 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs na /
analyzed: gal te ro la sogs pa bzhin du med pa las yang dbang po'i byed pa yod pa nyid ma yin nam dngos po'i khyad par du 'dzin pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs na /
translated: If, like taste and so on, the object does not exist, then how can the activity of the sense faculty exist? Because it apprehends a particular thing.

original: de 'di nyan na zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de 'di nyan na zhes gsungs te /
translated: If you think this, then listen to this:

original: bum pa la sogs pa ste yul 'di na'o //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa ste yul 'di na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis pot and so on is here.‚Äù

original: de'i ni bum pa la sogs pa'i'o //
analyzed: de'i ni bum pa la sogs pa'i'o //
translated: This is the pot and so on.

original: med kyang dbang po'i spyod yul yin na ci skyon snyam na /
analyzed: med kyang dbang po'i spyod yul yin na ci skyon snyam na /
translated: If it is the object of the sense faculty even though it does not exist, what is the problem?

original: chos kyang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: chos kyang zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚Äú Even dharma‚Äù is stated.

original: rnam par 'jig pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'jig pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par 'jig pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'jig pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚Äú Because of destruction‚Äù means because of the absurd consequence of destruction.

original: gal te gang la 'di med pa de ni khyad par can du mngon sum gyi yul du gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te gang la 'di med pa de ni khyad par can du mngon sum gyi yul du gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: If it is argued that that which does not have this is not the object of perception,

original: 'on kyang gang zhig yul la sogs pa nye bar 'gyur ba bum pa la sogs pas dben pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang gang zhig yul la sogs pa nye bar 'gyur ba bum pa la sogs pas dben pa'o //
translated: then it is said that it is not the case that the object, etc., are not the object of perception, because they are the object of perception.

original: des na chod pa rtogs par 'gyur ba'i nyes pa med do zhes brjod pa ni /üîΩ'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na chod pa rtogs par 'gyur ba'i nyes pa med do zhes brjod pa ni / 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault of understanding what is obstructed.üîΩIf it is said that the object, etc., are not the object of perception,üîΩthen what is this so-called absence?

original: dben pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa ni dngos po @122b med pa nges pa dbang pos bskyed pa ma yin pa nyid kyis rgyas par ston pa'o //
analyzed: dben pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa ni dngos po @122b med pa nges pa dbang pos bskyed pa ma yin pa nyid kyis rgyas par ston pa'o //
translated: This is taught extensively by the statement that a non-entity is not produced by the sense faculties.

original: 'o na rig pa las zhes bya ba ni mngon sum las ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na rig pa las zhes bya ba ni mngon sum las ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: If it is said that it is not from perception,

original: gal te rig pa nyid mi snang ba la ltos nas rig pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te rig pa nyid mi snang ba la ltos nas rig pa med pa yin te /
translated: then it is argued that if awareness itself is not apparent, it is non-existent awareness.

original: des na mngon sum nyid las dngos po med pa sel ba yin no zhes rtsod pa ni /
analyzed: des na mngon sum nyid las dngos po med pa sel ba yin no zhes rtsod pa ni /
translated: Therefore, it is from perception itself that the absence of an entity is excluded.

original: de las gzhan zhes bya ba ni ;
analyzed: de las gzhan zhes bya ba ni ;
translated: From that, what is other than that...

original: gang la ltos nas de bzhin du 'gyur ba snang bzhin pa ni gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes lan brjod pa ni de ma rig pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang la ltos nas de bzhin du 'gyur ba snang bzhin pa ni gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes lan brjod pa ni de ma rig pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response, ‚ÄúThat which is seen in dependence on this is not seen as different,‚Äù is called ‚Äúignorance.‚Äù

original: de sngar zhes bya ba ni dgos pa ste /
analyzed: de sngar zhes bya ba ni dgos pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú Before‚Äù is the purpose.

original: dgag par bya ba bum pa la sogs pa de /
analyzed: dgag par bya ba bum pa la sogs pa de /
translated: The object of negation, such as a pot,

original: bum pa dang bcas pa'i sa phyogs kyi dus su'o //
analyzed: bum pa dang bcas pa'i sa phyogs kyi dus su'o //
translated: is at the time of the place with a pot.

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni lan te /
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni lan te /
translated: ‚Äú At that time‚Äù is the response.

original: sa phyogs 'ga' zhig dmigs pa'i dus de'i tshe dgag par bya ba de'o //
analyzed: sa phyogs 'ga' zhig dmigs pa'i dus de'i tshe dgag par bya ba de'o //
translated: At the time of the observation of some place, the object of negation is there.

original: ji ltar bum pa la sogs pa dang 'brel pa nyid kyis khyad par dang bcas pa'i med par rtogs te /
analyzed: ji ltar bum pa la sogs pa dang 'brel pa nyid kyis khyad par dang bcas pa'i med par rtogs te /
translated: How is it that a pot, etc., is understood to be nonexistent, qualified by the connection with it?

original: mi rtogs pa nyid de de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi rtogs pa nyid de de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is not understood, and that is why.

original: dbang po'i byed pa las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i byed pa las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is beyond the operation of the senses.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni dbang po skyed pa las yin pas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni dbang po skyed pa las yin pas na'o //
translated: ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù is because of the production of the senses.

original: mngon sum nyid ldog pa las de med pa las med par nges pa ma yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mngon sum nyid ldog pa las de med pa las med par nges pa ma yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚Äú If it is not direct perception, then the ascertainment of nonexistence from nonexistence is not from that‚Äù is the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: rang log pa na dngos po med pa nges par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i dogs pa rjes su brjod pa'o //
analyzed: rang log pa na dngos po med pa nges par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i dogs pa rjes su brjod pa'o //
translated: The response to the qualm is as follows.

original: lan ni 'gal ba'am zhes bya ba ni gnod pa'o //
analyzed: lan ni 'gal ba'am zhes bya ba ni gnod pa'o //
translated: The response is ‚ÄúContradictory‚Äù and so on. ‚Äú Contradictory‚Äù means ‚Äúharmful.‚Äù

original: 'on kyang dngos po med par 'gyur ba'i ldog pas ni yod pa bzhin du med pa la nges par byed pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'on kyang dngos po med par 'gyur ba'i ldog pas ni yod pa bzhin du med pa la nges par byed pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not tenable to ascertain nonexistence as it is, by way of the negation of existence.

original: 'on te yang mngon sum ldog pa ni dngos po med par nges par byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on te yang mngon sum ldog pa ni dngos po med par nges par byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: But, if you think that the negation of direct perception does not ascertain nonexistence,

original: 'on kyang de btang ba'i rang bzhin gyi ldog pas yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'on kyang de btang ba'i rang bzhin gyi ldog pas yin no snyam na /
translated: but rather, it is by way of the negation of the nature of that which is relinquished,

original: ldog pa las med pa nges par smra bas rjes su dpag pa khas blangs pa nyid do zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: ldog pa las med pa nges par smra bas rjes su dpag pa khas blangs pa nyid do zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: then, because of advocating that nonexistence is ascertained from negation, you are accepting inference.

original: de nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is meant by ‚Äúthat itself.‚Äù

original: ji ltar na 'di 'gal ba yin snyam na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'di 'gal ba yin snyam na /
translated: How is it contradictory?

original: mngon sum nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is meant by ‚Äúdirect perception itself.‚Äù

original: ji ltar na rig pa med par dngos po med par nges pa'i rgyu ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na rig pa med par dngos po med par nges pa'i rgyu ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that the absence of awareness is not the cause of ascertaining nonexistence?

original: 'di smra ba po dag ces gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di smra ba po dag ces gsungs so //
translated: The speaker of this is called ‚Äúthe one who speaks of non-existence.‚Äù

original: ma nges pa'i phyir yang nges pa'i rgyu ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: ma nges pa'i phyir yang nges pa'i rgyu ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúIt is not a cause of ascertainment because it is not ascertained‚Äù is as follows.

original: des na med pa'i rgyu rig pa med pa las zhes bya ba'o //üîΩ'on te nyes pa 'di gsal ba'i don du gzhan dag brgya la snang ba mi dmigs par khas len na des na snang ba mi dmigs pa las med par nges par rtog pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na med pa'i rgyu rig pa med pa las zhes bya ba'o // 'on te nyes pa 'di gsal ba'i don du gzhan dag brgya la snang ba mi dmigs par khas len na des na snang ba mi dmigs pa las med par nges par rtog pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the cause of non-existence is the non-apprehension of the object of apprehension.

original: snang ba mi dmigs pa khas len na rang gi gzhung mi 'grub po zhes lan 'debs pa @123a * //üîΩni ; 'o na ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snang ba mi dmigs pa khas len na rang gi gzhung mi 'grub po zhes lan 'debs pa @123a * // ni ; 'o na ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But if one accepts that the non-apprehension of appearance is sometimes the cause of non-apprehension, then the thought that ascertains non-existence from the non-apprehension of appearance is ‚ÄúBut if one accepts that the non-apprehension of appearance is sometimes the cause of non-apprehension, then the thought that ascertains non-existence from the non-apprehension of appearance is the cause of non-apprehension.‚ÄùüîΩThe response that if one accepts the non-apprehension of appearance, one‚Äôs own position is not established is ‚ÄúBut if one accepts that the non-apprehension of appearance is sometimes the cause of non-apprehension, then the thought that ascertains non-existence from the non-apprehension of appearance is the cause of non-apprehension.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang de lta na ni rjes su dpag pa khas blangs par yang 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de lta na ni rjes su dpag pa khas blangs par yang 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúMoreover, in that case, one would accept inference‚Äù is as follows.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni yod pa'i las so //üîΩde bas na zhes khong nas byung la /
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni yod pa'i las so // de bas na zhes khong nas byung la /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that‚Äù is from existence.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i zhes sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, from within, ‚Äúone would accept inference.‚Äù

original: gal te de lta na rjes su dpag pa thams cad khas blang pa ji lta bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na rjes su dpag pa thams cad khas blang pa ji lta bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then how can all inferences be accepted?

original: 'dis ni zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dis ni zhes gsungs te /
translated: He says, By this...

original: de nyid ldog pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: de nyid ldog pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: By the words the negation of that... and so on.

original: gal te gzhan gyi sems yod do zhes ga las shes zhes dogs na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi sems yod do zhes ga las shes zhes dogs na /
translated: If you doubt that the existence of another's mind is known,

original: sgra sogs la ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sgra sogs la ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: he says, The existence of sound and so on...

original: de'i ngo bo yang nges par grub ces bya ba ni gzhan gyi sems nges par grub pa'o //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo yang nges par grub ces bya ba ni gzhan gyi sems nges par grub pa'o //
translated: The existence of its nature is also ascertained means that the existence of another's mind is ascertained.

original: gzhan te gzhan gyis sems mngon sum nyid las grub pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gzhan te gzhan gyis sems mngon sum nyid las grub pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn't the existence of another's mind established by direct perception?

original: des na rjes su dpag pa khas blangs pas ci bya snyam na /
analyzed: des na rjes su dpag pa khas blangs pas ci bya snyam na /
translated: Then what is the use of accepting inference?

original: gzhan gyi sems ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, The existence of another's mind...

original: ji ltar mi 'grub snyam na /
analyzed: ji ltar mi 'grub snyam na /
translated: How is it not established?

original: gzhan gyi sems yod pa yin nam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems yod pa yin nam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is the existence of another's mind.

original: de'i rnam par zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i rnam par zhes gsungs so //
translated: The form of that...

original: de ltar rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni mngon sum nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni mngon sum nyid do //
translated: If you think it is because of the realization of that, it is direct perception.

original: gzhan gyi sems ni de ltar rtogs pa yang ma yin na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems ni de ltar rtogs pa yang ma yin na /
translated: And since the mind of another is not known in this way,

original: de'i phyir de ni tha snyad pa rnams kyis rjes su dpag pa kho na las rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni tha snyad pa rnams kyis rjes su dpag pa kho na las rtogs pa yin no //
translated: it is known only through inference for others.

original: gal te gzhan gyi sems tsam nges kyang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i khyad par ji ltar nges she na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi sems tsam nges kyang zhe sdang la sogs pa'i khyad par ji ltar nges she na /
translated: If the mind of another is ascertained as mere mind, how is the distinction of hatred, etc. ascertained?

original: snang ba la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snang ba la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The appearance of hatred, etc.

original: da ni phyed phyi ma zhes bshad pa'i don du dogs pa bsu ba nas /
analyzed: da ni phyed phyi ma zhes bshad pa'i don du dogs pa bsu ba nas /
translated: Now, in order to explain the second half, he anticipates an objection:

original: sdang ba la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba'o //üîΩgal te rnam pa ci zhig ltar zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sdang ba la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba'o // gal te rnam pa ci zhig ltar zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The distinction of hatred, etc.üîΩIn what way?

original: rnam pa gang yang rung bas so //
analyzed: rnam pa gang yang rung bas so //
translated: In any way.

original: len ni brjod pa la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: len ni brjod pa la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression, etc.

original: de dang rjes su mthun pa zhes bya ba ni tshad mas grub pa'i sems pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i'o //
analyzed: de dang rjes su mthun pa zhes bya ba ni tshad mas grub pa'i sems pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i'o //
translated: In accordance with that means in accordance with the ascertainment by a valid cognition.üîΩHow is it possible?

original: ji ltar rung ba zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rung ba zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
translated: This is the doubt.

original: 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni brjod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni brjod pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The engagement has the nature of expression, etc.

original: tshad ma med pa nyid 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma med pa nyid 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that there is no valid cognition.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dpyad nas zhes gsungs so ;
analyzed: dpyad nas zhes gsungs so ;
translated: He says, ‚Äúafter analysis.üîΩ‚Äù

original: / thabs gzhan zhes bya ba ni dogs pa ste /
analyzed: / thabs gzhan zhes bya ba ni dogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAnother method‚Äù is a doubt.

original: brjod pa la sogs pa la gzhan no //
analyzed: brjod pa la sogs pa la gzhan no //
translated: ‚ÄúAnother‚Äù is a statement, etc.

original: lan ni thabs zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni thabs zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is ‚Äúmethod.‚Äù

original: nges pa ni mi dmigs pa'i rtags kyis bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa ni mi dmigs pa'i rtags kyis bskyed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúCertainty‚Äù is produced by the sign of non-apprehension.

original: 'di ji ltar tshad ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar tshad ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is that a valid cognition?

original: de yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThat too.üîΩ‚Äù

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten rgyang 'phen pa'i @123b dgos pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten rgyang 'phen pa'i @123b dgos pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAnother‚Äù is the LokƒÅyata.

original: de skad ces bya ba ni gzhan gyi sems yod par sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: de skad ces bya ba ni gzhan gyi sems yod par sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù is the inference that proves the existence of another‚Äôs mind.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i las kyi don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i las kyi don ni 'di yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúNo‚Äù and so on. The point of the passage is this.

original: gzhan gyis khas blangs pa ni gzhan kho na rtogs par bya ba yin gyi bdag nyid ni ma yin na /
analyzed: gzhan gyis khas blangs pa ni gzhan kho na rtogs par bya ba yin gyi bdag nyid ni ma yin na /
translated: What is accepted by another is only to be understood by another, not by oneself.

original: rang nyid go ji ltar gzhan gyi sems rtogs par byed /
analyzed: rang nyid go ji ltar gzhan gyi sems rtogs par byed /
translated: How can one understand another‚Äôs mind?

original: gzhan gyi sems ma rtogs na yang ji ltar gzhan gyi don du bstan bcos byed par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems ma rtogs na yang ji ltar gzhan gyi don du bstan bcos byed par 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you do not understand the minds of others, how can you compose treatises for the benefit of others?

original: re zhig rten gzhan zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: re zhig rten gzhan zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa'o //
translated: The opponent‚Äôs position is stated in the line ‚ÄúIf there is no other mind. . . . ‚Äù

original: rjes su dpag pa dor nas ni gzhan gyi sems pa rtogs pa la thabs gzhan la mthong ste /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa dor nas ni gzhan gyi sems pa rtogs pa la thabs gzhan la mthong ste /
translated: Having rejected inference, he sees no other means of understanding the minds of others.

original: thabs gzhan med pa des na de ltar zhes bya ba rjes su dpag pa la sems pa nges par byas nas bdag bstan bcos byed pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: thabs gzhan med pa des na de ltar zhes bya ba rjes su dpag pa la sems pa nges par byas nas bdag bstan bcos byed pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Since there is no other means, he concludes that inference is the means of understanding the minds of others and then engages in composing treatises and so on.

original: lan ni 'jig rten pha rol yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni 'jig rten pha rol yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this is stated in the line ‚ÄúThe afterlife too. . . . ‚Äù

original: ji ltar rten gzhan med pas brjod pa la sogs pa'i rtags las de'i sems rtogs pa de bzhin du rtags gzhan las 'jig rten pha rol yang dpogs shing /üîΩ'jig rten pha rol yang zhes bya ba ni dgos pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rten gzhan med pas brjod pa la sogs pa'i rtags las de'i sems rtogs pa de bzhin du rtags gzhan las 'jig rten pha rol yang dpogs shing / 'jig rten pha rol yang zhes bya ba ni dgos pa'o //
translated: Just as the mind of another person is understood on the basis of the evidence of speech and so on, the afterlife too is understood on the basis of other evidence.üîΩThe afterlife too is the purpose.

original: der yang ni 'jig rten pha rol la'o //
analyzed: der yang ni 'jig rten pha rol la'o //
translated: The afterlife too is the object.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni lan te /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni lan te /
translated: The response is stated in the line ‚ÄúThe afterlife too. . . . ‚Äù

original: 'jig rten pha rol dor ba dang da ltar ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol dor ba dang da ltar ro //
translated: The world beyond is rejected, and the present is also.

original: 'di las zhes bya ba ni 'di tshad ma can ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di las zhes bya ba ni 'di tshad ma can ma yin te /
translated: From this, there is no valid cognition,

original: 'di las khyab pa 'dzin pa'i tshad ma 'gal ba yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di las khyab pa 'dzin pa'i tshad ma 'gal ba yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and there is no contradictory valid cognition that comprehends the pervasion from this. This is the meaning.

original: sun 'byin pa gzhan yang brjod bzhed /
analyzed: sun 'byin pa gzhan yang brjod bzhed /
translated: Another refutation is stated.

original: rnam par rtog pa mdzad pa ni 'tsho ba don du gnyer ba yang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa mdzad pa ni 'tsho ba don du gnyer ba yang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The analysis is: Also for one who seeks livelihood.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni rim bzhin sel ba'o //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni rim bzhin sel ba'o //
translated: From that is in order, as before.

original: rnam par rtog pa gnyis bzlog gnas phyogs gzhan dgos par byed pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gnyis bzlog gnas phyogs gzhan dgos par byed pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The other direction is necessary to stop the two misconceptions.

original: 'o na ni zhes bya ba ni lan 'debs pa ni 'dis zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi sems nges pas so //
analyzed: 'o na ni zhes bya ba ni lan 'debs pa ni 'dis zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi sems nges pas so //
translated: If one says then, the answer is: By this, by ascertaining the mind of another.

original: gzhan gyi ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni thabs med par ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni thabs med par ro //
translated: Not by another is without means.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las zhes bya ba ni thabs kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang rjes su byed pa'i 'tsho ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las zhes bya ba ni thabs kyi rjes su 'gro ba dang rjes su byed pa'i 'tsho ba'o //
translated: From the forward and reverse, by the means, the forward and reverse, is livelihood.

original: 'dis ni 'jig rten rgyang 'phen pas ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu rjes su dpog pa khas blangs par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'jig rten rgyang 'phen pas ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu rjes su dpog pa khas blangs par 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is to say that the Lokayatas would be accepting the inference of a future cause.

original: ji ltar rung ba zhes bya ba ni tshad ma can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rung ba zhes bya ba ni tshad ma can ma yin pa'o //
translated: How could that be possible? means it is not valid.

original: dang po la brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dang po la brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: As for the first, it is stated in the line, ‚ÄúIf you say that the mind of another is known by inference.‚Äù

original: gnyis pa la brjod pa ni 'on te gzhan la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa la brjod pa ni 'on te gzhan la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: As for the second, it is stated in the line, ‚ÄúIf you say that it is known by some other means.‚Äù

original: thabs med pa kho na zhes bya ba ni tshad ma med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: thabs med pa kho na zhes bya ba ni tshad ma med pa kho na'o //
translated: The line, ‚ÄúThere is no other means‚Äù means there is no valid means.

That isüîΩthe meaning of the line, ‚ÄúIn that case, the knowledge of the mind of another is established.‚ÄùüîΩThe line, ‚ÄúIf you say that it is known by some other means‚Äù means that it is known by some other means that is not valid.

analyzed: ltan yang gzhan gyi sems rtogs pa grub po zhes brjod pa ni de lta yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The line, ‚ÄúIn that case, the knowledge of the mind of another is established‚Äù means that it is established by that other means.

analyzed: 'on te 'di yang zhes bya ba ni gzhan la thabs med par rtogs pa'o //
translated: The line, ‚ÄúIf you say that it is known by some other means‚Äù means that it is known by some other means that is not valid.
