original: yid ches pas med pa ni ci gzhan la thabs med par rtogs pa yod dam 'on te med ces bya bar ro //
analyzed: yid ches pas med pa ni ci gzhan la thabs med par rtogs pa yod dam 'on te med ces bya bar ro //
translated: The line, ‚ÄúIn that case, the knowledge of the mind of another is established‚Äù means that it is established by that other means.üîΩThe line

original: des na 'jig rten rgyang 'phen las pha rol du gyur pa'i gzhan ji ltar rtogs par byed de thabs med par na mi rtogs pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na 'jig rten rgyang 'phen las pha rol du gyur pa'i gzhan ji ltar rtogs par byed de thabs med par na mi rtogs pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, how can one understand anything other than what is in the Lokayatas system? If there is no means, then one cannot understand anything at all.

original: bdag re zhig ces bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag re zhig ces bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
translated: The word at all means doubtful.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni thabs med pa kho nar ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni thabs med pa kho nar ro //
translated: The word thus means if there is no means at all.

original: 'o na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: 'o na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The word then means answer.

original: brjod pa ni gzhan rtogs pa'i don du yin pas gal te thabs mad pa kho nar te rtogs na 'o na brjod pas ci bya /
analyzed: brjod pa ni gzhan rtogs pa'i don du yin pas gal te thabs mad pa kho nar te rtogs na 'o na brjod pas ci bya /
translated: Since the expression is for the purpose of understanding something other than that, if there is no means at all to understand it, then what is the use of the expression?

original: ji ltar bdag tshad ma med par de rtogs pa de bzhin du gzhan yang yin no zhes dogs pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar bdag tshad ma med par de rtogs pa de bzhin du gzhan yang yin no zhes dogs pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word also expresses the doubt, Just as I understand it without a means of valid knowledge, so also does another.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan no //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni lan no //
translated: The word not and so on is the answer.

original: ji ltar bdag rtogs pa de bzhin du gzhan yang yin no zhes bya ba 'di la tshad ma ci yang med de zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar bdag rtogs pa de bzhin du gzhan yang yin no zhes bya ba 'di la tshad ma ci yang med de zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is, There is no means of valid knowledge at all for this statement, 'Just as I understand it, so also does another.'

original: gang gi phyir brjod pa la sogs pa'i 'jug pa las de yod pa nges par nges na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir brjod pa la sogs pa'i 'jug pa las de yod pa nges par nges na'o //
translated: because it is ascertained that it exists from the engagement of expression, etc.

original: gang gi phyir brjod pa'i phyir te zhes tshul du rjes su dpag pa spangs nas gnas par nus pa ma yin pa des na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir brjod pa'i phyir te zhes tshul du rjes su dpag pa spangs nas gnas par nus pa ma yin pa des na /
translated: because of expression, etc.

original: gzhan na 'jig rten rgyang 'phen gyis kyang rjes su dpag pa khas blang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan na 'jig rten rgyang 'phen gyis kyang rjes su dpag pa khas blang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the Lokayata must accept inference, even though he is incapable of maintaining the method of inference.

original: gal te rjes su dpag pa khas blangs mod /
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pa khas blangs mod /
translated: If you accept inference,

original: tshad mar go ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: tshad mar go ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: how can it be a means of valid knowledge?

original: slu med phyir te zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: slu med phyir te zhes gsungs so //
translated: because it is non-deceptive.

original: gal te smra ba nyid la thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa dang / 'chi ba'i sems nyid la yang mtshams sbyor ba med pas khyab pa yin yang nges par byed pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te smra ba nyid la thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa dang / 'chi ba'i sems nyid la yang mtshams sbyor ba med pas khyab pa yin yang nges par byed pa ma yin na /
translated: If it is not ascertained that one who is not omniscient is a speaker, and that the mind at death has no link to a subsequent life, even though it is pervaded by those,

original: 'o na gzhan la yang yid brtan du ci yod de de'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'o na gzhan la yang yid brtan du ci yod de de'i mtshan nyid can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then how can one be confident about anything else, because it has the same character?

original: des mi slu ba ma yin te /
analyzed: des mi slu ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not non-deceptive.

original: de ltar nye bar bstan pa thob pas mi byed pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar nye bar bstan pa thob pas mi byed pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: Because of the attainment of such a teaching, one does not act.

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to the doubt is ‚ÄúIf . . .‚Äù

original: lan 'debs pa ni rtags log ste rtags ngan pa mthong ba gang yin pa de ni de 'dra ste /
analyzed: lan 'debs pa ni rtags log ste rtags ngan pa mthong ba gang yin pa de ni de 'dra ste /
translated: The response is: ‚ÄúThe opposite of the sign, that is, the seeing of a bad sign, is like that.

original: rtags ma yin no snyam pas rtags de ma nges te rnam par mi 'byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rtags ma yin no snyam pas rtags de ma nges te rnam par mi 'byed pa yin te /
translated: Thinking that it is not a sign, one is uncertain about that sign and does not distinguish it.

original: smra ba nyid la sogs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang 'gal ba ma yin pa la sogs pa 'gal ba yang ma yin 'gal ba pa'i 'bras bu yang ma yin /
analyzed: smra ba nyid la sogs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang 'gal ba ma yin pa la sogs pa 'gal ba yang ma yin 'gal ba pa'i 'bras bu yang ma yin /
translated: Speech and so forth are not contradictory with omniscience and so forth, and are not contradictory with the effect of the contradictory,

original: des khyab pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: des khyab pa yang ma yin te /
translated: and are not pervaded by that.

original: des na the @124b tshom za ba yin no //
analyzed: des na the @124b tshom za ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is doubt.

original: shin tu phye ba'i 'bras bu'am khyab par bya ba de las ni nges pa yin no //
analyzed: shin tu phye ba'i 'bras bu'am khyab par bya ba de las ni nges pa yin no //
translated: From that effect or pervasion that is well distinguished, there is certainty.

original: la lar zhes bya ba ni de'i bu la sogs par ro //
analyzed: la lar zhes bya ba ni de'i bu la sogs par ro //
translated: ‚Äú In some cases‚Äù means in the case of his son and so forth.

original: bzlog par ni tshad ma la min par ro //
analyzed: bzlog par ni tshad ma la min par ro //
translated: ‚Äú The opposite‚Äù is the opposite of valid knowledge.

original: ji ltar snang ba yin zhe na 'brel ba med pas zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar snang ba yin zhe na 'brel ba med pas zhes gsungs so //
translated: How does it appear? It is said that ‚Äúbecause of the lack of connection.‚Äù

original: 'brel pa med pan yid brjod pa ni de'i bu nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pan yid brjod pa ni de'i bu nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The expression ‚Äúhis son‚Äù is the one that is related.

original: pha de ni tshogs pa gcig yin la de ni de dang 'brel pa nyid do zhes dogs pa ni tshogs pa gcig la zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde'i bu nyid dang sngo bsangs nyid ni tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa des na rang bzhin mtshungs pa nyid yin te ngo bo gcig yin no //
analyzed: pha de ni tshogs pa gcig yin la de ni de dang 'brel pa nyid do zhes dogs pa ni tshogs pa gcig la zhes bya ba'o // de'i bu nyid dang sngo bsangs nyid ni tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa des na rang bzhin mtshungs pa nyid yin te ngo bo gcig yin no //
translated: The father is one part of the collection, and he is related to that.üîΩThe son‚Äôs being his son and his being dark are dependent on the same collection. Therefore, they are of the same nature, that is, they are one entity.

original: de'i bdag nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: They are of the same nature, that is, they are one entity.

original: lan du de'i bdag nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: lan du de'i bdag nyid ma yin no //
translated: The response is: ‚ÄúThey are not of the same nature.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: tshogs pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: tshogs pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause of the collection.‚Äù

original: ji ltar zhe na las dang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na las dang zhes gsungs so //
translated: How? He says, ‚Äúbecause of the action.‚Äù

original: sngo bsangs nyid la ni rgyu lhag ma yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sngo bsangs nyid la ni rgyu lhag ma yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because the cause of being dark remains.

original: tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa nyid du khas blangs pas nyes pa brjod pa ni /
analyzed: tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa nyid du khas blangs pas nyes pa brjod pa ni /
translated: The objection to the assertion that they are dependent on the same collection is:

original: tshogs pa gcig /
analyzed: tshogs pa gcig /
translated: ‚ÄúIf they are dependent on the same collection,

original: la rag las pa yin la ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: la rag las pa yin la ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then the son would be the father.‚Äù

original: tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa'i gzugs dang ro dag ni dus gcig kho nar skye ba yin no //
analyzed: tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa'i gzugs dang ro dag ni dus gcig kho nar skye ba yin no //
translated: Form and taste, which are dependent on the same collection, are produced at the same time.

original: de bzhin du sngo bsangs nyid dang de'i bu dag kyang gyur na de lta na yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du sngo bsangs nyid dang de'i bu dag kyang gyur na de lta na yang ma yin no //
translated: But this is not the case with the blue color and the son of the barren woman.

original: dang po ni bur 'gyur bas phyis ni sngo bsangs su 'gro ba dag kyang 'gyur ba'i phyir ro//
analyzed: dang po ni bur 'gyur bas phyis ni sngo bsangs su 'gro ba dag kyang 'gyur ba'i phyir ro//
translated: The first is a son, and later becomes blue.

original: gang gi phyir de dang 'brel pa ma yin pa'i des na rtags kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dang 'brel pa ma yin pa'i des na rtags kyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since it is not related to that, it is not a reason.

original: 'di lta bu'i tshul can zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i tshul can zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúSuch a method‚Äù means

original: smra ba nyid la sogs pa dang 'dra ba dag go //
analyzed: smra ba nyid la sogs pa dang 'dra ba dag go //
translated: like speech, etc.

original: gang zhig mi 'khrul te gang yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig mi 'khrul te gang yang ma yin no //
translated: There is no non-erroneous [reason] at all.

original: 'gal ba'i 'bras bu'am khyab bya ni 'ga' yang grub yang grub pa med do //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i 'bras bu'am khyab bya ni 'ga' yang grub yang grub pa med do //
translated: There is no established effect or pervaded [property] that is contradictory.

original: res 'ga' de la yod pa tsam gyis ni de'i 'bras bu'am de'i khyab byar mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: res 'ga' de la yod pa tsam gyis ni de'i 'bras bu'am de'i khyab byar mi 'grub ste /
translated: Merely existing sometimes does not establish it as the effect or pervaded [property] of that,

original: ha cang thal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ha cang thal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because it would lead to absurd consequences. This is the meaning.

original: dngos po gang las dngos po 'ga' la rgol ba de'i rtogs pa grub par 'gyur pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po gang las dngos po 'ga' la rgol ba de'i rtogs pa grub par 'gyur pa ste /
translated: Whatever thing is opposed to some other thing, the cognition of that is established.

original: nges pa'i rang bzhin nges pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa nges par gyur pa'i dngos po ni de ltar rtogs pa'i yul de las skye bas 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: nges pa'i rang bzhin nges pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa nges par gyur pa'i dngos po ni de ltar rtogs pa'i yul de las skye bas 'bras bu'am /
translated: The nature of the ascertained is the opposite of the non-ascertained. The ascertained thing arises from the object that is cognized in that way, and therefore it is the effect or the pervaded.

original: de'i ngo bo khyab par bya ba yin par gdon mi za'o //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo khyab par bya ba yin par gdon mi za'o //
translated: There is no doubt that it is the nature that is pervaded.

original: de las nges pa ni de'i 'bras bu 'am khyab par bya ba ma yin pa mi srid do //
analyzed: de las nges pa ni de'i 'bras bu 'am khyab par bya ba ma yin pa mi srid do //
translated: It is impossible that what is ascertained is not the effect or the pervaded,

original: nges pa nyid la de ltar brjod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgal te rjes su dpag pa thams cad de'i bu nyid la sogs pa dang / mtshungs pa @125a * //
analyzed: nges pa nyid la de ltar brjod pa'i phyir ro // gal te rjes su dpag pa thams cad de'i bu nyid la sogs pa dang / mtshungs pa @125a * //
translated: because it is said to be just that.

original: ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las yin snyam na de'i bdag nyid dang de las zhes smos so //
analyzed: ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las yin snyam na de'i bdag nyid dang de las zhes smos so //
translated: If one thinks, How is it that all inferences are not the same as that son and so on? it is said that nature and from that.

original: gal te gang la bsgrub par bya ba 'khrul pa med par rtogs pa de nyid rtags ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te gang la bsgrub par bya ba 'khrul pa med par rtogs pa de nyid rtags ma yin nam /
translated: If it is asked, Isn't that which is understood without error in the probandum the reason?

original: de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i 'brel pas ni ci bya snyam na /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i 'brel pas ni ci bya snyam na /
translated: What is the connection between the object and the cognition?

original: gang las zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde lta ma yin na ni zhes bya ba ni de'i bdag nyid de las byung ba'i 'brel pa med na'o //
analyzed: gang las zhes bya ba'o // de lta ma yin na ni zhes bya ba ni de'i bdag nyid de las byung ba'i 'brel pa med na'o //
translated: The connection is that the cognition arises from the object.üîΩOtherwise, if there were no connection between the object and the cognition,

original: ha cang thal ba ni khas blangs par yang mi 'thad do zhes gsungs pa ni /üîΩthams cad las ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ha cang thal ba ni khas blangs par yang mi 'thad do zhes gsungs pa ni / thams cad las ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: then the absurd consequence would be that any cognition could arise from any object.üîΩThis is what is meant by the statement, ‚ÄúIt follows that any cognition could arise from any object.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir gang yang rung ba las rtogs pa ni 'khrul pa yin par de'i phyir ro //üîΩgal te 'brel pa du ma yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang yang rung ba las rtogs pa ni 'khrul pa yin par de'i phyir ro // gal te 'brel pa du ma yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: Because it is not possible for any cognition to arise from any object,üîΩif there were no connection between the object and the cognition, then any cognition could arise from any object.

original: des na de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i 'brel pa nyid dang ldan pa zhes ci ste sa brjod snyam na /
analyzed: des na de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i 'brel pa nyid dang ldan pa zhes ci ste sa brjod snyam na /
translated: If there are many connections, then why is it said that the connection is only that the cognition arises from the object?

original: 'brel pa ni bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa ni bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The connection is refuted.

original: tshogs pa gcig la rag lus pa'i 'brel pas yang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kho na yin no zhes brjod pa ni tshogs pa gcig las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa gcig la rag lus pa'i 'brel pas yang de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid kho na yin no zhes brjod pa ni tshogs pa gcig las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The connection is only that the cognition arises from the object, because the connection is dependent on the collection.

original: de nyid las zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa rnam pa gnyis kho na las so //
analyzed: de nyid las zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa rnam pa gnyis kho na las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that alone‚Äù means from just the two kinds of relation.

original: de yod kyang mi 'khrul ba ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de yod kyang mi 'khrul ba ji ltar zhe na /
translated: But how can there be non-error even when that exists?

original: 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn this way‚Äù is stated.

original: gzhan du de med kyang 'gyur ba med kyang des kyang ji ltar de la mi 'khrul pa yin snyam na /
analyzed: gzhan du de med kyang 'gyur ba med kyang des kyang ji ltar de la mi 'khrul pa yin snyam na /
translated: But how can there be non-error in that even when there is no other and there is no change?

original: de dag rang bzhin zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de dag rang bzhin zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúTheir nature‚Äù is stated.

original: 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dag gi rang bzhin bsgrub par bya ba med na mi 'byung ba nyid dpe la mthong ba yin pa nyid gzhan yang rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dag gi rang bzhin bsgrub par bya ba med na mi 'byung ba nyid dpe la mthong ba yin pa nyid gzhan yang rang bzhin yin te /
translated: The nature of the effect and the nature of the cause are seen in the example to be the invariable concomitance of the probandum and the probans.

original: des na ji ltar 'khrul par 'gyur /
analyzed: des na ji ltar 'khrul par 'gyur /
translated: So how can there be error?

original: re zhig phyed phyi ma 'chad pa ni 'bras bu dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: re zhig phyed phyi ma 'chad pa ni 'bras bu dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The latter half of the verse is explained: ‚ÄúThe effect . . .‚Äù

original: de nyid ces bya ba bsgrub par bya ba med na mi 'byung ba nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba bsgrub par bya ba med na mi 'byung ba nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúThat alone‚Äù is the invariable concomitance of the probandum.

original: de'i bu nyid la sogs pa ni 'di yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de'i bu nyid la sogs pa ni 'di yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the son-ness, etc., of that nonexistent?

original: nges pa thams cad de dang mtshungs pa nyid du ji ltar 'gyur zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: nges pa thams cad de dang mtshungs pa nyid du ji ltar 'gyur zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: How can all the certainties be just like that?

original: de'i bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The son of that one and so on.

original: da ni phyed dang po 'chad de rgyu dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: da ni phyed dang po 'chad de rgyu dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Now, the first half is explained, beginning with cause and so on.

original: gal te re 'ga' rgyu dang rang gi ngo bo yin yang gzhan gyi tshe yang de ltar yin par ga las she na /
analyzed: gal te re 'ga' rgyu dang rang gi ngo bo yin yang gzhan gyi tshe yang de ltar yin par ga las she na /
translated: If it is sometimes the case that even though there is a cause and an intrinsic nature, at other times it is not so, then how is it?

original: de ltar rtogs pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, thus it is understood.

original: ci ste yang don dam pa'i tshad ma spyod pa na tha snyad med par thal ba ci ste brjod snyam na 'di ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ci ste yang don dam pa'i tshad ma spyod pa na tha snyad med par thal ba ci ste brjod snyam na 'di ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: But if one thinks, When engaging ultimate valid cognition, why is it said that the consequence is that there is no conventional usage? it is said, this is not so.

original: gzhan don dam pa'i skabs ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan don dam pa'i skabs ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that the ultimate is the context of others.

original: de'i phyir tha snyad 'chad par thal bar grub pa ni 'thad pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir tha snyad 'chad par thal bar grub pa ni 'thad pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that the consequence is the explanation of the conventional.

original: tha snyad med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: tha snyad med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And it is not the case that there is no conventional usage.

original: des na tha @125b snyad pa dag gis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na tha @125b snyad pa dag gis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said, by those who are conventional.

original: gal te rjes su dpag pa ni 'jug pa'i thabs ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pa ni 'jug pa'i thabs ma yin na /
translated: If inference is not the means of engagement,üîΩthen how is it that one who seeks that?

original: des na ji ltar de don du gnyer ba zhes dogs pa ni thabs med par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na ji ltar de don du gnyer ba zhes dogs pa ni thabs med par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said, without means.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: It is not so is the reply.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: rab tu grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste tha snyad du'o //
analyzed: rab tu grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste tha snyad du'o //
translated: Because of the establishment, i.e., conventionally.

original: rnam par dpyad na zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par dpyad na zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf one analyzes‚Äù means ‚Äúif one doubts.‚Äù

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa 'gog pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNo‚Äù means ‚Äúthe objection is rejected.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩrnam par dpyod pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / rnam par dpyod pa yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Why?üîΩ‚ÄúBecause of the analysis‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause of the investigation.‚Äù

original: rjes su dpag pa spangs kyang de gdon mi za bar khas blangs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa spangs kyang de gdon mi za bar khas blangs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Even though one rejects inference, one must accept it, i.e., the analysis.

original: 'di nyid dpe'i sgo nas bzhag gang du mdzad pa ni de ni zhes bya ba ste tshul lugs de na'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid dpe'i sgo nas bzhag gang du mdzad pa ni de ni zhes bya ba ste tshul lugs de na'o //
translated: This very point is presented through an example: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù means ‚Äúin that system.‚Äù

original: gang zhe na lam du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhe na lam du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What system? ‚ÄúOn the path.‚Äù

original: 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi rtags dang 'brel ba'i phyir go bar byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi rtags dang 'brel ba'i phyir go bar byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: Because of the connection with the effect and the nature of the reason, it is the cause of understanding.

original: mi dmigs pa go ci ltar de /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa go ci ltar de /
translated: How is non-apprehension that?üîΩBecause of the absence of that.

original: de med pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni 'o na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The objection is anticipated: ‚ÄúWell then,‚Äù etc.

original: 'brel pa rnam pa gnyis srid pa kho na las go bar byed pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni de'i bdag nyid dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa rnam pa gnyis srid pa kho na las go bar byed pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni de'i bdag nyid dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúIt is understood only from the two kinds of relation‚Äù refers to ‚Äúidentity‚Äù and ‚Äúcausality.‚Äù

original: rang gi ngo bo ni shing la sogs par rang rgyun me la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ni shing la sogs par rang rgyun me la sogs pa la'o //
translated: The intrinsic nature of the fire is the fuel, etc.

original: bltar rung zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin khyad par can du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bltar rung zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin khyad par can du gyur pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Visible‚Äù means that it has a special nature.

original: mthong ba'i rgyu gzhan dag yod par zhes bya ba ni rkyen gzhan tshang ba'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i rgyu gzhan dag yod par zhes bya ba ni rkyen gzhan tshang ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Other causes of seeing are present‚Äù means that the other conditions are complete.

original: snang ba med na ni zhes bya ba ni ji ltar yod ces 'brel to //
analyzed: snang ba med na ni zhes bya ba ni ji ltar yod ces 'brel to //
translated: ‚Äú If there is no light‚Äù means ‚Äúif it exists as it is.‚Äù

original: 'dir na rang bzhin mi dmigs pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir na rang bzhin mi dmigs pa bstan to //
translated: Here, the non-apprehension of intrinsic nature is taught.

original: de dang ldan pa'ang zhes bya ba ni rim pa gzhan du byas pa'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'ang zhes bya ba ni rim pa gzhan du byas pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Possessing that‚Äù means that it is made into another category.

original: rang gi ngo bo nges pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nges pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: It possesses the determination of its intrinsic nature.

original: ji skad brjod pa'i mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: ji skad brjod pa'i mi dmigs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni mi 'thad de /
translated: ‚Äú Possessing the non-apprehension as described‚Äù is not tenable.

original: rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa dag gis ni /
analyzed: rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa dag gis ni /
translated: The non-apprehension of the cause and the non-apprehension of the pervader

original: dmigs par mi rung pa dang ldan pa dag kho na med par nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs par mi rung pa dang ldan pa dag kho na med par nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is certain that only those that are not suitable as objects of the mind do not exist.

original: 'dis ni rgyu dang khyab par byed pa dag bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rgyu dang khyab par byed pa dag bshad pa yin no //
translated: By this, cause and pervasion are explained.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa nyid ma yin na'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa nyid ma yin na'o //
translated: If it were not so, i.e., if it were not a relation,

original: gal te de dang 'brel pa'ang yin la de med par yang yod pa la 'gal ba ci yod ce na /
analyzed: gal te de dang 'brel pa'ang yin la de med par yang yod pa la 'gal ba ci yod ce na /
translated: if it were related to that and also existed without that, what would be the contradiction?

original: gal te de med na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te de med na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it were not that, i.e., if it were not related to that,

original: de med pa na yod pa yang yin la med pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba yin la 'grel pa yang med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de med pa na yod pa yang yin la med pa yang yin no zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba yin la 'grel pa yang med pa nyid yin no //
translated: it would be both existent and non-existent when that does not exist. This is a contradiction, and there is no commentary.

original: gal te de lta na yang rjes su dpag pa tshad ma yin no zhes bsgrubs par ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang rjes su dpag pa tshad ma yin no zhes bsgrubs par ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: Even if it were so, how could it be established that inference is valid cognition?

original: tshad mar khas ma blangs kyang kho bo cag la nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshad mar khas ma blangs kyang kho bo cag la nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes dogs pa ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because there is no fault for us even if we do not accept it as valid cognition. This is the doubt expressed by the word because.

original: spyi zhes @126a * //
analyzed: spyi zhes @126a * //
translated: The general

original: bya ba lkog tu gyur pa'i blo tshad ma ma yin na yang rang gi khas blangs pa'i lkog tu gyur /üîΩkhyim dang kun dga' ra ba la sogs pa de med 'thob 'gyur te /
analyzed: bya ba lkog tu gyur pa'i blo tshad ma ma yin na yang rang gi khas blangs pa'i lkog tu gyur / khyim dang kun dga' ra ba la sogs pa de med 'thob 'gyur te /
translated: Even though the cognition of an action that is hidden is not a valid cognition, it is still accepted that the hidden object exists.

original: bdag cag gis 'dod pa'i 'jig rten pha rol gyi dngos po bzhin no //
analyzed: bdag cag gis 'dod pa'i 'jig rten pha rol gyi dngos po bzhin no //
translated: Just like the object that is desired by us, the world beyond exists.

original: 'on kyang yang khyim dang kun dga' ra ba la sogs pa mthong ba dag ni yang mthong ba yod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang yang khyim dang kun dga' ra ba la sogs pa mthong ba dag ni yang mthong ba yod pa yin te /
translated: But, you might say, the house, the park, and so on, that were seen are seen again.

original: des na med pa ma yin la /
analyzed: des na med pa ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, they are not nonexistent.

original: 'jig rten pha rol ni nam yang ma mthong bas na med par 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol ni nam yang ma mthong bas na med par 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa ni /
translated: But the world beyond is never seen, so it must be nonexistent.

original: gal te dbang rnams kyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te dbang rnams kyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this is stated in the lines ‚ÄúIf the faculties were to cease, etc.‚Äù

original: khyim dang kun dga' ra ba la sogs pa ni dbang po mthong ba las phyis ma mthong yang /
analyzed: khyim dang kun dga' ra ba la sogs pa ni dbang po mthong ba las phyis ma mthong yang /
translated: The house, the park, and so on, are seen by the faculties and then are not seen.

original: yang phyis mthong ba yin gyi 'jig rten pha rol ni de ltar ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang phyis mthong ba yin gyi 'jig rten pha rol ni de ltar ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: But they are seen again later. The world beyond is not like that.

original: lan ni de yin zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lan ni de yin zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The response to this is stated in the lines ‚ÄúThis is the response, etc.‚Äù

original: rnam grangs kyis mthong ba zhes bya ba de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam grangs kyis mthong ba zhes bya ba de ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that the seeing is nominal.

original: shes pa skyes par nus pa'i bdag nyid kyis dbang po dang 'bras bu tsam skyes pa'i bdag nyid kyi nus pa la'o //
analyzed: shes pa skyes par nus pa'i bdag nyid kyis dbang po dang 'bras bu tsam skyes pa'i bdag nyid kyi nus pa la'o //
translated: The sense faculty and the mere effect that is generated by the nature of the arising of consciousness are the objects of the sense faculty.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na dbang po blo ni srid phyir zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na dbang po blo ni srid phyir zhes gsungs so //
translated: Why? Because the sense faculty is possible for the cognition.

original: dbang po dang nus pa la sogs pa dag ni dbang po'i blos 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po dang nus pa la sogs pa dag ni dbang po'i blos 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: The sense faculty, the potential, and so on are not apprehended by the sense cognition.

original: des na 'jig rten pha rol bzhin du khyed nyid kyis 'dod pa'i dbang po la sogs pa med par thal lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na 'jig rten pha rol bzhin du khyed nyid kyis 'dod pa'i dbang po la sogs pa med par thal lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it follows that the sense faculty and so on do not exist, just like the world beyond.

original: de yang med mod ces bya ba ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang med mod ces bya ba ni mi rigs te /
translated: That also does not exist.

original: rgyu med par mthong ba khas len pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa ni med par rtogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu med par mthong ba khas len pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa ni med par rtogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because it is contradictory to accept seeing without a cause. This is what is said in ‚Äúthe realization of nonexistence.‚ÄùüîΩIf the sense faculties, etc.

original: gal te dbang rnams kyis zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te dbang rnams kyis zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel pa ni 'on te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of ‚Äúif‚Äù is ‚Äúperhaps.‚Äù

original: rnam pa de lta bu nyid ces bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol dang mtshungs pa dag kho na'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu nyid ces bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol dang mtshungs pa dag kho na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSuch a form‚Äù means that it is just like the other world.

original: de min zhes bya ba'i 'ang gi sgra yod pas 'phangs pa'i lan nyid re zhig brjod pa ni gang gi tshe zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de min zhes bya ba'i 'ang gi sgra yod pas 'phangs pa'i lan nyid re zhig brjod pa ni gang gi tshe zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúbut‚Äù in ‚Äúit is not so‚Äù indicates an answer to the objection.

original: ma mthong ba'i mod kho na la khyim dang kun dga' ra ba la sogs pa de nyid kyi tshe mthong ba las yod par grub mod /
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i mod kho na la khyim dang kun dga' ra ba la sogs pa de nyid kyi tshe mthong ba las yod par grub mod /
translated: When one sees the house, the garden, and so on, at that very moment, one sees that they exist.

original: de las sngar ni yod par mi grub ste tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las sngar ni yod par mi grub ste tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But one cannot establish that they exist prior to that, because there is no valid cognition.

original: de'i tshe srog chags gzhan gyis mthong ba yin no zhes dogs pa ni sngar yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe srog chags gzhan gyis mthong ba yin no zhes dogs pa ni sngar yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The doubt that the other world is seen by another living being is addressed in the line ‚ÄúBefore, too.‚Äù

original: 'jig rten pha rol ni lus kyang rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol ni lus kyang rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: The other world is not perceived by the body.

original: des na med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it is nonexistent.

original: 'jig rten pha rol yang zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol yang zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The answer to the question ‚ÄúWhat about the other world?‚Äù is given in the line ‚ÄúThe other world, too.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyi rtogs pa med pa bzhin du khyim dang kun dga' ra ba la sogs pa dag la yang de'i rtogs pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma @126b yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rtogs pa med pa bzhin du khyim dang kun dga' ra ba la sogs pa dag la yang de'i rtogs pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma @126b yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: Just as there is no cognition of other minds, so too there is no valid cognition establishing the cognition of houses, gardens, and so on.

original: 'jig rten pha rol las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is stated in the line ‚ÄúThere is no cognition of other worlds.‚Äù

original: gzhan bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa khyed kyis mthong ba nyid kyang ngo //
analyzed: gzhan bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa khyed kyis mthong ba nyid kyang ngo //
translated: You see other things, such as pots and cloth.

original: snam bu'i rtogs pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i tha snyad mthong ba las gzhan rtogs par 'grub po zhes dogs ba bsu ba ni de ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snam bu'i rtogs pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i tha snyad mthong ba las gzhan rtogs par 'grub po zhes dogs ba bsu ba ni de ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to the qualm that the cognition of cloth is established by seeing the expression that accords with the cognition of cloth is stated in the line ‚ÄúIn that case.‚Äù

original: lan ni rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba'o //üîΩ'ang gi sgras 'phangs pa'i sun 'byin pa brjod nas de min zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel pa ni dbang po'i 'am zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni rjes su dpag pa zhes bya ba'o // 'ang gi sgras 'phangs pa'i sun 'byin pa brjod nas de min zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel pa ni dbang po'i 'am zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is stated in the line ‚ÄúInference.‚ÄùüîΩThe response to the qualm that the opponent raises by the word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is stated in the line ‚ÄúIt is not the case that the sense faculty.‚ÄùüîΩThe word ‚Äúonly‚Äù in the line ‚ÄúIt is not the case that the sense faculty is the only cause of the arising of the cognition‚Äù is explained in the line ‚ÄúIt is not the case that the sense faculty.‚Äù

original: rung ba nyid la zhes bya ba ni rgyu rnams kyi nus pa la'o //üîΩ'o na khyed kyis de ci ltar rtogs she na /
analyzed: rung ba nyid la zhes bya ba ni rgyu rnams kyi nus pa la'o //üîΩ'o na khyed kyis de ci ltar rtogs she na /
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù in the line ‚ÄúIt is not the case that the sense faculty is the only cause of the arising of the cognition‚Äù is explained in the line ‚ÄúIt is not the case that the sense faculty.‚ÄùüîΩThe word ‚Äúonly‚Äù in the line ‚ÄúIt is not the case that the sense faculty is the only cause of the arising of the cognition‚Äù is explained in the line ‚ÄúIt is not the case that the sense faculty.‚ÄùüîΩThe word ‚Äúonly‚Äù in the line ‚ÄúIt is not the case that the sense faculty is the only cause of the arising of the cognition‚Äù is explained in the line ‚ÄúIt is not the case that the sense faculty.‚ÄùüîΩThe word ‚Äúonly‚Äù in the line ‚ÄúIt is not the case that the sense faculty is the only cause of the arising of the cognition‚Äù is explained in the line ‚ÄúIt is not the case that the sense faculty.‚ÄùüîΩThe word ‚Äúonly‚Äù in the line ‚ÄúIt is not the case that the sense faculty is the only cause of the arising of the cognition‚Äù is explained in the line ‚ÄúIt is not the case that the sense faculty.‚ÄùüîΩThe word ‚Äúonly‚Äù in the line ‚ÄúIt is not the case that the sense faculty is the only cause of the arising of the cognition‚Äù is explained in the line ‚ÄúIt is not the case that the sense faculty.‚ÄùüîΩThe word ‚Äúonly‚Äù in the line ‚ÄúIt is not the case that the sense faculty is the only cause of the arising of the cognition‚Äù is explained in the line ‚ÄúIt is not the case that the sense faculty.‚ÄùüîΩThe word ‚Äúonly‚Äù in the

original: 'bras bu rang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'bras bu rang zhes gsungs so //
translated: The result is called ‚Äúself.‚Äù

original: de dag ces bya ba ni dbang po dang rung ba dag go //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni dbang po dang rung ba dag go //
translated: ‚Äú Those‚Äù refers to the sense faculties and the object.

original: des na dbang po la sogs pa la yang med par 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa'o //
analyzed: des na dbang po la sogs pa la yang med par 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is doubted that the sense faculties and so on would not exist.

original: de lta yin mod ci skyon snyam na /
analyzed: de lta yin mod ci skyon snyam na /
translated: What is the fault if that is so?

original: de med na ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de med na ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúIf that does not exist.‚Äù

original: dbang po dang rung ba dbang mad na'o //
analyzed: dbang po dang rung ba dbang mad na'o //
translated: If the sense faculties and the object do not exist.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rtsa bar yang //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rtsa bar yang //
translated: Therefore, in the root text, it is said,

original: blo dang skye ba rgyu med 'gyur //
analyzed: blo dang skye ba rgyu med 'gyur //
translated: ‚ÄúThe mind and birth would be without a cause.‚Äù

original: zhes zlas dbye ba yin no ;
analyzed: zhes zlas dbye ba yin no ;
translated: This is the analysis.

original: / rgyu mtshan med pa nyid kyang ma yin te de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / rgyu mtshan med pa nyid kyang ma yin te de'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not that there is no reason, because of that.

original: 'bras bu mthong ba dang zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu mthong ba dang zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú The result is seen‚Äù is the forward pervasion.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni dbang po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni dbang po la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the sense faculties and so on.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag par bya ba yang yod pas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag par bya ba yang yod pas na'o //
translated: ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù is because the object of inference also exists.

original: de lta bu nyid do zhes bya ba ni dbang po la sogs pa bzhin du shin tu lkog tu gyur pa rjes su dpag par bya ba ni yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de lta bu nyid do zhes bya ba ni dbang po la sogs pa bzhin du shin tu lkog tu gyur pa rjes su dpag par bya ba ni yod pa kho na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is just so‚Äù means that it is only inference that can determine the extremely hidden object, just as the senses can determine the obvious object.

original: gang gi phyir lkog tu gyur pa mngon sum 'jug pa ma yin pa des na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir lkog tu gyur pa mngon sum 'jug pa ma yin pa des na'o //
translated: Because the obvious object is not the domain of direct perception,

original: spyi zhes bya ba ni lkog tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: spyi zhes bya ba ni lkog tu gyur pa'o //
translated: the general is the domain of inference.

original: mngon sum gyis spyi mi rtogs so zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis spyi mi rtogs so zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na /
translated: How do you know that direct perception does not determine the general?

original: 'di ltar rnam rtog med nyid kyis na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam rtog med nyid kyis na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because it is devoid of conceptualization.

original: gtan tshigs kyi gtam pa'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi gtam pa'o //
translated: This is the argument.

original: 'o na ji ltar spyi 'dzin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar spyi 'dzin zhe na /
translated: How then is the general determined?

original: rnam rtog med par zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam rtog med par zhes gsungs te /
translated: The text says, ‚Äúby the absence of conceptualization.‚Äù

original: spyi ni rnam par rtog pa kho nas 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: spyi ni rnam par rtog pa kho nas 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the general is determined only by conceptualization.

original: spyir 'dzin pa yang rjes su dpag pa kho na yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: spyir 'dzin pa yang rjes su dpag pa kho na yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: The text says that the determination of the general is only inference.

original: de phyir zhes bya ba mngon sum mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de phyir zhes bya ba mngon sum mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means because direct perception does not operate.

original: dbang po la sogs pa de la rjes su dpag pa nyid tshad ma yin gyi mngon sum ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa de la rjes su dpag pa nyid tshad ma yin gyi mngon sum ni ma yin no //
translated: Inference is a valid means of knowledge in regard to that, but perception is not.

original: de ltar gzhal bya rang gi mtshan nyid gcig kho na'o //
analyzed: de ltar gzhal bya rang gi mtshan nyid gcig kho na'o //
translated: Thus, the object of comprehension is only one, the particular.

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid bzhin gyi rtogs pa'i yul yin te /
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid bzhin gyi rtogs pa'i yul yin te /
translated: It is the object of the understanding of the universal and the particular.

original: des na mtshan ma gcig kho na yin no zhes bya ba gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: des na mtshan ma gcig kho na yin no zhes bya ba gsal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is clear that it is only the particular that is the object.

original: rtog pa'i dbye ba nyid tshad ma'i dbye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩda ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan @127a * //
analyzed: rtog pa'i dbye ba nyid tshad ma'i dbye ba yin pa'i phyir ro // da ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan @127a * //
translated: Because the divisions of the valid means of knowledge are just the divisions of the understanding.

original: nyid can gcig tu gyur pa'i gzhal bya gsum pa yod pa'i phyir de'i yul can tshad ma gsum par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa 'god pa ni 'o na kha dog la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyid can gcig tu gyur pa'i gzhal bya gsum pa yod pa'i phyir de'i yul can tshad ma gsum par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rtsod pa 'god pa ni 'o na kha dog la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Now, in order to set forth the objection that a third valid means of knowledge would exist because a third object of comprehension would exist, which is both the universal and the particular, he says, ‚ÄúWell then, color and so on . . .‚Äù

original: gal te spyi dang khyad par rang bzhin gyis gzhal bya rnams pa gnyis kho na yin no zhes bya bar nges pa yin na ;
analyzed: gal te spyi dang khyad par rang bzhin gyis gzhal bya rnams pa gnyis kho na yin no zhes bya bar nges pa yin na ;
translated: If it is certain that the objects of comprehension are only two, the universal and the particular,

original: 'o na rang gi mtshan nyid 'di mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa spyi'i bdag nyid can dag gis 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ci ltar de rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na rang gi mtshan nyid 'di mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa spyi'i bdag nyid can dag gis 'dzin pa gang yin pa de ci ltar de rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Well then, how is it that the apprehension of the aspects of impermanence, etc., which have the nature of universals, does not understand that ?

original: rtogs pa yang yin te des na de'i blo ni tshad ma gzhan yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa yang yin te des na de'i blo ni tshad ma gzhan yin no //
translated: It is understood, and therefore the cognition of that is another valid cognition.
