original: des na zhes ni sbyor bas @128b na'o ;
analyzed: des na zhes ni sbyor bas @128b na'o ;
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù is applied to that.

original: / gal te kha dog la sogs pa'i spyi la mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa sbyor na dngos po'i chos nyid du mi 'gyur la khyad par la lhag par zhen pa dang 'jug par yang ji ltar 'gyur zhes dogs pa ni /
analyzed: / gal te kha dog la sogs pa'i spyi la mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa sbyor na dngos po'i chos nyid du mi 'gyur la khyad par la lhag par zhen pa dang 'jug par yang ji ltar 'gyur zhes dogs pa ni /
translated: If impermanence, etc. were applied to the universals of color, etc., it would not be the reality of things. How could there be adherence to the particulars and engagement?

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù is the doubt.

original: spyi yang zhes bya ba ni kha dog la sogs pa'i'o //
analyzed: spyi yang zhes bya ba ni kha dog la sogs pa'i'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe universal‚Äù is of color, etc.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i rang bzhin te ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i rang bzhin te ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù is the nature of impermanence, etc.

original: gal te de lta na yang ji ltar dngos po'i chos ma yin snyam na spyi ni zhes smras so //
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang ji ltar dngos po'i chos ma yin snyam na spyi ni zhes smras so //
translated: If it is asked how it is not the reality of things even if it is so, ‚Äúthe universal‚Äù is stated.

original: dngos po nyid de ltar lhag par zhen par bya bas spyi yin pas des na dngos po'i chos ma yin pa ma yin la de la lhag par zhen pa dang 'jug pa dang mi 'gal lo zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: dngos po nyid de ltar lhag par zhen par bya bas spyi yin pas des na dngos po'i chos ma yin pa ma yin la de la lhag par zhen pa dang 'jug pa dang mi 'gal lo zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
translated: The universal is not a non-entity, because it is a thing, since it is the entity itself that is conceived as such. Therefore, it is not a non-entity, and there is no contradiction in conceiving it as such and engaging in it.

original: dngos med ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: dngos med ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: The universal is the entity itself,

original: mi rtag pa'i sgra las kha dog gi spyi ni dngos po las gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i sgra las kha dog gi spyi ni dngos po las gzhan ma yin no //
translated: because the universal of color is not different from the entity, since it is derived from the word impermanent.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dngos po de nyid de ltar de byas pa yin par grub pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po de nyid de ltar de byas pa yin par grub pa ste /
translated: Because the entity itself is established as such,

original: nges par grub phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par grub phyir ro //
translated: because it is definitely established.üîΩIf you doubt that it is not established by another conception that is unrelated because its own characteristics do not appear to it, then the reply is:

original: gal te rang gi mtshan nyid gzhan mi snang ba'i phyir ma 'brel ba'i rnam par rtog pa gzhan gyis ji ltar 'thob snyam du dogs pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid gzhan la mi snang ba'i phyir ma 'brel pa'i rnam par rtog pa gzhan gyis 'grub pa ma yinüîΩte / 'thob pa ma yin zhe na ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te rang gi mtshan nyid gzhan mi snang ba'i phyir ma 'brel ba'i rnam par rtog pa gzhan gyis ji ltar 'thob snyam du dogs pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid gzhan la mi snang ba'i phyir ma 'brel pa'i rnam par rtog pa gzhan gyis 'grub pa ma yinüîΩte / 'thob pa ma yin zhe na ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is not established by another conception that is unrelated because its own characteristics do not appear to it.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid rnam par rtog pa las 'grub pa yang yin no zhes bya bar ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid rnam par rtog pa las 'grub pa yang yin no zhes bya bar ni mi 'thad do //
translated: It is not tenable to say that the intrinsic identity is established from conceptualization.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid de nyid brgyud nas 'brel pa'i rnam par rtog pas 'grub pa'i phyir de 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid de nyid brgyud nas 'brel pa'i rnam par rtog pas 'grub pa'i phyir de 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is established by conceptualization that is indirectly related to that intrinsic identity, and because it is obtained.

original: gal te spyi zhes bya ba nas zhe na'i bar gyis kha dog dang mi rtag pa gnyi ga spyi'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dngos po ma yin par dogs pa bsu ba'o //
analyzed: gal te spyi zhes bya ba nas zhe na'i bar gyis kha dog dang mi rtag pa gnyi ga spyi'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dngos po ma yin par dogs pa bsu ba'o //
translated: If you say that the intrinsic identity is not a thing because it is the nature of a universal, up to the phrase ‚Äúbecause it is a universal,‚Äù he anticipates the qualm that both color and impermanence are the nature of universals.

original: da lta kha dog nyid ni dngos po'i chos dngos po'i rang bzhin ma yin na /
analyzed: da lta kha dog nyid ni dngos po'i chos dngos po'i rang bzhin ma yin na /
translated: Now, if color itself is not the nature of a thing,

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa de yang dngos po nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa de yang dngos po nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then impermanence and so on would also not be things.

original: lan du dngos po ma yin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lan du dngos po ma yin pa ma yin no //
translated: In response, he says, ‚ÄúIt is not that they are not things.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dngos po nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBecause they are the nature of things.‚Äù

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa la gnas pa'i rang bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa la gnas pa'i rang bzhin du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that way‚Äù means in the nature of abiding in conceptualization.

original: gal te dngos po'i rang bzhin mi snang ba'i phyir na dngos po de ltar ji ltar 'grub snyam na rnam par rtog pa la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te dngos po'i rang bzhin mi snang ba'i phyir na dngos po de ltar ji ltar 'grub snyam na rnam par rtog pa la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you think that a thing is not established in that way because the nature of a thing does not appear, [the response is:] ‚Äúin conceptualization.‚Äù

original: de la yang yod pa yin no zhes bya ba ga las she na /
analyzed: de la yang yod pa yin no zhes bya ba ga las she na /
translated: And if you ask, ‚ÄúHow is that?‚Äù

original: lan du dngos po ma yin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lan du dngos po ma yin pa ma yin no //
translated: The response is, ‚ÄúIt is not that it is not a thing.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid nyams su myong ba nyid las zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid nyams su myong ba nyid las zhes gsungs so //
translated: Why is it? It is because of the experience of its own characteristic.

original: 'di ni tha snyad byed pa'i skye bo la ltos nas bshad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni tha snyad byed pa'i skye bo la ltos nas bshad pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not explained in terms of the person who uses conventions.

original: gzhan la gzhan 'grub yin zhe na zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel pa ni gal te rnam par rtog pa zhes @129a * //
analyzed: gzhan la gzhan 'grub yin zhe na zhes bya ba rnam par 'grel pa ni gal te rnam par rtog pa zhes @129a * //
translated: The explanation of ‚Äúin terms of another‚Äù is as follows: If you think, ‚ÄúIn conceptualization,‚Äù

original: bya ba'o // lan ni sgrub par byed pa nyid ma yin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bya ba'o // lan ni sgrub par byed pa nyid ma yin pa ma yin no //
translated: the response is, ‚ÄúIt is not that it is not a proof.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na brgyud nas zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na brgyud nas zhes gsungs so //
translated: Why is it? It is because of the indirect [proof].

original: rang gi mtshan nyid mi snang yang brgyud nas 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid mi snang yang brgyud nas 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though the own characteristic does not appear, it is indirectly related.

original: 'di nyid brjod pa ni dngos su zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid brjod pa ni dngos su zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is being said: ‚ÄúDirectly.‚Äù

original: mi slu ba dang ldan pa nyid ni sgrub par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: mi slu ba dang ldan pa nyid ni sgrub par byed pa nyid do //
translated: The possession of non-deceptiveness is the proof.

original: rjes su dpag pa dngos po dang 'brel ba 'gog par dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa dngos po dang 'brel ba 'gog par dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The anticipation of the objection that the inference is related to the thing is ‚ÄúIf it is said.

original: lan ni de'i bag chags de'i dngos po dang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lan ni de'i bag chags de'i dngos po dang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The reply is ‚ÄúThe habit-energy of that, the thing.

original: rjes su dpag pa de'i bag chags rtags kyis shes pa ni khyab par byed pa'i dngos po dang 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa de'i bag chags rtags kyis shes pa ni khyab par byed pa'i dngos po dang 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The habit-energy of that inference is the knowledge of the reason, because it is related to the thing that is pervaded.

original: de'i bag chags dang 'brel pa yin yang dngos po dang 'brel par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de'i bag chags dang 'brel pa yin yang dngos po dang 'brel par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Even though it is related to the habit-energy, how can it be related to the thing?

original: zhes dris pa la brjod pa ni me dang shing la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes dris pa la brjod pa ni me dang shing la sogs pa'o //
translated: The reply is ‚ÄúFire and fuel, etc.‚Äù

original: dngos gang ji lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba ni me ma yin pa'i bdag nyid la ldog pa de ni rgyu yin no //
analyzed: dngos gang ji lta bur gyur pa zhes bya ba ni me ma yin pa'i bdag nyid la ldog pa de ni rgyu yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe thing that is what it is‚Äù is the exclusion of the nature of non-fire. That is the cause.

original: gang gi zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: de 'dra ba'i rtags sems kyi'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i rtags sems kyi'o //
translated: The mind that has such a reason.

original: de 'dra ba'ang yin te du ma ma yin pa dang sha pa ma yin pa las ldog pa'i rang bzhin yin gyi /
analyzed: de 'dra ba'ang yin te du ma ma yin pa dang sha pa ma yin pa las ldog pa'i rang bzhin yin gyi /
translated: It is also like that, because it is a nature that is the opposite of not being many and not being a tree.

original: yod pa dang lo ma la sogs pa las byung ba ni ma yin pas so //
analyzed: yod pa dang lo ma la sogs pa las byung ba ni ma yin pas so //
translated: But it does not arise from existence, leaves, and so on.

original: rtags kyang yin te 'bras bu'am khyab par bya ba yin pas so //
analyzed: rtags kyang yin te 'bras bu'am khyab par bya ba yin pas so //
translated: It is also a sign, because it is an effect or what is pervaded.

original: de dag gi sems kyi'o //
analyzed: de dag gi sems kyi'o //
translated: It is of their minds.

original: de las ci 'khrul snyam na /
analyzed: de las ci 'khrul snyam na /
translated: What is the error in that?

original: gang gi phyir de lta ma yin pa de'i phyir ji lta ba bzhin du gyur pa de lta bu'i dngos po la ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta ma yin pa de'i phyir ji lta ba bzhin du gyur pa de lta bu'i dngos po la ste /
translated: Because it is not like that, therefore, in that way, a sign that is a real thing,

original: yul rgyu mtshan la des bskyed de rtags kyis bskyed pa rtags can gyi blor 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: yul rgyu mtshan la des bskyed de rtags kyis bskyed pa rtags can gyi blor 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: that is generated from that, that is generated from the sign, becomes the mind that possesses the sign.

original: rtags kyi sgo nas de des bskyed pa'i phyir na 'brel bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: rtags kyi sgo nas de des bskyed pa'i phyir na 'brel bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Because it is generated by the sign, it is related to that.

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa'i blo ni ma yin te bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa'i blo ni ma yin te bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But it is not the mind of ƒ™≈õvara and so on, because that is the opposite.

original: gal te dngos po dang 'brel kyang de snang bas stong pa'i phyir na ji ltar rjes su dpag pa mi slu ba yin snyam na des na zhes smos so //
analyzed: gal te dngos po dang 'brel kyang de snang bas stong pa'i phyir na ji ltar rjes su dpag pa mi slu ba yin snyam na des na zhes smos so //
translated: If you think that even though it is related to the thing, it is not a non-deceptive inference because it is empty of appearance, then the verse says, ‚Äúbecause of that.‚Äù

original: des na 'brel pa yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: des na 'brel pa yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: ‚Äú Because of that‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause of the relation.‚Äù

original: rtags dang rtags can blo zhes bya ba ni 'chad par gyur pa'i tshul gyis rjes su dpag pa'i bdag nyid can dag go //
analyzed: rtags dang rtags can blo zhes bya ba ni 'chad par gyur pa'i tshul gyis rjes su dpag pa'i bdag nyid can dag go //
translated: ‚Äú The reason and the property to be proven‚Äù are the two parts of an inference.

original: gal te snang bas stong na ji ltar mi slu ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te snang bas stong na ji ltar mi slu ba yin zhe na /
translated: If it is empty of appearance, how can it be non-deceptive?

original: snang ba nyid las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snang ba nyid las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Because of the appearance itself.‚Äù

original: mngon sum nyid las so //
analyzed: mngon sum nyid las so //
translated: Because of direct perception.

original: lhag par zhen pa las kyang zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa las kyang ngo //
analyzed: lhag par zhen pa las kyang zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa las kyang ngo //
translated: ‚Äú Because of the adherence to the remainder‚Äù means because of inference.

original: ji ltar zhe na 'jug pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na 'jug pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How? ‚Äú Because of engagement.‚Äù

original: 'on te snang ba med na 'jug pa nyid du mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te snang ba med na 'jug pa nyid du mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If there is no appearance, there would be no engagement.

original: 'jug pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Engagement‚Äù means ‚Äúengagement in the object.‚Äù

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te rjes su dpag pas dang po mi 'jug na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te rjes su dpag pas dang po mi 'jug na /
translated: If that were not so, if inference did not engage at first,

original: phyis mngon @129b sum gyis 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyis mngon @129b sum gyis 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and later on, it would not be engaged by perception.üîΩHow then is it engaged by perception?

original: 'o na ji ltar mngon sum 'jug snyam na dang po zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar mngon sum 'jug snyam na dang po zhes gsungs so //
translated: The word ‚Äúfirst‚Äù is used.

original: lhag par zhes pas ni rjes su dpag pas so //
analyzed: lhag par zhes pas ni rjes su dpag pas so //
translated: The word ‚Äúespecially‚Äù refers to inference.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni lhag par zhen pa las so //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni lhag par zhen pa las so //
translated: The word ‚Äúfrom that‚Äù refers to the especially strong adherence.

original: gal te gang gis 'thob par 'gyur pa snang ba ma yin pa ji ltar yod pa nyid yin zhes dogs na /
analyzed: gal te gang gis 'thob par 'gyur pa snang ba ma yin pa ji ltar yod pa nyid yin zhes dogs na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúHow can that which is not perceived exist?‚Äù

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the answer is ‚ÄúJust as . . .‚Äù

original: gnyi ga la yang mi snang ba dang gzhan dag la'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga la yang mi snang ba dang gzhan dag la'o //
translated: It is not perceived in either of the two, and it is not perceived in other things.

original: snang ba thob pa ni gang na yang med pa'i phyir 'di ni khas blangs pa kho nas brjod pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni snang ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snang ba thob pa ni gang na yang med pa'i phyir 'di ni khas blangs pa kho nas brjod pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni snang ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is ‚ÄúThe perception of that . . .‚Äù because it does not exist anywhere.

original: gal te mi snang na ni yod kyang de ji ltar rtogs she na /
analyzed: gal te mi snang na ni yod kyang de ji ltar rtogs she na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúHow can it be known if it is not perceived?‚Äù

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the answer is ‚ÄúJust as . . .‚Äù

original: 'brel pa snang ba las kyang yod par shes so zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: 'brel pa snang ba las kyang yod par shes so zhes 'brel to //
translated: It is known to exist from the perception of the relation.

original: 'on te mi snang ba'i phyir thob pa'i yul med pa nyid de zhe na gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te mi snang ba'i phyir thob pa'i yul med pa nyid de zhe na gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But if you say that the object of attainment does not exist because it is not perceived, then what?

original: 'on te mi snang ba'i phyir thob pa'i yul med pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te mi snang ba'i phyir thob pa'i yul med pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the object of attainment does not exist because it is not perceived,

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: then what?

original: gang gi phyir thob par bya ba'i yul med na 'khrul pa dang / cig shos kyi rnam par dbye ba med pa de'i phyir thob par bya ba lkog tu gyur pa rtog na 'khrul pa gcig shos kyi rnam par dbye bar 'gyur ba yin no /
analyzed: gang gi phyir thob par bya ba'i yul med na 'khrul pa dang / cig shos kyi rnam par dbye ba med pa de'i phyir thob par bya ba lkog tu gyur pa rtog na 'khrul pa gcig shos kyi rnam par dbye bar 'gyur ba yin no /
translated: Because if the object of attainment does not exist, error and the distinction of the other would not exist. Therefore, when one imagines the hidden object of attainment, error and the distinction of the other would exist.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni lkog tu gyur pa ma rtogs par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni lkog tu gyur pa ma rtogs par ni ma yin te /
translated: But not otherwise. This means that it is not the case that one does not understand the hidden object of attainment.

original: rang gi ngo bos ni thams cad kyang ma 'khrul ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar nges pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos ni thams cad kyang ma 'khrul ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar nges pa yin no //
translated: Because all things are nonerroneous by their own nature. This is the certainty.

original: 'brel bar 'gyur ba'i 'brel ba'i yul nges par byed pa nyid rjes su dpag pa'i mi slu ba slu ba med pa'i rang bzhin gyi tshad ma yin no zhes brjod nas /
analyzed: 'brel bar 'gyur ba'i 'brel ba'i yul nges par byed pa nyid rjes su dpag pa'i mi slu ba slu ba med pa'i rang bzhin gyi tshad ma yin no zhes brjod nas /
translated: The means of valid knowledge is non-deceptive, i.e., it is non-erroneous by nature, in that it ascertains the object which is related to the object to be inferred.

original: 'chad pa po'i log par rtog pa bsal ba'i don du tshigs su bcad pa yang 'don pa ni de ltar rtags dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'chad pa po'i log par rtog pa bsal ba'i don du tshigs su bcad pa yang 'don pa ni de ltar rtags dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to remove the false conception of the expounder, he also quotes the verse: ‚ÄúThus, the sign, etc.‚Äù

original: rtags can gyi shes pa bzhin du de nges par byed pa'i rtags kyi shes pa yang rtags de dang 'brel pa'i phyir de la mi 'khrul ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtags can gyi shes pa bzhin du de nges par byed pa'i rtags kyi shes pa yang rtags de dang 'brel pa'i phyir de la mi 'khrul ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the knowledge of the sign, like the knowledge of the one who has the sign, is non-erroneous with regard to that object, because it is related to that sign.

original: gal te don dang 'brel pa dang lhag par zhen pa dang thob par byed pa la sogs pa yin yang ji ltar 'khrul pa yin te 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes dogs na /
analyzed: gal te don dang 'brel pa dang lhag par zhen pa dang thob par byed pa la sogs pa yin yang ji ltar 'khrul pa yin te 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes dogs na /
translated: If one asks, ‚ÄúHow can it be erroneous if it is related to the object, is the ascertainment of the object, and is the means of attaining the object, etc.? Because of the contradiction,‚Äù

original: sgrub par byed pa nyid lhag par zhen par byed par rtags dang rtags can gyi shes pa de ni rtags can de'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa nyid lhag par zhen par byed par rtags dang rtags can gyi shes pa de ni rtags can de'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The cognition of the sign and the signified, which is the establishment of the signified, is the nature of the signified.

original: 'khrul pa rnam gzhan byas pa yin //
analyzed: 'khrul pa rnam gzhan byas pa yin //
translated: Therefore, it is a different kind of error.

original: de'i ngo bo zhes bya ba ni de mngon du byed pas stong pa dag ste /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo zhes bya ba ni de mngon du byed pas stong pa dag ste /
translated: The nature of that is empty of that, because it is the manifestation of that.

original: 'di ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: 'di ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: This is the reason.

original: rang gi ngo bo dngos su byed pa nyid ni ma 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo dngos su byed pa nyid ni ma 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: The direct establishment of its own nature is non-error.

original: bshad pa mdzad pa ni rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pa ni rtags kyi shes pa yin te /üîΩrtags can @130a * //
analyzed: bshad pa mdzad pa ni rang bzhin gyi rjes su dpag pa ni rtags kyi shes pa yin te / rtags can @130a * //
translated: The explanation is that natural inference is the cognition of the sign,üîΩbecause the signified

original: yang rtags nyid tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang rtags nyid tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is not different from the sign itself.

original: 'bras bu'i rjes su dpag pa ni rtags can gyi shes pa yin no zhes 'chad do //üîΩ'di la kha cig na re zhes bya ba ni slob dpon chos mchog la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rjes su dpag pa ni rtags can gyi shes pa yin no zhes 'chad do // 'di la kha cig na re zhes bya ba ni slob dpon chos mchog la sogs pa yin te /
translated: Inferential cognition of the effect is the cognition of the signified.üîΩHere, some say...

original: du ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas gtso bo nyid du yin no zhes bya ba'i bar ro //
analyzed: du ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas gtso bo nyid du yin no zhes bya ba'i bar ro //
translated: This refers to Master Dharmottara and others, from smoke, etc. up to is the principal.

original: rtags can gyi shes pa bzhin rtags kyi shes pa yang rtags can gyi yul can yin te /
analyzed: rtags can gyi shes pa bzhin rtags kyi shes pa yang rtags can gyi yul can yin te /
translated: Just as a cognition with an image is a subject with an image, so too a cognition with a sign is a subject with a sign.

original: rtags med na mi 'byung bar nges pa'i rang bzhin nyid rtags kyi byed pa yin pas na rtags can yang 'dus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rtags med na mi 'byung bar nges pa'i rang bzhin nyid rtags kyi byed pa yin pas na rtags can yang 'dus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The nature of a cognition that definitely does not occur without a sign is the activity of a sign. Therefore, a cognition with a sign is also a composite.

original: slob dpon chos mchog la sogs pa'i lus rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: slob dpon chos mchog la sogs pa'i lus rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: This is the presentation of the body of the master Dharmottara and others.

original: 'di gsal ba'i rtsod pa brjod pa ni /
analyzed: 'di gsal ba'i rtsod pa brjod pa ni /
translated: The following is a discussion that clarifies this.

original: des na ji skad du zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: des na ji skad du zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, as it is said,

original: bde byed kyis so de bsal ba yin te zhes bya ba rgyang ring por 'brel to //
analyzed: bde byed kyis so de bsal ba yin te zhes bya ba rgyang ring por 'brel to //
translated: it is refuted by BhƒÅviveka.

original: ji skad smras she na /
analyzed: ji skad smras she na /
translated: What is said?

original: 'dir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here.

original: rtags smos pa ni skabs su bab pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rtags smos pa ni skabs su bab pa ma yin te /
translated: The mention of a sign is not relevant,

original: rtags can gyi blo nyid kyi skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtags can gyi blo nyid kyi skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because this is the context of a cognition with an image.

original: des na rtags kyi blo dpyad pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: des na rtags kyi blo dpyad pas ci zhig bya /
translated: Therefore, what is the point of analyzing a cognition with a sign?

original: ci ste de yang zhes bya ba ni rtags kyi blo'o //
analyzed: ci ste de yang zhes bya ba ni rtags kyi blo'o //
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúThat also,‚Äù ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to a cognition with a sign.

original: de lta na ni zhes bya ba ni rtags kyi blo rjes su dpag pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa na'o //
analyzed: de lta na ni zhes bya ba ni rtags kyi blo rjes su dpag pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù means if the inferential cognition is of the nature of the evidence.

original: rtags dang rtags can blo zhes tha dad par smos pa don med do //
analyzed: rtags dang rtags can blo zhes tha dad par smos pa don med do //
translated: It would be meaningless to say that the evidence and the evidence-possessor are different cognitions.

original: sngon gyi blo nyid bdag nyid yin na yang der snang bas stong pa zhes mi 'thad do zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: sngon gyi blo nyid bdag nyid yin na yang der snang bas stong pa zhes mi 'thad do zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: Even if the prior cognition itself is the evidence, it is not tenable to say that it is empty of appearing as that.

original: gal te rtags rtogs pa zhes bya ba'o //üîΩbsgrub par bya ba'i rnam par stong pas 'khrul pa yin na yang ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: gal te rtags rtogs pa zhes bya ba'o // bsgrub par bya ba'i rnam par stong pas 'khrul pa yin na yang ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: This is stated in ‚ÄúIf the evidence is cognized. . . .‚Äù

original: rtags can snang bas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rtags can snang bas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Even if it is mistaken because of being empty of the aspect of the probandum, it would follow that it is not the evidence. This is stated in ‚ÄúThe evidence-possessor appears. . . .‚Äù

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba ste yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba ste yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the probandum, because it is not the object.

original: 'di ga las she na bum pa'i zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'di ga las she na bum pa'i zhes smos so //
translated: Why is that? It is stated in ‚ÄúThe vase. . . .‚Äù

original: ji ltar 'dis bsgrub snyam na rtags dang zhes so //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dis bsgrub snyam na rtags dang zhes so //
translated: How is it established by that? It is stated in ‚ÄúThe evidence. . . .‚Äù

original: yul cig pa ni rtag can du'o //
analyzed: yul cig pa ni rtag can du'o //
translated: The object is the same as the evidence-possessor.

original: rtag can gyis khyad par du byas pa'i rtags ni mngon sum nyid kyang ma yin no zhes smos pa ni /
analyzed: rtag can gyis khyad par du byas pa'i rtags ni mngon sum nyid kyang ma yin no zhes smos pa ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúa reason that is qualified by permanence is not even perception‚Äù means

original: mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúbecause it is not perception.‚Äù

original: de ltar gzhan dag 'dod la /
analyzed: de ltar gzhan dag 'dod la /
translated: Others assert this.

original: gal te rtags ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rjes su brjod nas sel bar byed pa ni phyogs kyi chos nyid 'dzin pa'i dus na thun mong gi rang bzhin can mtshungs pa ni chos dag gi 'brel pa ni rjes su dpag pa las yin te /
analyzed: gal te rtags ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rjes su brjod nas sel bar byed pa ni phyogs kyi chos nyid 'dzin pa'i dus na thun mong gi rang bzhin can mtshungs pa ni chos dag gi 'brel pa ni rjes su dpag pa las yin te /
translated: Having stated ‚ÄúIf the reason . . . ,‚Äù he refutes it. When the property of the position is apprehended, the common nature is the same. The relation of the properties is inferred,

original: de'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir na mngon sum gyis ni ma yin na /
analyzed: de'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir na mngon sum gyis ni ma yin na /
translated: because it is not the object of that, it is not by direct perception.

original: de'i tshe thug pa med par 'gyur ro zhes @130b brjod pa ni /üîΩde lta yin na thug med 'gyur //
analyzed: de'i tshe thug pa med par 'gyur ro zhes @130b brjod pa ni / de lta yin na thug med 'gyur //
translated: At that time, there would be an infinite regress. This is stated in the line:

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf that were so, there would be an infinite regress.‚Äù

original: ji lta zhe na /üîΩde la'ang zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na / de la'ang zhes gsungs te /
translated: How is that?üîΩHe says, ‚ÄúIn that case . . . ,‚Äù

original: rjes su dpag pa la'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la'o //
translated: in that inference.

original: 'on te rtags ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ci ste goms pa las de med na mi 'byung ba'i rtags ni de med na mi 'byung ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'on te rtags ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ci ste goms pa las de med na mi 'byung ba'i rtags ni de med na mi 'byung ba nyid do //
translated: But if the reason is the appearance of the reason, then how can there be the apprehension of the invariable concomitance?

original: rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: In response to this question, he says,

original: mngon sum de ni rtags snang ba kho na yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum de ni rtags snang ba kho na yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúThat perception is the appearance of the reason.‚Äù

original: de mi snang ba de med na mi 'byung ba nyid du 'dzin pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: de mi snang ba de med na mi 'byung ba nyid du 'dzin pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
translated: Because it is not tenable to apprehend the invariable concomitance when the reason does not appear.

original: de lta yin zhes bya ba de mngon sum gyi yul nyid yin nam /
analyzed: de lta yin zhes bya ba de mngon sum gyi yul nyid yin nam /
translated: ‚ÄúIf that is so‚Äù means if the object of perception is the appearance of the reason.

original: ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mngon sum de'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mngon sum de'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHow can there be‚Äù means how can there be the apprehension of the invariable concomitance?üîΩ‚ÄúWhat should be done?‚Äù means what should be done in that case.

original: ci ste bya zhes bya ba la gzung yang zhes bya ba la dpe la'o //
analyzed: ci ste bya zhes bya ba la gzung yang zhes bya ba la dpe la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEven if it is grasped‚Äù means even if the example is grasped.

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi chos nyid 'dzin pa'i dus na'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi chos nyid 'dzin pa'i dus na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAt that time‚Äù means at the time of grasping the property of the subject.

original: de lta na zhes bya ba ni med na la'o //
analyzed: de lta na zhes bya ba ni med na la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù means in the absence of the reason.

original: de ni dran pa'o //
analyzed: de ni dran pa'o //
translated: That is memory.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni med na mi 'byung ba nyid la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni med na mi 'byung ba nyid la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù means in the case of invariable concomitance.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na tshad ma nyid kyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na tshad ma nyid kyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Why? Because of the validity of the inference.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
translated: But if, etc. is a doubt.

original: 'o na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: 'o na zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: Well, etc. is the answer.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni zhes bya ba ni de'i rang bzhin gyis rtags las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni zhes bya ba ni de'i rang bzhin gyis rtags las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The inference, etc. is because it arises from a reason that has that as its nature.

original: de zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: That, etc. is the inference.

original: sngar zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi chos nyid 'dzin pa las so //
analyzed: sngar zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi chos nyid 'dzin pa las so //
translated: Previously, etc. is from the apprehension of the property of the subject.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni med na mi 'byung ba nyid la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni med na mi 'byung ba nyid la'o //
translated: There, etc. is with regard to the absence of the reason.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar gzhan gyi bshad pa mi 'grig pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar gzhan gyi bshad pa mi 'grig pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that other explanation is not correct, therefore.

original: gal te rtags kyi blo'i sgras rtags can gyi blo ci ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: gal te rtags kyi blo'i sgras rtags can gyi blo ci ltar brjod ce na /
translated: If the word of the cognition of the reason is used for the cognition of the property of the subject, how is it that the word of the cognition of the reason is used for the cognition of the property of the subject?

original: don dam par zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: don dam par zhes gsungs so //
translated: In reality, etc. is said.

original: rgyu'i yul can gyi rtags can gyi blo yang rtags kyi blo'i sgras rtags can gyi blo ci ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: rgyu'i yul can gyi rtags can gyi blo yang rtags kyi blo'i sgras rtags can gyi blo ci ltar brjod ce na /
translated: If the cognition of the property of the subject, which has a cause as its object, is also called the cognition of the property of the subject by the word of the cognition of the reason,

original: der ni tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste rgyu dang 'bras bu dag la'o //
analyzed: der ni tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste rgyu dang 'bras bu dag la'o //
translated: there, etc. is because of the difference between cause and effect.

original: de zhes bya ba ni rtags kyi blo'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni rtags kyi blo'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the cognition of the reason.

original: ci ste yang du ba'i rang bzhin me mi 'byung ba nyid du khas mi len na rtags ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ste yang du ba'i rang bzhin me mi 'byung ba nyid du khas mi len na rtags ma yin te /
translated: But if one does not accept that smoke is the nature of fire, then it is not a reason.

original: des na de la rjes su dpag pa ji ltar 'byung snyam na shin tu zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na de la rjes su dpag pa ji ltar 'byung snyam na shin tu zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, how can there be an inference in that case?

original: sbrang bu'i tshogs la sogs pa dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i rang bzhin shin tu goms pa las ni me ma rtogs kyang shin tu gsal bar nyams su myong bas nye bar mtshon pa'i du bas rjes su dpag pa skyed par byed pa ni rtags kho na'o zhesüîΩbya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sbrang bu'i tshogs la sogs pa dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i rang bzhin shin tu goms pa las ni me ma rtogs kyang shin tu gsal bar nyams su myong bas nye bar mtshon pa'i du bas rjes su dpag pa skyed par byed pa ni rtags kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is a reason because it produces an inference of fire from smoke that is very clearly experienced, even though fire is not understood from the nature of smoke that is very familiar, like a swarm of bees, etc., which has a different characteristic.

original: goms pa med na ni de'i rang bzhin gyi rtags las mi 'brel bar 'dzin pa kho na rtags blo yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: goms pa med na ni de'i rang bzhin gyi rtags las mi 'brel bar 'dzin pa kho na rtags blo yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: If there is no familiarity, then the cognition of the reason is only the apprehension of the absence of the relation between the nature of that and the reason.

original: du'i zhes gsungs so //üîΩde nyid ni du ba nyid du ni'o //
analyzed: du'i zhes gsungs so // de nyid ni du ba nyid du ni'o //
translated: This is stated by ‚Äúif there is no familiarity.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to smoke.üîΩ‚ÄúOf that‚Äù refers to fire.

original: mes bskyed pa rnam pa de lta bu nyid la du'o @131a * //
analyzed: mes bskyed pa rnam pa de lta bu nyid la du'o @131a * //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that way‚Äù refers to the nature of being produced by fire.

original: zhes bsnyad pa'i phyir du ba nyid de dang 'brel pa yin la /
analyzed: zhes bsnyad pa'i phyir du ba nyid de dang 'brel pa yin la /
translated: Because of the statement, ‚Äúsmoke is related to that,‚Äù

original: de bzung ba nyid kyang de dang 'brel par bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzung ba nyid kyang de dang 'brel par bzung ba yin no //
translated: and because of the statement, ‚Äúthe apprehension of that is the apprehension of that with which it is related,‚Äù

original: de nyid ga las rtogs snyam na /
analyzed: de nyid ga las rtogs snyam na /
translated: from where is that known?

original: du ba nyid kyang ngo shes pa las so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: du ba nyid kyang ngo shes pa las so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSmoke is known from recognition.‚Äù

original: de nyid rtags kyi shes pa yin no zhes ngo shes pa la yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid rtags kyi shes pa yin no zhes ngo shes pa la yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: That is the knowledge of the reason.

original: gal te rjes su dpag pa 'di la yang de rang bzhin gyi rtags phyogs kyi chos su grub pa'i don du rjes su dpag pa gzhan dang gzhan gyi rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir thug pa med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pa 'di la yang de rang bzhin gyi rtags phyogs kyi chos su grub pa'i don du rjes su dpag pa gzhan dang gzhan gyi rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir thug pa med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúIf in this inference, another and another inference is required in order to establish the reason consisting of the nature of the subject, there will be an infinite regress.‚Äù

original: shin tu goms pa las so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shin tu goms pa las so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom complete familiarity.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir med na mi 'byung ba nyid du nges pa'o ni rtags 'dzin pa nyid du mi 'thad pa de'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir med na mi 'byung ba nyid du nges pa'o ni rtags 'dzin pa nyid du mi 'thad pa de'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: Because it is not tenable that the apprehension of the reason is ascertained as the invariable concomitance, therefore, it is said, ‚Äúits own characteristic.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyis 'brel pa nges pa nyid rtogs 'dzin brjod pa gang yin pa de ni rtags can 'dzin pa kho na yin te rtog pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa ni de'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis 'brel pa nges pa nyid rtogs 'dzin brjod pa gang yin pa de ni rtags can 'dzin pa kho na yin te rtog pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa ni de'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThat which is the ascertainment of the relation by another is the apprehension of the evidence alone, because there is no other conception‚Äù is the reason.

original: 'brel pa nyid 'dzin pa nyid yin pa de ni zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: 'brel pa nyid 'dzin pa nyid yin pa de ni zhes 'brel to //
translated: The relation of the very relation is that.

original: de ni spyi'i 'dzin pa rjes su dpag pa yin zhes 'brel to gzhan du zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa rtags kyi shes pa yin par ro //
analyzed: de ni spyi'i 'dzin pa rjes su dpag pa yin zhes 'brel to gzhan du zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa rtags kyi shes pa yin par ro //
translated: The relation is ‚ÄúThat is the apprehension of the universal, the inference.‚Äù ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means that the cognition of the evidence is not of the nature of inference.

original: rjes su dpag pa dngos po dang 'brel pa de nyid nye bar sdud pa ni de'i phyir dngos po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa dngos po dang 'brel pa de nyid nye bar sdud pa ni de'i phyir dngos po zhes bya ste /
translated: The very relation to the thing is the inference, and the thing is the reason.

original: dngos por rtogs par bya ba'i dngos po rtogs par bya ba la'o //
analyzed: dngos por rtogs par bya ba'i dngos po rtogs par bya ba la'o //
translated: The thing is the object of the cognition of the thing.

original: khyab byed ni rgyu mtshan yin no su'i zhe na khyab par byed pa yang sems kyi'o //
analyzed: khyab byed ni rgyu mtshan yin no su'i zhe na khyab par byed pa yang sems kyi'o //
translated: The pervader is the reason. Whose? Of the pervaded, and also of the mind.

original: khyab par byed pa yang de'i ngo bo'am rgyu yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa yang de'i ngo bo'am rgyu yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: The pervader is also the nature or cause of that.

original: khyab par bya ba'i sems de yang khyab par byed pa de'i blo'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: khyab par bya ba'i sems de yang khyab par byed pa de'i blo'i rgyu yin no //
translated: And that pervaded state of mind is the cause of the cognition of the pervader.

original: gal te gang gis dngos po rtogs par bya ba la'o //
analyzed: gal te gang gis dngos po rtogs par bya ba la'o //
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúBy what is the thing to be understood?‚Äù

original: byed pa bsgrub par bya ba gzhan dag kyang srid dam snyam na bsgrub par bya ba zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: byed pa bsgrub par bya ba gzhan dag kyang srid dam snyam na bsgrub par bya ba zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúThe object to be established.‚Äù

original: de ltar bsgrub par bya ba yin snyam na /
analyzed: de ltar bsgrub par bya ba yin snyam na /
translated: If it is thought that way, ‚ÄúHow is it to be established?‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúBecause.‚Äù

original: ji ltar de'i rgyu yin zhe na de yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar de'i rgyu yin zhe na de yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How is it the cause of that? It is said, ‚ÄúThat also.‚Äù

original: de lta na ji ltar rjes su dpag pa tshad ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na ji ltar rjes su dpag pa tshad ma yin zhe na /
translated: In that case, how is inference valid cognition?

original: de yang zhes bya ba ste khyab par bya ba'i sems kyang ngo //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ste khyab par bya ba'i sems kyang ngo //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúThat also,‚Äù meaning the pervaded state of mind.

original: de bsgrub pa'i yul can gyi rjes su dpag pa tshad ma nyid du bsgrubs nas dgag pa'i yul can yang bsgrub pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: de bsgrub pa'i yul can gyi rjes su dpag pa tshad ma nyid du bsgrubs nas dgag pa'i yul can yang bsgrub pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa zhes smos so //
translated: Having established that the subject, inference, is valid cognition, non-observation is mentioned in order to establish the object of negation.

original: gang gis de'i yul can gyi shes pa tshad mar 'gyur ba ji ltar 'brel pa yod ces dris pa la ston pa ni zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gis de'i yul can gyi shes pa tshad mar 'gyur ba ji ltar 'brel pa yod ces dris pa la ston pa ni zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: How can there be a connection between the object and the cognition that has it as its object?

original: thams cad du zhes bya ba ni 'ga' zhig tu dgag pa zhes bya ba'o cog der ni mi dmigs pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: thams cad du zhes bya ba ni 'ga' zhig tu dgag pa zhes bya ba'o cog der ni mi dmigs pa kho na yin no //
translated: In all cases, i.e., in every case, there is a negation.

original: 'di ga las @131b she na dmigs pa'i bdag nyid kyis tshad grub pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ga las @131b she na dmigs pa'i bdag nyid kyis tshad grub pa ste /
translated: Why is this? Because the establishment of a valid cognition is by means of an object.

original: nges par smra ba rnams kyi don gyis zhes bya ba med pa rtogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan med pa'i shugs kyis so //
analyzed: nges par smra ba rnams kyi don gyis zhes bya ba med pa rtogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan med pa'i shugs kyis so //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù in the statement ‚Äúthe non-perception of an object is only a negation‚Äù is for the purpose of excluding the other forms of the cognition of non-existence.

original: bzlog pa nyid las zhes bya ba nyid 'dzin par byed pa'i tshad ma bzlog pa las so //
analyzed: bzlog pa nyid las zhes bya ba nyid 'dzin par byed pa'i tshad ma bzlog pa las so //
translated: The word ‚Äúitself‚Äù in the statement ‚Äúthe establishment of a valid cognition is by means of an object‚Äù is for the purpose of excluding the opposite of a valid cognition.

original: mi dmigs pa nyid las 'gag pa 'grub pa zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na /üîΩgang du dngos po'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa nyid las 'gag pa 'grub pa zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na / gang du dngos po'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Why is the establishment of a negation only by means of non-perception?

original: dngos po de dgag pa ni'o //
analyzed: dngos po de dgag pa ni'o //
translated: Because the establishment of a negation is only by means of the non-perception of an object.üîΩThe word ‚Äúonly‚Äù in the statement ‚Äúthe establishment of a negation is only by means of the non-perception of an object‚Äù is for the purpose of excluding the perception of an object.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa ni dngos po med pa'i sgrub byed nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa ni dngos po med pa'i sgrub byed nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means that the non-apprehension of an object is not a valid means of knowledge.

original: bzlog pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: bzlog pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa nyid kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy the opposite‚Äù means by non-apprehension.

original: gal te gang gis de skad brjod pa mi dmigs pas dgag par 'grub la gzhan gyis chen cher 'dzin pa'am zhen ched cher 'dzin to zhes bstan pa'i don du rnam pa gcig dper brjod pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te gang gis de skad brjod pa mi dmigs pas dgag par 'grub la gzhan gyis chen cher 'dzin pa'am zhen ched cher 'dzin to zhes bstan pa'i don du rnam pa gcig dper brjod pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If someone says that negation is established by non-apprehension, and that the other party‚Äôs apprehension or adherence is taught for the sake of illustration, the following is an example:

original: dmigs par rigs pa ni ltar rung ba'o //
analyzed: dmigs par rigs pa ni ltar rung ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe object of apprehension‚Äù is the object of perception.

original: gal te gzhan gyi ltar na rnam pa ci zhig ltar med par rtogs par 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi ltar na rnam pa ci zhig ltar med par rtogs par 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: If the other party understands in some way that it does not exist,

original: khyed la ji ltar tshad ma dang ldan pa'i rtogs pa dang ldan pa'i mngon sum pa'am 'brel pa can ma yin pa med do zhes dogs pa bsu nas bstan pa'i 'brel pa gsal bar byed pa ni de tsam dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyed la ji ltar tshad ma dang ldan pa'i rtogs pa dang ldan pa'i mngon sum pa'am 'brel pa can ma yin pa med do zhes dogs pa bsu nas bstan pa'i 'brel pa gsal bar byed pa ni de tsam dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: how can you have a valid cognition that is not related to the object? Anticipating this doubt, the connection is clarified: ‚ÄúThat much‚Äù means that much of the object of apprehension is not apprehended.

original: mi dmigs pa las gzhan pa'i dgag pa la ni 'brel pa med par yang 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa las gzhan pa'i dgag pa la ni 'brel pa med par yang 'gyur gyi /
translated: But in the case of a negation that is not non-apprehension, there is no relation.

original: nged kyi la ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: nged kyi la ni ma yin gyi /
translated: But in our case, it is not so.

original: gzhan ma yin pas na de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pas na de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since it is not other, it is of the same nature.

original: gal te dgag pa nyid ni thams cad du mi dmigs pa las grub pa yin zhes bya ba ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: gal te dgag pa nyid ni thams cad du mi dmigs pa las grub pa yin zhes bya ba ni mi 'thad de /
translated: If you say that negation is established in all cases from non-apprehension, that is not tenable.

original: 'gal ba dmigs pa la sogs pa yang med pa'i sgrub byed yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba dmigs pa la sogs pa yang med pa'i sgrub byed yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the apprehension of an incompatible object, etc., is also a proof of non-existence.

original: mi dmigs pa ni 'dir de'i bdag nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni 'dir de'i bdag nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: Non-apprehension is not here of the same nature as that.

original: rung ba ma yin pa'i yul can nyid kyis dgag pa las tha dad pa'i phyir zhes dogs pa ni 'gal ba yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa'i yul can nyid kyis dgag pa las tha dad pa'i phyir zhes dogs pa ni 'gal ba yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because it is different from negation, being a non-suitable object. The doubt is expressed by ‚Äúincompatible, etc.‚Äù

original: dngos sam zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba mi dmigs pa la'o //
analyzed: dngos sam zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba mi dmigs pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDirectly‚Äù refers to the non-apprehension of an incompatible object.

original: brgyud pas zhes bya ba ni rgyu 'gal ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: brgyud pas zhes bya ba ni rgyu 'gal ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIndirectly‚Äù refers to the cause of an incompatible object, etc.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni rgyu 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni rgyu 'gal ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHere‚Äù refers to the cause of an incompatible object.

original: 'gal ba 'dzin pa'i dus nas rtogs pa'i snang ba mi dmigs pa de'i rang bzhin mthong ba las dpag pa nyid dngos po med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu yin no zhes lan 'debs pa ni 'gal ba brjod pa mthong ba gang yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba 'dzin pa'i dus nas rtogs pa'i snang ba mi dmigs pa de'i rang bzhin mthong ba las dpag pa nyid dngos po med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu yin no zhes lan 'debs pa ni 'gal ba brjod pa mthong ba gang yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reply is that the cause of the expression ‚Äúnon-existence of an entity‚Äù is the very inference from the seeing of the nature of the non-apprehension of the appearance of the conceptual differentiation that occurs when there is the apprehension of an inconsistency.

original: gang gi zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi zhe na /
translated: What is the inconsistency?

original: dgag par bya ba grang ba de'am de'i rgyu'i ste ba spu langs pa la sogs pa gang la rgyu grang ba de dgag pa la'o //
analyzed: dgag par bya ba grang ba de'am de'i rgyu'i ste ba spu langs pa la sogs pa gang la rgyu grang ba de dgag pa la'o //
translated: It is the apprehension of the cold, or the cause of that, such as horripilation, etc., in regard to which there is the negation of the cause, i.e., the cold.

original: mthong ba la gang yin pa de la yang grang ba la @132a * //
analyzed: mthong ba la gang yin pa de la yang grang ba la @132a * //
translated: And in regard to the seeing of that, the cold, etc.,

original: sogs pa de nyid tshad ma nyid med pa ste /
analyzed: sogs pa de nyid tshad ma nyid med pa ste /
translated: there is the absence of a valid cognition.

original: mi dmigs pa ston par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ston par byed pa yin te /
translated: The non-apprehension is indicated by the absence of a valid cognition.

original: dpog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dpog par byed pa yin no //
translated: It is inferred.

original: 'gal ba dang dmigs pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas mi dmigs pa nyid rjes su dpog pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'gal ba dang dmigs pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas mi dmigs pa nyid rjes su dpog pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the non-apprehension is inferred by way of the inconsistency, the apprehension, etc.

original: 'bar ba'i gzugs mngon sum du mthong bas ni tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa nyid kyis grang ba mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin dro ba'i reg pa go bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'bar ba'i gzugs mngon sum du mthong bas ni tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa nyid kyis grang ba mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin dro ba'i reg pa go bar byed pa yin te /
translated: Since the form of fire is directly perceived, the tactile sensation of heat, which is the nature of the non-apprehension of cold, is understood by the fact that it depends on the same assemblage.

original: des ni rjes su dpag pas mi dmigs pa grub pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni rjes su dpag pas mi dmigs pa grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, non-apprehension by inference is established.

original: des mi dmigs pa dang 'gal ba la 'brel ci yod ces brjod pa de gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: des mi dmigs pa dang 'gal ba la 'brel ci yod ces brjod pa de gsal ba yin no //
translated: This clarifies the question, ‚ÄúWhat is the relation between non-apprehension and its opposite?‚Äù

original: de la tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa'i me'i gzugs kyis ni dro ba'i bdag nyid kyi reg pa dpog pa yin no zhes kyang 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa'i me'i gzugs kyis ni dro ba'i bdag nyid kyi reg pa dpog pa yin no zhes kyang 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is also explained that the form of fire, which depends on the same assemblage, infers the tactile sensation of the nature of heat.

original: 'gal ba ni zhes bya ba ni grangs pa'i reg pa'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba ni zhes bya ba ni grangs pa'i reg pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIts opposite‚Äù is the tactile sensation of cold.

original: dogs pa ni med pa'i tshul du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dogs pa ni med pa'i tshul du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the manner of non-existence‚Äù is the doubt.

original: de lta na ni zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: de lta na ni zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù is the answer.

original: de lta ma yin na de mthong ba las de med par ji ltar rtogs de dang ni zhes bya ba ni grang ba med pa dang ste me dang grang ba med pa dag ni lhan cig yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de mthong ba las de med par ji ltar rtogs de dang ni zhes bya ba ni grang ba med pa dang ste me dang grang ba med pa dag ni lhan cig yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúAnd that‚Äù refers to the absence of cold, because fire and the absence of cold are simultaneous.

original: gang la med de yod pa der grang ba med par 'gyur ba la ni de ga las zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde lta bu nyid du zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: gang la med de yod pa der grang ba med par 'gyur ba la ni de ga las zhes bya ba'o // de lta bu nyid du zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: Where there is the absence of that, there is the absence of cold.üîΩIn that case, how could one know that it does not exist from seeing it?üîΩIn order to anticipate this doubt, he says, ‚ÄúHow could one know that it does not exist from seeing it?‚Äù

original: ci zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis byas nas gal te zhes bya bas dang po sel ba'o //
analyzed: ci zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis byas nas gal te zhes bya bas dang po sel ba'o //
translated: Having made two alternatives, he refutes the first with ‚ÄúIf it were so.‚Äù

original: de ste zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de ste zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second is with ‚ÄúIf it were not so.‚Äù

original: mi dmigs pa kho na las zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba mthong bas dpag pa las so //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa kho na las zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba mthong bas dpag pa las so //
translated: ‚ÄúOnly from non-apprehension‚Äù means from inference by seeing contradiction.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni 'gal bar bsgrub pas mi dmigs pa rjes su dpag pa ma yin na'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni 'gal bar bsgrub pas mi dmigs pa rjes su dpag pa ma yin na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means that if non-apprehension by establishing contradiction is not inference,

original: me la sogs pa'i dngos po gcig yod par brjod pas gzhan grang ba'i reg pa la sogs pa med par ro //
analyzed: me la sogs pa'i dngos po gcig yod par brjod pas gzhan grang ba'i reg pa la sogs pa med par ro //
translated: then by stating the existence of one thing like fire, the absence of another like cold touch would not be known.

original: gang las zhes bya ba ni tshad mas so //
analyzed: gang las zhes bya ba ni tshad mas so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom which‚Äù means from a valid cognition.

original: de nyid kyang ni 'gal ba nyid kyang ngo //
analyzed: de nyid kyang ni 'gal ba nyid kyang ngo //
translated: That itself is contradictory.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni lhan cig mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni lhan cig mi gnas pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù means non-co-existence.

original: tshad ma med pa nyid ni mi dmigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: tshad ma med pa nyid ni mi dmigs pa nyid do //
translated: The absence of a valid cognition is non-apprehension.

original: 'on te gcig yod pa nyid las gzhan 'gog pa'i phyir mi dmigs pas ci bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gcig yod pa nyid las gzhan 'gog pa'i phyir mi dmigs pas ci bya zhe na /
translated: But if the negation of something else is from the existence of one thing, then what is the use of non-apprehension?

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù is what is said.

original: 'on te gzhan dgag pa ni 'gal ba las yin pa des na ha cang thal ba ma yin no zhe na lhan cig ces gsungs so //
analyzed: 'on te gzhan dgag pa ni 'gal ba las yin pa des na ha cang thal ba ma yin no zhe na lhan cig ces gsungs so //
translated: But if the negation of something else is from a contradiction, then it is not an absurd consequence.

original: gal te de lta zhes bya ba la sogs pas mu stegs pa'i lugs dogs pa bsu ba'o //
analyzed: gal te de lta zhes bya ba la sogs pas mu stegs pa'i lugs dogs pa bsu ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it is like that‚Äù and so on introduces the objection from the tƒ´rthika system.

original: 'di 'gog pa slob dpon chos mchog gi lugs kyis dogs pa bsu ba ni ci ste 'gal ba bsgrub pa'i zhes @132b bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di 'gog pa slob dpon chos mchog gi lugs kyis dogs pa bsu ba ni ci ste 'gal ba bsgrub pa'i zhes @132b bya ba'o //
translated: The objection from the system of the master Dharmottara to the refutation of that is ‚ÄúIf it is established as contradictory‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: sngon zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba 'dzin pa'i dus su'o //
analyzed: sngon zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba 'dzin pa'i dus su'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBefore‚Äù is at the time of apprehending the contradiction.

original: de'i rjes su 'brang ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni sngon zhugs pa'i mi dmigs pa'i rjes su 'brang ba las so //
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'brang ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni sngon zhugs pa'i mi dmigs pa'i rjes su 'brang ba las so //
translated: By following that means by following the non-apprehension that has already been engaged.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni sngon zhugs pa'i mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni sngon zhugs pa'i mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: That itself means the non-apprehension that has already been engaged.

original: 'brel ba 'dzin pa nyid las rjes su dpag par bya ba 'grub pas na rjes su dpag par tshad ma dus su'o //
analyzed: 'brel ba 'dzin pa nyid las rjes su dpag par bya ba 'grub pas na rjes su dpag par tshad ma dus su'o //
translated: Since the object of inference is established by the mere connection, inference is a valid means of knowledge at the time of connection.

original: de'i rjes su 'brang ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba gal te de lta na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'brang ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba gal te de lta na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is like that, by following that, if it is like that, then the object of inference would not be established.

original: khong par mthong ba ni snang ba mi dmigs pa ste 'gal ba 'dzin pa'i dus na zhugs pa des /
analyzed: khong par mthong ba ni snang ba mi dmigs pa ste 'gal ba 'dzin pa'i dus na zhugs pa des /
translated: Seeing inside is the non-apprehension of appearance, which is engaged at the time of connection with the contradictory object.

original: gal te bsgrub par bya ba dngos po med par 'grub par 'gyur ba me'i rjes su dpag par chad mar ji ltar 'gyur te mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: gal te bsgrub par bya ba dngos po med par 'grub par 'gyur ba me'i rjes su dpag par chad mar ji ltar 'gyur te mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: If the object to be established is established as non-existent, how could there be an inference of fire? There could not be.

original: gal te gzhan rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur bas gzhan rnam pa gzhan du ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan rnam pa gzhan du 'gyur bas gzhan rnam pa gzhan du ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that since the other becomes different, how could the other become different?

original: rjes su dpag pa'i zhes gsungs te rtags kyi'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i zhes gsungs te rtags kyi'o //
translated: It is said of inference, meaning of the reason.

original: de nyid las zhes bya ba ni mngon sum nyid las so //
analyzed: de nyid las zhes bya ba ni mngon sum nyid las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that very‚Äù means from direct perception.

original: der zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: der zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThere‚Äù means

original: lkog tu gyur pa la'o //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa la'o //
translated: in the hidden.

original: lan ni lkog tu gyur pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lan ni lkog tu gyur pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is ‚ÄúThe non-apprehension of the hidden.‚Äù

original: 'jug pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'jug pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThat which is engaged‚Äù means

original: grang ba la sogs pa dgag par bya ba lkog tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: grang ba la sogs pa dgag par bya ba lkog tu gyur pa'o //
translated: the hidden object of negation, such as cold.

original: 'o na ni 'gal ba 'dzin pa'i dus na yod pa'i mi dmigs pa dran pa'i yul du gyur pa nyid med pa'i sgrub par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ni 'gal ba 'dzin pa'i dus na yod pa'i mi dmigs pa dran pa'i yul du gyur pa nyid med pa'i sgrub par byed pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúBut then, when there is apprehension of the contradictory, the non-apprehension that exists in the object of memory is the proof of nonexistence.‚Äù

original: zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni ci ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Anticipating this, he says, ‚ÄúWhy?‚Äù

original: 'di yang me'i rjes su dpag pa dang mtshungs pa yin no zhes lan 'debs pa ni de'i 'di yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di yang me'i rjes su dpag pa dang mtshungs pa yin no zhes lan 'debs pa ni de'i 'di yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is, ‚ÄúThis is also similar to the inference of fire.‚Äù

original: der yang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: der yang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThere‚Äù means

original: lkog tu gyur pa'i me la yang ngo //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa'i me la yang ngo //
translated: in the hidden fire.

original: 'o na ji ltar 'gal ba dmigs pa la sogs par mi dmigs pa las mi 'grub pa ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar 'gal ba dmigs pa la sogs par mi dmigs pa las mi 'grub pa ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúBut then, how is it that the non-apprehension of the contradictory and so on is not established?‚Äù

original: dogs pa bsu nas mjug sdud pa'i sgo nas mjug gi lugs brjod pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dogs pa bsu nas mjug sdud pa'i sgo nas mjug gi lugs brjod pa ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The conclusion is stated by way of anticipating an objection: ‚ÄúTherefore, . . .‚Äù

original: 'di las zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di las zhes bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom this‚Äù refers to what is about to be said.

original: de kho na'i don can zhes bya ba lung gi skad kyis ni don gyi de nyid brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de kho na'i don can zhes bya ba lung gi skad kyis ni don gyi de nyid brjod pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving the meaning of reality‚Äù is stated with the voice of scripture.

original: gang gi phyir 'gal ba 'dzin pa'i dus na me grang ba med pa dang 'brel pa ni dmigs pa brten pa des na me de grub pas grang ba'i reg pa med par grub pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'gal ba 'dzin pa'i dus na me grang ba med pa dang 'brel pa ni dmigs pa brten pa des na me de grub pas grang ba'i reg pa med par grub pa'o //
translated: When there is the apprehension of the contradictory, the connection of fire with the absence of cold is observed. By that, the existence of fire is established, and the absence of cold contact is established.

original: de lta na yang mi dmigs pa sgrub par byed par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang mi dmigs pa sgrub par byed par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Even so, how can non-apprehension be a proof?

original: med pa de yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: med pa de yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat absence . . .‚Äù

original: des na zhes bya ba ni gzhan la yin pas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni gzhan la yin pas na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause of that.‚Äù

original: mi dmigs pa nyid ces bya ba ni grang ba med pa'i rang bzhin dro ba'i reg pa'i ngo bo nyid de //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa nyid ces bya ba ni grang ba med pa'i rang bzhin dro ba'i reg pa'i ngo bo nyid de //
translated: ‚ÄúNon-apprehension itself‚Äù is the nature of the absence of cold, the essence of warm contact.

original: gal te gang gis dper 'gyur ba mngon @133a * //
analyzed: gal te gang gis dper 'gyur ba mngon @133a * //
translated: If it were the case that . . .

original: sum gyis grub pa'i mi dmigs par brjod pa yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: sum gyis grub pa'i mi dmigs par brjod pa yod dam zhe na /
translated: Is there a non-observation of the established that is based on three?

original: gang 'chad par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang 'chad par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is said that this will be explained.

original: gal te de lta na yang rjes su dpag pas grub pa yin no zhes bya bar ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang rjes su dpag pas grub pa yin no zhes bya bar ji ltar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: But if that is so, how can it be said that it is established by inference?

original: 'dir yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: Here, the word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is stated.

original: mngon sum rang nyid las zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon sum rang nyid las zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom direct perception itself‚Äù is an illustration.

original: 'o na rgyu 'gal ba dmigs par mi dmigs pa las dngos po med par ji ltar 'grub snyam na gang gi tshe zhes bya ba ni sla zhing 'bar ba'i gzugs can gyis so //
analyzed: 'o na rgyu 'gal ba dmigs par mi dmigs pa las dngos po med par ji ltar 'grub snyam na gang gi tshe zhes bya ba ni sla zhing 'bar ba'i gzugs can gyis so //
translated: But how is the non-existence of a thing established from the non-observation of the observation of a contradictory cause? When, it is said, the cause of cold, such as snow, is not observed, heat is inferred.

original: 'di nyid brjod pa ni de la tshogs pa gcig la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid brjod pa ni de la tshogs pa gcig la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is stated: ‚ÄúIn that case, in one collection . . .‚Äù

original: de yang ni dro ba'i reg pa'o //
analyzed: de yang ni dro ba'i reg pa'o //

original: de mi dmigs pa nyid ni zhes bya ba ni dro ba'i reg pa dmigs pa nyid na'o //
analyzed: de mi dmigs pa nyid ni zhes bya ba ni dro ba'i reg pa dmigs pa nyid na'o //
translated: The non-observation of that is the observation of the contact of heat.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar spu langs pa med par sgrub par byed pa'i rgyu nges na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar spu langs pa med par sgrub par byed pa'i rgyu nges na'o //

analyzed: dro ba'i reg pa grang ba med pa'i rang bzhin can bsgrub par bya ba la gzugs ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs yin la /
translated: In the proof of the warm touch that has the nature of the absence of cold, form is the effect reason.

original: spu langs pa med pa'i bsgrub par bya ba la grang ba med par ni rgyu mi dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: spu langs pa med pa'i bsgrub par bya ba la grang ba med par ni rgyu mi dmigs pa yin te /
translated: In the proof of the absence of horripilation, the absence of cold is the nonobservation of a cause,

original: de gnyis su langs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bsgrub par bya ba gcig la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis su langs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bsgrub par bya ba gcig la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because both of those are included in the single probandum that has the characteristic of the absence of horripilation.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba rtags can gzhan ma yin pas na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba rtags can gzhan ma yin pas na'o //

original: grang ba'i med pa'i rang bzhin can dro ba'i reg pa la ni gzugs 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs yin la /
analyzed: grang ba'i med pa'i rang bzhin can dro ba'i reg pa la ni gzugs 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs yin la /
translated: In the warm touch that has the nature of the absence of cold, form is the effect reason.üîΩIn the absence of its effect, the absence of cold is the nonobservation of a cause.

original: de'i 'bras bu med pa la grang ba med pa rgyu mi dmigs pa yin no zhes brjod par ni de'i phyir de ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu med pa la grang ba med pa rgyu mi dmigs pa yin no zhes brjod par ni de'i phyir de ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In order to state that, it says ‚Äútherefore, that.‚Äù

original: gang yang 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i mngon sum rjes su dpag pa nyid las rjes su dpag par grub pa na /
analyzed: gang yang 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i mngon sum rjes su dpag pa nyid las rjes su dpag par grub pa na /

original: rjes su dpag pa med par zlog par byed pa de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa med par zlog par byed pa de yang mi 'thad de /

original: mngon sum las rjes su dpag par bya ba tha dad par med pa yin na /
analyzed: mngon sum las rjes su dpag par bya ba tha dad par med pa yin na /
translated: If there is no difference between a perception and what is to be inferred,

original: de grub na rjes su dpag par bya ba nyid grub pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de grub na rjes su dpag par bya ba nyid grub pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: then when it is established, what is to be inferred is established.

original: gal te de lta na ni zhes bya ba nas rjes su dpag par dngos po'i yul can yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te de lta na ni zhes bya ba nas rjes su dpag par dngos po'i yul can yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: If that is so, then the object of a perception is an existent thing, and the object of an inference is an existent thing.

original: gal te dmigs pa yod na de'i tshe mi dmigs pa med par 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: gal te dmigs pa yod na de'i tshe mi dmigs pa med par 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: If there is an object, then at that time there is no non-apprehension.

original: mi dmigs pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The response to this qualm is, ‚ÄúNon-apprehension itself . . .‚Äù

original: yin mod ces bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: yin mod ces bya ba ni lan no //

original: mi dmigs pa nyid med pa yin par khas len na /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa nyid med pa yin par khas len na /
translated: If you accept that non-apprehension itself does not exist,üîΩthen it follows that the object of an inference does not exist.

original: mi dmigs pa las med par bsgrub bo zhes bya ba'i phyogs nyams par 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni mes zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa las med par bsgrub bo zhes bya ba'i phyogs nyams par 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni mes zhes bya ba'o //

original: mi dmigs pa las med pa tha dad pa ma yin na /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa las med pa tha dad pa ma yin na /
translated: If non-apprehension were not different from non-existence,

analyzed: gang zhig gang gis sgrub @133b ces lan 'debs pa ni me nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: then how could one prove the other?

original: 'on te yang me nyid ni grang ba med pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on te yang me nyid ni grang ba med pa ma yin gyi /
translated: But if fire is not non-cold,

original: 'on kyang de las gzhan yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'on kyang de las gzhan yin no snyam na /

original: dro bas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dro bas zhes bya ba'o //

original: me grang ba med pa'i rang bzhin yin na ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs nyid du 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: me grang ba med pa'i rang bzhin yin na ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs nyid du 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If fire were by nature not cold, then the reason would be the nature of the probandum.

original: mi dmigs pa ni zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The reply to the objection is ‚ÄúNon-apprehension.‚Äù

original: ji ltar dmigs pa las med pa nyid tha mi dad pa de bzhin du gzhan dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyi mi dmigs pa las kyang tha mi dad de des na tha snyad las mi rtogs pa'i bsgrub par bya ba ni /

translated: Just as non-existence is not different from apprehension, in the same way, non-apprehension, which is of the nature of the apprehension of something else, is also not different. Therefore, the probandum, which is not understood from convention,

analyzed: med do gang gi phyir grang ba med pa'i tha snyad bsgrub par bya ba las me rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin pa des na 'di na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNo, because the reason, fire, is the nature of the probandum, the absence of cold. Therefore, it is said, ‚Äòhere.‚Äô

analyzed: gang gi phyir ji snyed bsgrub par bya ba las me rang bzhin mi dmigs pa nyid dngos po med par bsgrub par bya ba yin pa de'i phyir mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba rang sgras brjod na yang ngo //
translated: Because the non-apprehension of fire, which is the nature of the probandum, is the means of establishing the non-existence of an entity, the probandum, therefore, it is said, ‚Äònon-apprehension.‚Äô

original: yang gi sgras ni 'gal ba dmigs par rang gi sgra ma yin pas brjod pa yang ngo //
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni 'gal ba dmigs par rang gi sgra ma yin pas brjod pa yang ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äòalso‚Äô indicates that even though it is expressed by its own word, the apprehension of an incompatible object is not.

original: kha cig na re yang sgra ni ma brjod na yang zhes bya ba yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re yang sgra ni ma brjod na yang zhes bya ba yin no zhe'o //
translated: Some say that the word ‚Äòalso‚Äô means ‚Äòeven though not expressed.‚Äô

analyzed: bshad par ni 'gal ba'i skabs yin pa'i phyir rang gi sgra ni de'i sgra la bya'o zhe'o //
translated: But it is said that because it is the context of incompatibility, its own word should be taken as the word for that.

original: rgol ba gang la gzhan dmigs pa'i rang bzhin ma dmigs pa mngon sum mam rjes su dpag pa las grub pa ni med pa'i tha snyad sgrub pa'i tshad mar mi 'dod kyi /
analyzed: rgol ba gang la gzhan dmigs pa'i rang bzhin ma dmigs pa mngon sum mam rjes su dpag pa las grub pa ni med pa'i tha snyad sgrub pa'i tshad mar mi 'dod kyi /

original: gang la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is what is said by ‚Äúto which.‚Äù

original: rnam kun zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba nye bar bstan pa'am /
analyzed: rnam kun zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba nye bar bstan pa'am /
translated: ‚Äú In every way‚Äù indicates the presentation of the contradiction.

original: tshad ma gzhan gyis kyang rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan gyis kyang rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or it is because it is suitable for another valid cognition.

original: da ni phyed phyi ma 'chad de gang la de zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: da ni phyed phyi ma 'chad de gang la de zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Now the latter half is explained: ‚Äúto which.‚Äù

original: gal te rnam pa gzhan du yang dgag pa rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rnam pa gzhan du yang dgag pa rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is understood that the negation is in some other way,
