analyzed: dpag pa la ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúin inference‚Äù is said.

original: des ni zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba dmigs pa nye bar bstan pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: des ni zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba dmigs pa nye bar bstan pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: ‚Äú By that‚Äù is by the method of presenting the observation of a contradiction.

original: dgag par bya ba de dang 'gal ba med pa la sogs pa'i don de'i 'bras bu du ba de brjod pa yang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: dgag par bya ba de dang 'gal ba med pa la sogs pa'i don de'i 'bras bu du ba de brjod pa yang bshad pa yin no //
translated: The expression of the effect of that object, such as the absence of the object to be negated, the presence of what is incompatible with it, and so forth, is also explained.

original: 'o na 'gal ba dmigs pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba ji ltar zhe na sbyor ba nyid ces gsungs so //
analyzed: 'o na 'gal ba dmigs pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba ji ltar zhe na sbyor ba nyid ces gsungs so //
translated: If one asks, ‚ÄúWhat is the division of the observation of the incompatible and so forth?‚Äù [The root text] declares, ‚Äújust the application.‚Äù

original: 'o na rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i nang du ji ltar 'du shes na /
analyzed: 'o na rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i nang du ji ltar 'du shes na /
translated: If one asks, ‚ÄúHow is the non-observation of the essential nature included in that?‚Äù

original: thams cad du ni zhes gsungs te rang bzhin 'gal la sogs pa dmigs par ro //üîΩgang gi phyir don de rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i @134a * //
analyzed: thams cad du ni zhes gsungs te rang bzhin 'gal la sogs pa dmigs par ro // gang gi phyir don de rang bzhin mi dmigs pa'i @134a * //
translated: [The root text] declares, ‚Äúin all cases,‚Äù that is, in the observation of the incompatible essential nature and so forth.

original: ngo bo nyid dang / bsgrub par bya bas gyur pa tha snyad kyi ngo bo nyid tha dad pa med pa des na khongs su 'dus pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang / bsgrub par bya bas gyur pa tha snyad kyi ngo bo nyid tha dad pa med pa des na khongs su 'dus pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because that object is of the nature of the non-observation of the essential nature, and the nature of the object to be established is not different, it is included in that. This is the meaning.

original: de la yang zhes bya ba na 'gal ba'i 'brel la yang ngo //
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba na 'gal ba'i 'brel la yang ngo //
translated: In that regard, ‚Äúand so forth‚Äù refers to the connection with the incompatible.

original: ji ltar rjes su dpag pa yin zhes dogs pa bsu ba na /
analyzed: ji ltar rjes su dpag pa yin zhes dogs pa bsu ba na /
translated: If one wonders, ‚ÄúHow is it an inference?‚Äù [The root text] declares,

original: des ni 'di ltar yin no zhes brjod pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des ni 'di ltar yin no zhes brjod pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is how it is is in this way.

original: sngar bshad tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni dro ba'i reg pa ni grang ba mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar bshad tshul gyis zhes bya ba ni dro ba'i reg pa ni grang ba mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the manner previously explained is because the nature of the contact of heat is the non-apprehension of cold.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba'i ste dro ba'i reg pa med pa'i rang bzhin ma yin na de'i tshe grang ba med pa mi 'grub pa zhig na 'grub pa yang yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba'i ste dro ba'i reg pa med pa'i rang bzhin ma yin na de'i tshe grang ba med pa mi 'grub pa zhig na 'grub pa yang yin te /
translated: Otherwise, in the absence of the nature of the contact of heat that is incompatible with it, at that time the non-existence of cold would not be established, but it is established.

original: des na 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa der yang brgyud pa kho nas grang ba la sogs pa med par 'grub pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa der yang brgyud pa kho nas grang ba la sogs pa med par 'grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, even in the case of the observation of the effect of the incompatible, the non-existence of cold, etc. is established there only through the medium.

original: dbu ba las zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: dbu ba las zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //
translated: From foam, etc. is explained.

original: du ba las rab tu 'grub pa grang ba'i reg pa med pa'i rang bzhin can me las de med pa'i tha snyad 'grub pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: du ba las rab tu 'grub pa grang ba'i reg pa med pa'i rang bzhin can me las de med pa'i tha snyad 'grub pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The establishment of smoke from fire, which has the nature of the absence of the contact of cold, is the establishment of the convention of its non-existence.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar thams cad la don tha mi dad pa des na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar thams cad la don tha mi dad pa des na'o //
translated: Because it is like that in all cases, the non-difference of the object.

original: ji ltar brjod pa'i mi dmigs pa dang bral ba'i sbyor ba la ni med pa 'grub pa med do zhes brjod pa ni 'gal ba dang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar brjod pa'i mi dmigs pa dang bral ba'i sbyor ba la ni med pa 'grub pa med do zhes brjod pa ni 'gal ba dang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: As for the argument that is free from the non-apprehension as has been described, there is no establishment of the non-existent, as has been said, ‚Äúthe contradictory is not established.‚Äù

original: 'gal ba ma grub par dgag pa bsgrub par bya ba la tshad mar smra ba gang yin pa de ni rigs pa'i rjes su 'brang ba can ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gal ba ma grub par dgag pa bsgrub par bya ba la tshad mar smra ba gang yin pa de ni rigs pa'i rjes su 'brang ba can ma yin no //
translated: He who maintains that the negation is a means of valid knowledge in the establishment of the non-existent, when the contradictory is not established, is not one who follows reasoning.

original: 'gal ba de yang thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa'i thabs dang 'di lhan cig tu 'jug pas thabs dang bcas par bkag par te bstan pa med par ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba de yang thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa nyid la sogs pa'i thabs dang 'di lhan cig tu 'jug pas thabs dang bcas par bkag par te bstan pa med par ro //
translated: And that contradiction is not taught, i.e., is not indicated, in the negation that is accompanied by a means, since it operates together with the means, i.e., the non-omniscience, etc.

original: dngos su 'gal ba med pa'i phyir na de'i rgyu'i sgo nas tshig dgag par bya ba dang 'gal ba ma bstan pa dgag pa brjod pa ni mi 'thad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos su 'gal ba med pa'i phyir na de'i rgyu'i sgo nas tshig dgag par bya ba dang 'gal ba ma bstan pa dgag pa brjod pa ni mi 'thad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since there is no contradiction in reality, it is not tenable to state the negation that is the object of negation, i.e., the non-teaching, as the negation of the means, i.e., the word, by way of its cause. This is the meaning.

original: ji skad brjod pa'i mi dmigs pa dang bral ba'i sbyor ba'i dpe brjod pa ni smra ba ni tshig go //
analyzed: ji skad brjod pa'i mi dmigs pa dang bral ba'i sbyor ba'i dpe brjod pa ni smra ba ni tshig go //
translated: As for the example of the argument that is free from the non-apprehension as has been described, the statement is the word.

original: de la sogs pa 'chi ba'i sems nyid la sogs pa gang yin pa des kun mkhyen dang / 'jig rten gzhan zhes bya ba mtshams sbyor ba la sogs pa 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: de la sogs pa 'chi ba'i sems nyid la sogs pa gang yin pa des kun mkhyen dang / 'jig rten gzhan zhes bya ba mtshams sbyor ba la sogs pa 'gog pa'o //
translated: The mind at the time of death and so on are the reasons. Omniscience and other worlds are the things to be refuted, such as the connection between actions and results.

original: de yang rnam pa gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir na 'gal ba sgrub pa las 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir na 'gal ba sgrub pa las 'gyur grang na /
translated: Moreover, since another mode is impossible, it would be an argument by contradiction.

original: smra ba nyid la sogs pa yod na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa med pa'am spang pas gnas par rtogs pa yang yod pa ma yin te dbang po las 'das pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: smra ba nyid la sogs pa yod na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la sogs pa med pa'am spang pas gnas par rtogs pa yang yod pa ma yin te dbang po las 'das pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: But when speech and so on exist, omniscience and so on do not exist or are abandoned. It is not understood that they exist because they are beyond the senses.

original: dbang po las 'das zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po las 'das zhes bya'o //
translated: This is stated in the line ‚ÄúBeyond the senses.‚Äù

original: skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du sgro @134b btags pas na /
analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du sgro @134b btags pas na /
translated: Since nonmomentariness is imputed to have the nature of blue and so on,

original: bltar rung ba yin pa'i skad cig smra ba nyid rang 'gal ba kho na'o zhes dogs pa'o //
analyzed: bltar rung ba yin pa'i skad cig smra ba nyid rang 'gal ba kho na'o zhes dogs pa'o //
translated: it is suitable to be seen. The statement that it is momentary is contradictory in itself.

original: tshig ni thams cad rig pa dang 'gal ba ma yin te /
analyzed: tshig ni thams cad rig pa dang 'gal ba ma yin te /
translated: All words are not contradictory to knowledge.

original: des na de bsgrub pas ni de med pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: des na de bsgrub pas ni de med pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the statement ‚Äúit is not non-existent because it is accomplished‚Äù

original: smra ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: smra ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is the statement ‚Äúspeech.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: dbang po las 'das zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dbang po las 'das zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúbeyond the senses.‚Äù

original: 'bras bus rgyu med par go bar byed pa yang mi 'thad do zhes brjod pa ni tshig ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bus rgyu med par go bar byed pa yang mi 'thad do zhes brjod pa ni tshig ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúit is not tenable that the effect is understood without a cause‚Äù is the statement ‚Äúwords.‚Äù

original: de med par ni shes pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de med par ni shes pa med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt‚Äù is the absence of consciousness.

original: gal te shes pa tsam dang ni mi 'gal gyi /
analyzed: gal te shes pa tsam dang ni mi 'gal gyi /
translated: If it is not contradictory with mere consciousness,

original: 'on kyang thams cad shes pa dang ngo zhes dogs pa ni thams cad shes pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang thams cad shes pa dang ngo zhes dogs pa ni thams cad shes pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then it is understood that ‚Äúall is consciousness.‚Äù

original: 'gal ba 'dzin pa'i tshad ma 'ga' yang med do zhes lan brjod pa ni gang gis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba 'dzin pa'i tshad ma 'ga' yang med do zhes lan brjod pa ni gang gis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response ‚Äúthere is no valid cognition that apprehends a contradiction‚Äù is the statement ‚Äúby what?‚Äù

original: gal te nyon mongs pa dang lam shin tu 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: gal te nyon mongs pa dang lam shin tu 'gal ba yin te /
translated: If afflictions and the path are a complete contradiction,

original: lam yod pa de 'og nas 'og tu 'grib pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam yod pa de 'og nas 'og tu 'grib pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then the path exists and it is said that the afflictions are gradually reduced.

original: de bzhin du rigs pa dang tshig dag kyang brtag par bya ba yin no zhes bya bar ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de bzhin du rigs pa dang tshig dag kyang brtag par bya ba yin no zhes bya bar ni mi 'thad de /
translated: In the same way, it is said that reasonings and words should be investigated.

original: rigs pa 'phel na tshig 'phel bas phyin ci log tu 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rigs pa 'phel na tshig 'phel bas phyin ci log tu 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because when reasoning increases, words increase, and so it is established as a mistake.

original: de la legs pa ci yod snyam na /
analyzed: de la legs pa ci yod snyam na /
translated: What is the good of that?

original: thams cad shes pa la zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: thams cad shes pa la zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúAll is known by the words.‚Äù

original: de ltar yin pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar yin pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: If that is so,

original: de ltar ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIn that way.‚Äù

original: tshig ni rigs pa'i rgyu can yin te /
analyzed: tshig ni rigs pa'i rgyu can yin te /
translated: Words have reasoning as their cause,

original: des 'phel na 'phel ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des 'phel na 'phel ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: because when it increases, they increase.

original: gal te thams cad rigs pa dan tshig gnyis lhan cig 'jug pa ma mthong ba'i phyir de dang smra ba 'gal ba yin no zhes dogs pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te thams cad rigs pa dan tshig gnyis lhan cig 'jug pa ma mthong ba'i phyir de dang smra ba 'gal ba yin no zhes dogs pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If all is so, then it is contradictory to say and to speak, because the two, saying and speaking, are not seen to occur together.üîΩIf that is so, then it follows that all is inferred to be delusion from the words.

original: de lta yin na tshig las thams cad rmongs pa nyid du rjes su dpog par thal lo zhes lan 'debs pa ni smra bas so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta yin na tshig las thams cad rmongs pa nyid du rjes su dpog par thal lo zhes lan 'debs pa ni smra bas so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The answer is, ‚ÄúBy speaking.‚Äù

original: mkhas pa mthong bas de rjes su dpog pa la gnod do zhes dogs pa ni smra ba'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa mthong bas de rjes su dpog pa la gnod do zhes dogs pa ni smra ba'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The objection is, ‚ÄúThe seeing of the wise contradicts the inference of that.‚ÄùüîΩThe answer is, ‚ÄúBy speaking.‚Äù

original: la ni de yang zhes bya ba ste thams cad rig pa yang ngo //
analyzed: la ni de yang zhes bya ba ste thams cad rig pa yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúAnd that‚Äù refers to the omniscience of the one who speaks.

original: gal te da lta thams cad rig pa dang smra ba gnyis lhan cig rigs pa med pa'i phyir na phyis ci ste mi 'gal zhe na /
analyzed: gal te da lta thams cad rig pa dang smra ba gnyis lhan cig rigs pa med pa'i phyir na phyis ci ste mi 'gal zhe na /
translated: If it is not logical for the omniscience of the one who speaks and the speech to exist simultaneously, why is it not contradictory for them to exist sequentially?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù means as follows.

original: 'gal ba'i sgrub byed de 'phel na 'grib pa nyid med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i sgrub byed de 'phel na 'grib pa nyid med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The point is that if the proof of the contradiction increases, then the contradiction itself does not decrease.

original: gal te de 'dra ba mi dmigs pa'i khyad par can gyi smra ba po nyid ni grang ba ma dmigs pa'i khyad par can gyi dro ba'i reg pa bzhin du 'gal ba kho na ma yin nam zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni de 'dra ba mi dmigs phyirüîΩzhe na zhes bya ba'o //üîΩ'o na mi dmigs @135a * //
analyzed: gal te de 'dra ba mi dmigs pa'i khyad par can gyi smra ba po nyid ni grang ba ma dmigs pa'i khyad par can gyi dro ba'i reg pa bzhin du 'gal ba kho na ma yin nam zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni de 'dra ba mi dmigs phyir zhe na zhes bya ba'o // 'o na mi dmigs @135a * //
translated: If you say that the mere speech of the one who speaks, which is qualified by the nonobservation of such, is a contradiction, just like the hot sensation that is qualified by the nonobservation of cold, then we reply: ‚ÄúIn that case, the mere nonobservation of the one who speaks is sufficient to establish the nonexistence of omniscience.üîΩWhat is the use of the speech of the one who speaks that is qualified by the nonobservation of such?‚Äù

original: pa de nyid thams cad rigs pa med par grub pa la brjod par bya ba'i de'i khyad par can gyi smra ba nyid kyis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: pa de nyid thams cad rigs pa med par grub pa la brjod par bya ba'i de'i khyad par can gyi smra ba nyid kyis ci zhig bya /
translated: If you say that the mere nonobservation of the one who speaks is sufficient to establish the nonexistence of omniscience, then what is the use of the speech of the one who speaks that is qualified by the nonobservation of such?üîΩIn that case, the mere nonobservation of the one who speaks is sufficient to establish the nonexistence of omniscience. What is the use of the speech of the one who speaks that is qualified by the nonobservation of such?

original: re zhig phyed snga ma 'chad pa ni dper na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: re zhig phyed snga ma 'chad pa ni dper na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The first half of the verse is explained by the example.üîΩ

original: de med kyang ni rmongs pa nyid med kyang ngo //
analyzed: de med kyang ni rmongs pa nyid med kyang ngo //
translated: The first half of the verse is explained as follows: ‚ÄúFor example, even though there is no delusion, there is no delusion, even though there is no delusion.

original: gang gi tshe zhe na mkhas pa'i dus su'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhe na mkhas pa'i dus su'o //
translated: When? At the time of the wise.

original: de bzhin du gal te zhes bya ba ni gnas su yang khyad par du gyur na zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te zhes bya ba ni gnas su yang khyad par du gyur na zhes 'brel to //
translated: In the same way, if there is a change in the place, there is a change in the place.

original: de'i tshe ci 'gal te ci yang mi 'gal lo zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: de'i tshe ci 'gal te ci yang mi 'gal lo zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: What is the contradiction at that time? There is no contradiction at all.

original: thams cad 'phel ba dang ni mi 'gal mod kyi 'on kyang thams cad rig pa dang 'gal ba yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni shin tu zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad 'phel ba dang ni mi 'gal mod kyi 'on kyang thams cad rig pa dang 'gal ba yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni shin tu zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Although there is no contradiction in the increase of everything, there is a contradiction with the knowledge of everything.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The answer is ‚ÄúNo.‚Äù

original: da ni phyed phyi ma 'chad de /
analyzed: da ni phyed phyi ma 'chad de /
translated: Now the second half of the verse is explained.

original: de lta bu'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that way‚Äù is explained as follows.

original: snang ba mi dmigs pa kho na go bar byed pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu ci yod snyam na /
analyzed: snang ba mi dmigs pa kho na go bar byed pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu ci yod snyam na /
translated: What is the reason for saying that non-apprehension of appearance alone is the revealer?

original: mi dmigs pa ni de lta bu zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni de lta bu zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The reason is stated: ‚ÄúNon-apprehension is like that.‚Äù

original: bltar rung ba'i khyad par dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: bltar rung ba'i khyad par dang bral ba'o //
translated: and it is devoid of the distinction of being visible.üîΩIf one does not ascertain nonexistence from the mere non-apprehension, then one would ascertain existence.

original: gal te mi dmigs pa tsam las med par mi nges na 'o na yod par nges par 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa bsu nas de'i phyir zhes gsungs so //üîΩres 'gal lkog tu gyur pa ni tshad ma dag gis yod pa'am /
analyzed: gal te mi dmigs pa tsam las med par mi nges na 'o na yod par nges par 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa bsu nas de'i phyir zhes gsungs so // res 'gal lkog tu gyur pa ni tshad ma dag gis yod pa'am /
translated: In response to this doubt, he says, ‚Äúbecause of that.‚Äù

original: med par nges pa yin no //
analyzed: med par nges pa yin no //
translated: Sometimes, the hidden is ascertained as existent or nonexistent by means of valid cognitions.

original: dbang po ni rtag tu lkog tu gyur pa yin yang don gyis go bas rtogs pa yin na thams cad mkhyen pa la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhes gzhan gyis khas blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang po ni rtag tu lkog tu gyur pa yin yang don gyis go bas rtogs pa yin na thams cad mkhyen pa la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhes gzhan gyis khas blangs pa yin no //
translated: Although the sense faculties are always hidden, one understands them by implication, but not omniscience and so on.

original: de ltar 'gal ba ma bsgrub par dgag ba brjod pa'i rigs pa'i rjes su 'brang ba can ma yin no zhes bya ba bshad pa nas /
analyzed: de ltar 'gal ba ma bsgrub par dgag ba brjod pa'i rigs pa'i rjes su 'brang ba can ma yin no zhes bya ba bshad pa nas /
translated: Thus, without establishing the contradiction, one should not follow the reasoning that expresses the negation.

original: de ni thabs bcas par zhes bya bar bshad pa'i don du thams cad rig pa gsal bar don thams cad mthong ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang 'gal ba yin la de'i 'bras bu tshig dang yang 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: de ni thabs bcas par zhes bya bar bshad pa'i don du thams cad rig pa gsal bar don thams cad mthong ba ni rnam par rtog pa dang 'gal ba yin la de'i 'bras bu tshig dang yang 'gal ba yin te /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúall‚Äù is that the Omniscient One sees all objects clearly, and that is incompatible with conceptualization. And the result of that is incompatible with words.üîΩTherefore, the result of incompatibility is speech.

original: des na smra ba nyid ni 'gal ba'i 'bras bu yin te zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni 'on te yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na smra ba nyid ni 'gal ba'i 'bras bu yin te zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni 'on te yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to that qualm is ‚ÄúBut if the Omniscient One‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: thams cad mkhyen pa zhes pa zhes bya ba ni gsal bar ro //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa zhes pa zhes bya ba ni gsal bar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThe Omniscient One‚Äù is clearly stated.

original: 'o na tshig ji ltar 'byung ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na tshig ji ltar 'byung ba yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, how do words arise?

original: snga ma dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snga ma dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is ‚ÄúFrom the former‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: smra ba po gzhan bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa yang rtogs pas 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: smra ba po gzhan bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa yang rtogs pas 'jug pa yin te /
translated: Just as there is another speaker, the Omniscient One also engages through realization.

original: ma brtags ma dpyad par ni tshig mi smra ba'o zhes lung las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma brtags ma dpyad par ni tshig mi smra ba'o zhes lung las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said in the scriptures, ‚ÄúWithout examination and analysis, words are not spoken.‚Äù

original: yang na de med kyang sngon gyi brjod par 'dod pa'i 'phan shugs yod pa des na gcig mi srid par ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba gnyis po 'di lhan cig brjod pas tshigs su bcad @135b pa gcig gis brjod pas ni don kun zhes bya ba'o //üîΩbrjod 'jug par gyur te /
analyzed: yang na de med kyang sngon gyi brjod par 'dod pa'i 'phan shugs yod pa des na gcig mi srid par ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba gnyis po 'di lhan cig brjod pas tshigs su bcad @135b pa gcig gis brjod pas ni don kun zhes bya ba'o // brjod 'jug par gyur te /
translated: By expressing both of these together, the verse says ‚Äúall meanings.‚Äù

original: goms pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni phyogs dang po la'o //
analyzed: goms pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni phyogs dang po la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of familiarity‚Äù means in the first position.

original: sngon gyi dus na yod pa'i brjod par 'dod pa goms pa las brjod 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni phyogs gnyis pa la'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi dus na yod pa'i brjod par 'dod pa goms pa las brjod 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni phyogs gnyis pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of the familiarity of the desire to speak that existed in the past‚Äù means in the second position.

original: de'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa de la rnam pa gnyis ka ltar yang tshig med par ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa de la rnam pa gnyis ka ltar yang tshig med par ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, how could that omniscience be without words in either case?

original: gal te mthong ba'i dus na rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar smra snyam na bsgoms stobs la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te mthong ba'i dus na rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar smra snyam na bsgoms stobs la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúHow can it speak because there is no conceptualization at the time of seeing?‚Äù ‚ÄúBecause of the power of meditation‚Äù is said.

original: bsgoms pa'i stobs la brten nas don dpag tu med pa'i rnam pa shin tu gsal bar mthong ba gang yin pa de dang dus mtshangs brjod par 'dod pa mi 'byung ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i stobs la brten nas don dpag tu med pa'i rnam pa shin tu gsal bar mthong ba gang yin pa de dang dus mtshangs brjod par 'dod pa mi 'byung ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that the object is not seen clearly in the form of an infinite number of aspects, but that the desire to speak does not occur simultaneously with the meditation.

original: 'di ga las snyam na /
analyzed: 'di ga las snyam na /
translated: Where is this taught?

original: nye bar gnas pa'i zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: nye bar gnas pa'i zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is taught in the line ‚Äúwhen it is present.‚Äù

original: ce de ltar 'ga' zhig tu mthong ba snyam du dogs pa bsu nas 'dir mthong ba kho na'o zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: ce de ltar 'ga' zhig tu mthong ba snyam du dogs pa bsu nas 'dir mthong ba kho na'o zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: In order to anticipate the doubt that one might see in some way, it is said here, ‚ÄúIt is seen only.‚Äù

original: yid gzhan du zhes bya ba'o //üîΩmthong ba gzhan yang brjod pa ni sngar goms pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yid gzhan du zhes bya ba'o // mthong ba gzhan yang brjod pa ni sngar goms pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The line ‚Äúwhen the mind is elsewhere‚Äù is stated.üîΩAnother kind of seeing is mentioned in the line ‚Äúwhen there is prior habituation.‚Äù

original: nye par gnas pa la zhes bya ba ni sngon la mthong ba dang po nyid nye bar gnas pa la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nye par gnas pa la zhes bya ba ni sngon la mthong ba dang po nyid nye bar gnas pa la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The line ‚Äúwhen it is present‚Äù means that the first seeing is present.

original: ji ltar 'dis 'di gsal ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dis 'di gsal ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that this clarifies it?

original: 'gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúbut‚Äù is used.

original: gzhan gyi 'gal ba gzhan te dper na grang ba dang me bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi 'gal ba gzhan te dper na grang ba dang me bzhin no //
translated: One contradiction is different from another, as for example, cold and fire.

original: gzhan gyis tha mi dad par sgro btags pa'i 'gal ba yang 'gal ba yin no zhes brjod pa ni tha mi dad la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis tha mi dad par sgro btags pa'i 'gal ba yang 'gal ba yin no zhes brjod pa ni tha mi dad la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The contradiction of superimposition, which is not different from the other, is also a contradiction.

original: 'gal ba gnyis po 'di nyid khyad par gyi mthar thug par byed pa ni kha ba med la zhes bya ba ste grang ba med pa'i //
analyzed: 'gal ba gnyis po 'di nyid khyad par gyi mthar thug par byed pa ni kha ba med la zhes bya ba ste grang ba med pa'i //
translated: This very contradiction is brought to its ultimate conclusion by ‚Äúwithout snow,‚Äù that is, without cold.

original: de dang tha mi dad par khas blangs pa'i skye ba la yod pa nyid gnod par byed pa yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de dang tha mi dad par khas blangs pa'i skye ba la yod pa nyid gnod par byed pa yin pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as the existence of arising, which is accepted as not different from that, is undermined.

original: ci tha dad pa med pa lhan cig mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba yod na zhes dogs na yod pa dang zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: ci tha dad pa med pa lhan cig mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba yod na zhes dogs na yod pa dang zhes gsungs te /
translated: If there is no difference, is there a contradiction of the characteristic of non-coexistence? He says ‚Äúexistence.‚Äù

original: yod pa dang skye ba dag ni 'gal ba yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: yod pa dang skye ba dag ni 'gal ba yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: Existence and arising are contradictory.

original: rnam pa ci 'dra bar zhe na phan tshul zhen pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam pa ci 'dra bar zhe na phan tshul zhen pa gsungs so //
translated: What kind of aspect? He says ‚Äúmutually exclusive.‚Äù

original: tha dad pa med pa ni yod pa dang skye ba dang khas blangs pa'i yul yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa ni yod pa dang skye ba dang khas blangs pa'i yul yin no //
translated: Non-difference is the object of existence, arising, and acceptance.

original: gzhan gyis khas blangs pa de nyid ston pa ni skye ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis khas blangs pa de nyid ston pa ni skye ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement of the opponent‚Äôs position is ‚Äúarising . . . ‚Äù

original: yod pa dang skye ba dag ni 'gal ba yang yin no //
analyzed: yod pa dang skye ba dag ni 'gal ba yang yin no //
translated: Existence and arising are contradictory.

original: 'gal ba nyid brjod pa ni yod pa nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba nyid brjod pa ni yod pa nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement of the contradiction is ‚ÄúExistence . . . ‚Äù

original: tha dad pa la 'gal ba nyid med par dogs pa bsu ba ni tha dad pa med pa dag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa la 'gal ba nyid med par dogs pa bsu ba ni tha dad pa med pa dag ces bya ba'o //
translated: The anticipation of the qualm that there is no contradiction in difference is ‚ÄúIf they were . . . ‚Äù

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni lan te grangs can gyis @136a * //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni lan te grangs can gyis @136a * //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe opponent . . . ‚Äù is the response, that is, the SƒÅ·πÉkhya‚Äôs response.

original: so ; /'gal ba'i rang bzhin ma rtogs pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: so ; /'gal ba'i rang bzhin ma rtogs pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The nonapprehension of the contradiction is ‚ÄúIf . . . ‚Äù

original: bzlog par bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: bzlog par bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The response is the reversal.

original: 'gal ba'i rang bzhin 'di nyid ston pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i rang bzhin 'di nyid ston pa ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The statement of the contradiction is ‚ÄúIn that case . . . ‚Äù

original: 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni rgyun gyis 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni rgyun gyis 'jug pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúArising‚Äù is the engagement of the continuum.

original: med par 'gyur ba ni de'i tshe de gnyis bzlog par bya ba dang zlog par byed pa yin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba de mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med par 'gyur ba ni de'i tshe de gnyis bzlog par bya ba dang zlog par byed pa yin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba de mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúNonexistence‚Äù is the seeing of the contradiction that has the characteristic of the reversal of those two.

original: gang la zhe na me dang grang ba'i bdag nyid la'o //
analyzed: gang la zhe na me dang grang ba'i bdag nyid la'o //
translated: because of the nature of fire and cold.

original: re zhig 'gal na 'di nyid rnam par spyod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: re zhig 'gal na 'di nyid rnam par spyod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If there is a contradiction, then this very analysis is stated: ‚ÄúIf, on the other hand, one maintains that things endure, then destruction is not tenable.‚Äù

original: skad cig ma'i phyogs la yang gzhan gyis gzhan 'jig pa ma yin pa zhes brjod pa ni skad ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma'i phyogs la yang gzhan gyis gzhan 'jig pa ma yin pa zhes brjod pa ni skad ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Even in the case of the theory of momentariness, it is said that ‚Äúdestruction does not occur through another.‚Äù

original: ma skyes pa la 'jig pa ji ltar mi 'thad snyam na ma skyes pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa la 'jig pa ji ltar mi 'thad snyam na ma skyes pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How is destruction not tenable in the case of what is not yet arisen? ‚ÄúWhat is not yet arisen does not endure.‚Äù

original: 'o na skyes pa la yang de ci ltar mi 'thad snyam na skyes pa yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'o na skyes pa la yang de ci ltar mi 'thad snyam na skyes pa yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: How is it not tenable in the case of what is arisen? ‚ÄúWhat is arisen does not endure.‚Äù

original: 'o na gzhan gyis dus gzhan du 'jig par byed do snyam du gzhan gyis dus su ni zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'o na gzhan gyis dus gzhan du 'jig par byed do snyam du gzhan gyis dus su ni zhes gsungs so //
translated: But it is thought that destruction is brought about by another at another time. ‚ÄúWhat is destroyed is not destroyed.‚Äù

original: de las zhes bya ba ni skad cig la'o //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni skad cig la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that‚Äù refers to a moment.

original: 'o na rgyun gzhan med mod //
analyzed: 'o na rgyun gzhan med mod //
translated: But there is no other continuum.

original: 'on kyang skad cig yod pa yin la de'i 'jig pa yang skad cig brgyud pa phyi ma'i gegs byas pa las gzhan ma yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te phyi ma'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang skad cig yod pa yin la de'i 'jig pa yang skad cig brgyud pa phyi ma'i gegs byas pa las gzhan ma yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni gal te phyi ma'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But it is feared that one might say, ‚ÄúThe existence of the moment is, and its cessation is nothing other than the prevention of the subsequent series of moments.‚Äù

original: rgyu yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs dag la rgyun gzhan gyis gegs byed pa ma yin no zhes lan brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs dag la rgyun gzhan gyis gegs byed pa ma yin no zhes lan brjod pa ni gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response to the position that the cause exists or does not exist is, ‚ÄúIf the cause exists, the effect does not exist.‚Äù

original: skad cig brgyud pa phyi ma'i rgyu yod na'o //
analyzed: skad cig brgyud pa phyi ma'i rgyu yod na'o //
translated: If the cause of the subsequent series of moments exists,

original: rgyu med pa la ni 'bras bu ma skyes pa 'gal bas byas pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu med pa la ni 'bras bu ma skyes pa 'gal bas byas pa yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: the effect does not exist, because it is contradictory for an effect to arise without a cause.

original: de ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúIf the cause does not exist, the effect does not exist.‚Äù

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o //üîΩgal te rgyu yod pa'am /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni 'chad pa'o // gal te rgyu yod pa'am /
translated: If the cause exists, the effect does not exist.üîΩIf the cause does not exist, the effect does not exist.

original: med pa la yang 'gal bas 'bras bu bzlog par mi nus na /
analyzed: med pa la yang 'gal bas 'bras bu bzlog par mi nus na /
translated: If the effect is not able to be stopped because it is contradictory for the cause to exist or not to exist,

original: 'o na 'gal bas rgyu ma tshang bar byas pa'i sgo nas 'bras bu 'gog par byed pa yin no zhes dogs pa ni /üîΩci ste 'gal bas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'o na 'gal bas rgyu ma tshang bar byas pa'i sgo nas 'bras bu 'gog par byed pa yin no zhes dogs pa ni /üîΩci ste 'gal bas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then it is feared that one might say, ‚ÄúWe stop the effect by making the cause incomplete because of contradiction.‚ÄùüîΩTherefore, it is said, ‚ÄúIf the cause is incomplete because of contradiction, the effect does not exist.‚Äù

original: rgyu med pas ni 'gal bas ma tshang bar byed srid de rang nyid kho na med pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni gal te med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu med pas ni 'gal bas ma tshang bar byed srid de rang nyid kho na med pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa ni gal te med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is causeless, it is possible that it would be incomplete due to contradiction, because it would not exist at all.

original: rang gi ngo bos yod pa la 'gal bas phyin ci log tu bya bar mi nus so zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos yod pa la 'gal bas phyin ci log tu bya bar mi nus so zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: If it is said that it is not possible to act in contradiction to that which exists by its very nature,

original: rang gi ngo bos zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos zhes bya ba'o //
translated: it is said, ‚Äúby its very nature.‚Äù

original: ji ltar byed de mi byed pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar byed de mi byed pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: How could it be done? It could not be done at all.

original: rgyu ma tshang ba med par yod na rgyu yang su dang yang 'gal ba ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni gal te de la zhes bya ste rgyu la'o //
analyzed: rgyu ma tshang ba med par yod na rgyu yang su dang yang 'gal ba ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni gal te de la zhes bya ste rgyu la'o //
translated: If it exists without a cause being incomplete, then the cause is not in contradiction with anything at all.

original: de ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: de ni rgyu'o //
translated: If it is said, ‚ÄúThat is the cause,‚Äù

original: gang gis @136b 'bras bu ldog par 'gyur ba ci ste de med par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis @136b 'bras bu ldog par 'gyur ba ci ste de med par 'gyur /
translated: then what is the cause of the cessation of the effect? How could it be nonexistent?

original: de med na yang 'gal ba ci yang yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de med na yang 'gal ba ci yang yod pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: Even if it is nonexistent, there is no contradiction at all.

original: 'on te ma tshang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te ma tshang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it is said, ‚ÄúBut if it is incomplete,‚Äù

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i bdag nyid do //
translated: then it is said, ‚ÄúThat is the nature of the cause.‚Äù

original: de ma thag pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed snga ma 'chad pa ni ma tshang ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed snga ma 'chad pa ni ma tshang ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The first half of the verse is the incomplete statement.

original: phyed phyi ma 'chad pa ni de'i rgyu zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyed phyi ma 'chad pa ni de'i rgyu zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The second half of the verse is the reason for that.

original: de'i phyir rnam par dpyad na ni 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni skabs kyi don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par dpyad na ni 'gal ba yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni skabs kyi don to //
translated: Therefore, when analyzed, there is no contradiction. This is the meaning of the context.

original: bsdad nas byed pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i khyad par nyid 'gal ba yin no zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
analyzed: bsdad nas byed pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i khyad par nyid 'gal ba yin no zhes lan 'debs pa ni /
translated: The response is that the difference between the cause and effect of the abiding and acting is contradictory.

original: me ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: me ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Fire is the subject.

original: gang la lhan cig byed pa med pa'i grang ba des ni grang ba gzhan skyed de /üîΩlhan cig byed pa med pa'i grang ba ni skyed par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang la lhan cig byed pa med pa'i grang ba des ni grang ba gzhan skyed de / lhan cig byed pa med pa'i grang ba ni skyed par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That which lacks a co-operating factor of cold produces another cold.üîΩThe meaning is that the cold that lacks a co-operating factor is the producer.

original: lhan cig byed dang zhes bya ba ni med dang ngo //
analyzed: lhan cig byed dang zhes bya ba ni med dang ngo //
translated: The co-operating factor is the cold.

original: de ni zhes bya ba grang ba'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba grang ba'o //
translated: That is the cold.

original: phyed phyi ma nyid rnam par 'brel pa ni grang ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyed phyi ma nyid rnam par 'brel pa ni grang ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The second half of the verse is connected with the cold.

original: grang ba'i reg pa snga ma ni me'i lhan cig byed pa nyid kyi phyir ci srid du gzhan pa dang ches gzhan pa la sogs pa'i grang ba'i reg pa nas skyed par byed pa nas grang ba'i reg pa gzhan skyed par byed pa ma yin pa de srid
analyzed: grang ba'i reg pa snga ma ni me'i lhan cig byed pa nyid kyi phyir ci srid du gzhan pa dang ches gzhan pa la sogs pa'i grang ba'i reg pa nas skyed par byed pa nas grang ba'i reg pa gzhan skyed par byed pa ma yin pa de srid
translated: The previous cold contact is the co-operating cause of fire, and as long as it generates another cold contact, more and more removed, it is not the generator of another cold contact.

original: kyi bar du 'gyur ro zhes ji srid gong du bton la de srid kyang khong nas phyung sde sbyar bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: kyi bar du 'gyur ro zhes ji srid gong du bton la de srid kyang khong nas phyung sde sbyar bar bya ba'o //
translated: As long as it is not the generator of another cold contact, it is cold contact.

original: de lta na yang gang gis 'gal bar 'gyur ba grang ba'i zlog par byed pa ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang gang gis 'gal bar 'gyur ba grang ba'i zlog par byed pa ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: But even so, how is it the opposite of cold, since it is not cold?

original: de zhes smos te skyed byed ma yin pa'i grang pa'i reg pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes smos te skyed byed ma yin pa'i grang pa'i reg pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to the cold contact that is not a generator.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni grang ba'i reg pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni grang ba'i reg pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Another‚Äù refers to cold contact.

original: gal te de'i rgyu nus pa med pas skyed pa las skyed byed nyid yin pa'i phyir ji ltar ldog par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de'i rgyu nus pa med pas skyed pa las skyed byed nyid yin pa'i phyir ji ltar ldog par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: If it is not a generator because its cause is ineffective, how is it the opposite of cold?

original: des byas pa zhes smos te /
analyzed: des byas pa zhes smos te /
translated: The word ‚Äúproduced‚Äù is stated.

original: me des byed pa grang pa'i reg pa'i de'i rgyu nus pa la med pa skye ba zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: me des byed pa grang pa'i reg pa'i de'i rgyu nus pa la med pa skye ba zhes bya bas so //
translated: That fire is said to generate the capacity for the contact of heat, which did not exist previously as a cause of that.

original: de la zhes bya ba nus pa med pa'i skad cig las so //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba nus pa med pa'i skad cig las so //
translated: In that regard, the moment of the absence of capacity is the cause of the moment of the presence of capacity.

original: ji lta bur gyur pa skye ba med pa zhe na snga na med pa'i mtshan nyid gang la yod pa de ste myu gu skye ba med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji lta bur gyur pa skye ba med pa zhe na snga na med pa'i mtshan nyid gang la yod pa de ste myu gu skye ba med pa bzhin no //
translated: How is that? It is the non-arising of what did not exist before, like the non-arising of a sprout.

original: gal te phyi ma'i skad cig ldog pa nyid des byas par ci khas mi len zhe na /
analyzed: gal te phyi ma'i skad cig ldog pa nyid des byas par ci khas mi len zhe na /
translated: If one does not accept that the cessation of the later moment is produced by that,

original: rgyu'i byed pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i byed pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then the function of the cause is not tenable.

original: de'i phyir nus pa med pa'i skad cig skyes pas me grang ba'i zlog par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir nus pa med pa'i skad cig skyes pas me grang ba'i zlog par byed pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the moment of the absence of capacity is produced by the fire, which prevents the contact of cold.

original: gzhan du ni mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes gnas so //
analyzed: gzhan du ni mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes gnas so //
translated: Otherwise, it is not tenable.

original: yang na sdod pa med par de'i khyad par 'gal ba yin no zhes brjod pa ni grang ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na sdod pa med par de'i khyad par 'gal ba yin no zhes brjod pa ni grang ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Or, the difference between them is contradictory, without abiding.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis so //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis so //
translated: By what? By its own nature.

original: gal te rang gi ngo bo de me nye ba kho na yin gyi gzhan gyi tshe ma yin no zhes bya ba gang las zhe na /üîΩdngos po @137a * //
analyzed: gal te rang gi ngo bo de me nye ba kho na yin gyi gzhan gyi tshe ma yin no zhes bya ba gang las zhe na / dngos po @137a * //
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúWhy is its own nature only near fire and not elsewhere?‚Äù

original: rnams kyi nus pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnams kyi nus pa ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is ‚ÄúThe power of things.‚Äù

original: 'gal ba dag tshogs pa mi srid par dogs pa ni 'gal ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba dag tshogs pa mi srid par dogs pa ni 'gal ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The doubt that the collection of opposites is impossible is ‚Äúopposites.‚Äù

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni lan te /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni lan te /
translated: The response is ‚ÄúThus,‚Äù

original: gcig la tshig pa nyid du gyur pa yin na'o //
analyzed: gcig la tshig pa nyid du gyur pa yin na'o //
translated: which is to say, ‚ÄúIf it were to become just that, the one,

original: gzhan du ni zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa yin par ro //
analyzed: gzhan du ni zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa yin par ro //
translated: then in another way, which is to say, in the collection,

original: sdod pa'i phyogs la ni me dang grang ba skad cig dang por tshogs pa gnyis mi 'gal lo zhes brjod pa ni skad cig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: sdod pa'i phyogs la ni me dang grang ba skad cig dang por tshogs pa gnyis mi 'gal lo zhes brjod pa ni skad cig ces bya ba'o //
translated: in the case of remaining in a place, the collection of fire and cold in the first moment is not contradictory.‚Äù

original: ji ltar 'di gnyis de'i tshe mi 'gal ba nges she na me zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'di gnyis de'i tshe mi 'gal ba nges she na me zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How is it ascertained that these two are not contradictory at that time?üîΩThe response is ‚ÄúFire.‚Äù

original: shin tu gsal ba'i snang ba dang mi nye bas mun pa dang kha ba dag 'jig pa kho nar byed do zhes dogs pa ni shin tu gsal ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shin tu gsal ba'i snang ba dang mi nye bas mun pa dang kha ba dag 'jig pa kho nar byed do zhes dogs pa ni shin tu gsal ba'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The doubt is ‚ÄúSince the very clear light and the cold are not near, darkness and snow are destroyed.‚Äù

analyzed: de nyid la zhes bya ba ni snang ba tshogs pa'i dus pa nyid la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that very same‚Äù means in the very same time when the appearance is assembled.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa dgag pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa dgag pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNo‚Äù is the refutation of the objection.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba shin tu gsal ba'i snang ba yod pa la yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that‚Äù means in the very same appearance that is very clear.

original: gsal ba'i de'i rgyu dang lhan cig pa'i mun pa ni'o //
analyzed: gsal ba'i de'i rgyu dang lhan cig pa'i mun pa ni'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe darkness that is together with the cause of that clarity‚Äù is the darkness that is together with the cause of the clarity.

analyzed: shin tu gsal ba'i mi dang snang ba nye ba na ni de 'dra ba'i rgyu dang lhan cig pa ni mun pa dang kha ba'i rgyu nyid ma yin no //
translated: When the very clear appearance is near, the darkness that is together with such a cause is not the cause of the darkness.

original: yes zin pa sel ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yes zin pa sel ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it does not remove what has already been removed.

original: skyes zin pa nyid bzlog pa yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /
analyzed: skyes zin pa nyid bzlog pa yin no zhes dogs pa bsu ba ni /
translated: The anticipation of the doubt, ‚ÄúIt is the reversal of what has already arisen,‚Äù is

original: de nyid ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThat very‚Äù is

analyzed: snang ba'i rgyu dang lhan cig pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: what is together with the cause of the appearance.

original: lan ni de nyid zhig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lan ni de nyid zhig pa ma yin no //

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: snang ba'i rgyu dang lhan cig pa'i mun pa de ni'o //
analyzed: snang ba'i rgyu dang lhan cig pa'i mun pa de ni'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe darkness that is together with the cause of the appearance‚Äù is

analyzed: skyes kyang de nyid mi 'dzin pa de ltar zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not so,

original: rang bzhin gang gis zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gang gis zhes gsungs so //

analyzed: snang ba'i yul can ni ma skyes pa nyid kyis 'jig pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pa ni /

original: rang bzhin gang du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gang du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy what nature?‚Äù

analyzed: gang gi phyir skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dang 'jig pa ma yin pa de'i phyir de nyid ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because it is not arisen, not arisen, and not destroyed, therefore it is said, ‚ÄúThat itself.‚Äù

original: mthong ba nyid de zhig pa yin par dogs pa ni /
analyzed: mthong ba nyid de zhig pa yin par dogs pa ni /
translated: The doubt that seeing itself is destroyed is

original: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf‚Äù means:üîΩ

translated: When there is no seeing, at that time, because it is not realized, how is the cognition of that, called ‚Äúthat,‚Äù the ultimate? The reply is, ‚ÄúIn the state of destruction.‚Äù

analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa chod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause‚Äù and so on is the response.

analyzed: ma yin @137b kyang zhig go zhes bya bar tha snyad byed pa ni ma yin no // 'on te khyad par can gyi ma dmigs pa zhig pa yin pa des na /

translated: The pot that has gone to another place.

original: gang du mthong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: gang du mthong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtsod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhere it is seen‚Äù and so on is the objection.

original: de nyid kyi tshe ni mthong ba nyid kyi tshe /
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshe ni mthong ba nyid kyi tshe /
translated: ‚ÄúAt that time‚Äù is the time when it is seen.

original: de nyid kyi tshe zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshe zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: ‚ÄúAt that time‚Äù is the response.

original: 'gal ba nyid spong ba'i dogs pa bsu ba ni de ma thag pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba nyid spong ba'i dogs pa bsu ba ni de ma thag pa'i zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The anticipation of the objection that it is contradictory is ‚Äúthe immediately preceding . . . ‚Äù

original: sngar dmigs pa de'i yod pa ma dmigs pa ni zhig pa yin pa des na mi 'gal lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sngar dmigs pa de'i yod pa ma dmigs pa ni zhig pa yin pa des na mi 'gal lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no contradiction, since the non-apprehension of the existence of that object previously is its destruction.

original: bar du zhes bya ba ni lan no //
analyzed: bar du zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is a reply.

original: ji ltar de ma thag par yul gzhan du ma dmigs par zhig pa de bzhin du par du mchod par yul gzhan du mi dmigs pa ji ltar zhig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar de ma thag par yul gzhan du ma dmigs par zhig pa de bzhin du par du mchod par yul gzhan du mi dmigs pa ji ltar zhig pa ma yin te /
translated: Just as it is destroyed by not being apprehended in another place immediately after it is seen, so also it is destroyed by not being apprehended in another place later on.

original: rigs pa mtshungs pa'i phyir zhig pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rigs pa mtshungs pa'i phyir zhig pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: How can it not be destroyed? The meaning is that it is destroyed, because the reasoning is the same.

original: gal te yul gzhan du mi dmigs pa ni de nyid kyi tshe yul gzhan na yod pa ma yin gyi dus gzhan na yod pa ni de nyid kyi tshe dus gzhan na yod pa ma yin no zhes dogs pa dus gzhan zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te yul gzhan du mi dmigs pa ni de nyid kyi tshe yul gzhan na yod pa ma yin gyi dus gzhan na yod pa ni de nyid kyi tshe dus gzhan na yod pa ma yin no zhes dogs pa dus gzhan zhes gsungs so //
translated: If it is doubted that not being apprehended in another place is not being in another place at that time, and not being in another time is not being in another time at that time, he says ‚Äúanother time.‚Äù

original: gang zhig sngar mthong ba la sogs pa'i dus gzhan du ma mthong ba de gal te zhig pa yin na de'i tshe yul du ma mthong ba ci ste zhig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig sngar mthong ba la sogs pa'i dus gzhan du ma mthong ba de gal te zhig pa yin na de'i tshe yul du ma mthong ba ci ste zhig pa ma yin no //
translated: If that which is not seen at another time, such as previously when it was seen, is destroyed, then why is that which is not seen in another place not destroyed?

original: 'on te yul khyab pa'i don gzhan du mthong ba ni gzhan dum mthong ba las 'jig par 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: 'on te yul khyab pa'i don gzhan du mthong ba ni gzhan dum mthong ba las 'jig par 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: But if it is seen as another object that pervades the place, then it would be destroyed by seeing it as another.

original: de khyad par ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de khyad par ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But there is no difference between them at all.üîΩTherefore, how could it be destroyed by seeing it as another when it is not seen as another?

original: des na gzhan du mthong ba gzhan du ma mthong bas zhig par ji ltar 'gyur snyam du dogs pa ni yul gzhan khyab pa zhes bya ba ste bum pa'o //
analyzed: des na gzhan du mthong ba gzhan du ma mthong bas zhig par ji ltar 'gyur snyam du dogs pa ni yul gzhan khyab pa zhes bya ba ste bum pa'o //
translated: The response to this doubt is ‚ÄúThe pervader of another place.‚Äù

original: dus gzhan la ni ji ltar yod ces bya ba ni lan te /
analyzed: dus gzhan la ni ji ltar yod ces bya ba ni lan te /
translated: The response to ‚ÄúHow could it exist at another time?‚Äù is ‚ÄúJust as it does in another place.‚Äù

original: yul gzhan bzhin du dus gzhan khyab pa yang 'ga' dang yod pa ma yin na de ji ltar dus gzhan du mthong ba dus gzhan du zhig pa yin /
analyzed: yul gzhan bzhin du dus gzhan khyab pa yang 'ga' dang yod pa ma yin na de ji ltar dus gzhan du mthong ba dus gzhan du zhig pa yin /
translated: If the pervader of another time does not exist in the same way as the pervader of another place, then how could it be seen at another time when it is destroyed at another time?

translated: The response to ‚ÄúIf it is seen at another time‚Äù is ‚ÄúIt is not destroyed.‚ÄùüîΩThe response to ‚ÄúHow could it be seen at another time?‚Äù is ‚ÄúIt is not destroyed.‚ÄùüîΩThe response to ‚ÄúHow could it be seen at another time?‚Äù is ‚ÄúIt is not destroyed.‚ÄùüîΩThe response to ‚ÄúHow could it be seen at another time?‚Äù is ‚ÄúIt is not destroyed.‚Äù

analyzed: yul gzhan bzhin du zhes bya ba ni lan no //
translated: The response to ‚ÄúHow could it be seen at another time?‚Äù is ‚ÄúIt is not destroyed.‚ÄùüîΩThe response to ‚ÄúHow could it be seen at another time?‚Äù is ‚ÄúIt is not destroyed.‚ÄùüîΩThe response to ‚ÄúHow could it be seen at another time?‚Äù is ‚ÄúIt is not destroyed.‚ÄùüîΩThe response to ‚ÄúHow could it be seen at another time?‚Äù is ‚ÄúIt is not destroyed.‚ÄùüîΩThe response to ‚ÄúHow could it be seen at another time?‚Äù is ‚ÄúIt is not destroyed.‚ÄùüîΩThe response to ‚ÄúHow could it be seen at another time?‚Äù is ‚ÄúIt is not destroyed.‚ÄùüîΩThe response to ‚ÄúHow could it be seen at another time?‚Äù is ‚ÄúIt is not destroyed.‚ÄùüîΩThe response to ‚ÄúHow could it be seen at another time?‚Äù is ‚ÄúIt is not destroyed.‚ÄùüîΩThe response to ‚ÄúHow could it be seen at another time?‚Äù is ‚ÄúIt is not destroyed.‚ÄùüîΩThe response to ‚ÄúHow could it be seen at another time?‚Äù is ‚ÄúIt is not destroyed.‚ÄùüîΩThe response to ‚ÄúHow could it be seen at another time?‚Äù is ‚ÄúIt is not destroyed.‚ÄùüîΩThe response to ‚ÄúHow could it be seen at another time?‚Äù is ‚ÄúIt is not destroyed.‚ÄùüîΩThe response to ‚ÄúHow could it be seen at another time?‚Äù is ‚ÄúIt is not destroyed.‚Äù

original: dus gzhan du zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
analyzed: dus gzhan du zhes bya ba ni dogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAt another time‚Äù means ‚Äúat a later time.‚Äù

analyzed: ma dmigs pa 'di ni yul dang dus gnyis ka la yang mtshungs pa'o //

analyzed: de lta nyid yin zhes bya ba ni ma khyab pa nyid do //

original: @138a * // gzhan du min te byas pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: @138a * // gzhan du min te byas pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúNot otherwise‚Äù means ‚Äúnot because of being produced.‚Äù

original: dpe gsungs pa ni sngon po nyid du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dpe gsungs pa ni sngon po nyid du zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: des na de nyid ces bya ba ni skabs nye bar sdud pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore, that itself‚Äù is the summary of the context.

analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni mun pa dang grangs la sogs pa'i skad cig go //

original: ci ste mi skye zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste mi skye zhe na /
translated: If it is asked why it does not arise,

original: rgyu med pas so //
analyzed: rgyu med pas so //
translated: it is because there is no cause.

original: des na sus kyang su yang gzhig pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang 'di ni tha snyad tsam yin no zhes mjug sdud pa de ma mthong ba na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na sus kyang su yang gzhig pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang 'di ni tha snyad tsam yin no zhes mjug sdud pa de ma mthong ba na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, no one is destroyed by anyone, but this is merely a convention. The summary is stated: ‚ÄúIf that is not seen.‚Äù

original: yul de lta bu zhes bya ba ni rgyu med pas ma skyes pa'i yul la'o //
analyzed: yul de lta bu zhes bya ba ni rgyu med pas ma skyes pa'i yul la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSuch an object‚Äù is an unproduced object because it is causeless.

original: 'o na de kho na nyid 'gal ba ci 'dra ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de kho na nyid 'gal ba ci 'dra ba yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is the contradiction in reality?

original: don dam par ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don dam par ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Ultimately‚Äù is the expression.

original: grang bas grang ba gzhan skyes pa ni me dang lhan cig skyes pa'i skyed par mi nus pas ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i khyad par nyid 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: grang bas grang ba gzhan skyes pa ni me dang lhan cig skyes pa'i skyed par mi nus pas ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i khyad par nyid 'gal ba yin no //
translated: Since cold cannot produce another cold that is produced simultaneously with fire, the distinction of cause and effect is contradictory.

original: 'on phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i 'gal ba tshul ji lar yin zhes na /
analyzed: 'on phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i 'gal ba tshul ji lar yin zhes na /

original: de yang tshul 'di las 'da' ba yin no zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: de yang tshul 'di las 'da' ba yin no zhes brjod pa ni /

original: phan tshun zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phan tshun zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Mutual‚Äù is the expression.

original: me dang lhan cig pa'i grang bas grang ba gzhan mi skyed pa bzhin du skad cig ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba brtag pa'i rang bzhin skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: me dang lhan cig pa'i grang bas grang ba gzhan mi skyed pa bzhin du skad cig ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba brtag pa'i rang bzhin skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Just as cold cannot produce another cold simultaneously with fire, the nature of analysis is not a producer that is free from the nature of momentariness.

original: 'dir brjod pa ni skad cig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir brjod pa ni skad cig ces bya ba'o //
translated: Here, ‚Äúmomentary‚Äù is the expression.
